description:
I loved it! Great happy hour wines & snacks. The truffle popcorn was sooo good. Truffle mac & cheese also delish. 

I like the art and movie projected onto the wall. Solid happy hour spot.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Happy hour til 7 makes me happy.

Stumbled upon this place and I couldn't be happier. Staff were super friendly, plenty of seating still available, and good snacks and drinks!

Ordered their house red along with the Mac n cheese and popcorn. 

Mac n cheese was a tad runny otherwise the noodles were cooked well and had good flavor. Just too soupy for my liking. Popcorn was good but nothing special about it.

Place had a great vibe to it. Relaxed but not dead, good atmosphere and good place to bring a date for a low key evening.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Yay for later hh times! Friend and I were at The Dorian, and their hh ended at 6? Maybe 630? So we were looking for another, and Nectar Wine Lounge was right around the corner!

Super cute wine me down spot on a Friday night, w hh ending at 7. We got in right around 645, and there was plenty of open seats to snag up. Sat at the bar top and the owner/bartender was very friendly. 

Although we weren't that hungry, we saw truffle popcorn, and just had to! Plus, the mac n cheese. Bacon on the side. He laughed at us when I said no bacon and my friend screamed yes, bacon! On the side. Eye roll at me. Haha. Mac n cheese was watery looking at first, but def tasted a whole lot better than it looked! As for the popcorn, it was a bit stale, with little truffle taste (tbh, still prefer the bar popcorn at The Evil Eye in outer mission). 

As for the drinks, friend went w a Pinot. Not typically a red person myself, but it was great. Full bodied, w tons of flavor. As for me, I got the vermentino. LOVE a great vermentino, and haven't been able to find a great one since leaving Italy...but this one they have here has to be one of the best ones I've had back in the states! Believe the owner/bartender told me this one they had in stock was from the South of France. 

All in all, a great experience. One notch down for the popcorn, but a def return spot when I'm in the area. 4 stars!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
My wife and I stopped by here before dinner at Maybeck's with some friends.  We liked the friendly vibe we got when we walked it.  The place is a decent size and there were quite a few people but it didn't seem packed or crowded at all.  We got a seat along the wall towards the bar and the staff was very attentive.  I got a glass of the Tempranillo and it was very tasty.

Looking for a low-key wine bar?  Nectar Wine Lounge is your place.
author: Blake B.

description:
I LOVE this place - I'm in the wine business and in my opinion, there isn't a better wine bar in the U.S. than Nectar Wine Lounge. The owners and staff pick excellent wines for all palates and they will ask you questions about what you like or have liked in the past to make their recommendations. 

Chris, Leila, and staff cool-guy Jack will give you something that you like or with me they challenged me - opened me up to new and exciting wines that I hadn't tried or had a firm opinion against. Specifically, they don't only buy wines they like but pick for everyone's palate - this is what makes an Award Winning Wine list. I've been given several Grand Awards and their list is on par with those lists - cover the spectrum. Everything I tasted was well structured and beautiful. 

I've been here a few times and absolutely LOVE, LOVE, LOVED it!! Pardon me but I was too lazy to write a proper review last time. My good friend Bob turned me on to these guys and he's a Wine Bar specialist. This last time we came over after dinner and tasted some really beautiful wines - both white, and red. 

I've been anti-German/NZ Pinot forever and Chris brought out a bottle of German Pinot Noir that was excellent. I might say this is one of the rare German Pinot's that taste this good. As an expert in his business - he explained to me that the owner started these wines from Northern Burgundy (Best Pinot's in the world) graftings - so he took root stock from the Cote de Nuit area of France and drove them to his winery house in Germany and grew them and is now making amazing wines. 

Chris and Leila also turned me onto a Cremant (like a Champagne) that I'm absolutely in love with and can't get enough. I'm not big on sparkling wines unless they're the best - and for a small price this is in that category for me. Pictures attached of these wines that I highly recommend to anyone that love complex tasty wines. Also have a menu for snacks, cheese, and charcuterie or salumi as some say. 

Go and talk to them - they all know their product really well and will expand your palate or give you exactly what you want to make your evening...........or day if you're a daytime drinker.
author: Rew C.

description: Three of us hit up Nectar Wine Lounge last night and it was fantastic. Tried 3 flights, had a super yummy & fresh dinner (salad with perfectly ripe stone fruit, charcuterie of course, burrata & ridiculously good truffled mac & cheese) and walked out with some very reasonably priced old world wines. A super experience made even better by great conversation with owner/somm Chris and his wife Leah. Perfectly relaxed vibe. Will definitely be back!
author: Kristen G.

description:
On my gosh!!!   This banana bread slightly toasted laced in caramel and chocolate sprinkled with walnuts and slightly chilled with a scoop of vanilla ice cream 

The veggie polenta was very savory!

Great ambiance and very intimate!!!

Update:   I'm stuck!
author: Stacy B.

description: Nectar has amazing wine, food, and the best staff. I wouldn't go anywhere else. Their food selection is fresh, seasonal, and inventive. It never disappoints. The wine selection is superb and they go above and beyond in everything they do. I recommend the burrata and the truffle popcorn....but seriously, everything is to die for and a must try!
author: Jen R.

description:
I'd been wanting to try Nectar for awhile and finally stopped in for dinner while doing some shopping. We were seated right away on a Saturday night which is better than most restaurants in the area. 

We enjoyed the nice ambience while perusing their extensive but approachable wine menu. What's nice is that you can order a half pour so we were able to each try a few different wines throughout the meal. As far as food we got the bacon-wrapped dates, butternut squash flatbread, and truffle mac and cheese - all of which I would recommend. Overall, I'd be happy to find myself back here!
author: Kevin S.

description:
I rarely venture out to this neighborhood because everything's pricier than I'm used to but my friends and I somehow ended up here on a Friday evening after food trucks at Off the Grid. Despite my love of wine, I haven't been to many wine bars, but I really liked the atmosphere of this place. Candles light up each table and it's quiet enough that you can hold an easy conversation. They also had a movie projected onto the wall, although they were playing Jaws which didn't seem to fit the ambiance very well LOL.

I got the bad ass red flight, which was 3 3oz glasses for $18 - seemed pretty pricey (at least compared to beer flights) but then again wine is usually not cheap anyways. The Italian and French wines had similarly tart flavors, while the Spanish one was sweeter and fruitier which I liked better. My friend who ordered the bubbly flight enjoyed that, and there were also pinot noir and white wine flights.

It wasn't super crowded when we went around 930pm, so this seems like a nice place to go if you're looking for a chill night. With happy hour 5-7pm and 30% off select wines on Monday, as well as a short food menu, I will definitely be back to try out the rest of the menu!
author: KC W.

description:
05.14.16 etc.

Always a chill experience hanging out at Nectar. Great place to chill pre-dinner, for dinner, or post-dinner.

Total damage for two glasses of wine: $30.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I called around to several wine bars in the city and it was surprising that nobody cared to help me out with a reservation. Finding Nectar Wine Lounge was amazing for me. Leia promptly called me back and gave me the details. I got my reservation no fuss no muss! She even called the day before to confirm with me. 

They were able to pull together a few tables to fit our party (16+ girls). Great place and low key for some wine and bites! Also, I chose this place because they have a huge variety of wine flights and wine in general. Leia knows a lot about their wines and gave good recommendations. 

The food here is phenomenal too! My favorites were the burrata, garden flatbread, and the truffle mac n cheese.
author: Cindy K.

description:
Perfect place for a Friday night date night! We came here for a glass of wine while we were waiting for our reservation at a different restaurant. The wine was great and the food smelled delicious, so we ended up cancelling our reservation to stay at Nectar. 

I love the dim lighting and energetic music (though not too loud!). 

The wine selection was excellent and, for those truffle lovers out there, there are plenty of truffle dishes to choose from. Yum!

My only complaint is they aren't open in the earlier! It would be a fun place to go early in the afternoon on the weekend.
author: Emmy Q.

description: Laid back and classy place in the Marina. It's a nice place to grab a glass of wine, order some appetizers and have great conversation. The music is also spot on-- R&B hits from the 90s. This will become a new Marina staple for us.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Met for after dinner drinks in the Marina district. Not too crowded but busy enough to have a fun atmosphere. Wonderful selection of wines. I went with a Pinot Noir flight (France, Germany, Oregon). Definitely France. Very nice small plate food pairings. Cheeses, nuts, meat with spicy grape salsa, honey, jams. Flat bread topped with prosciutto and other delectables. The owner Chris was friendly and very accommodating. Checked on how we were doing a couple of times. Our bar tender/waiter Jack was quite knowledgeable about wines and made several good suggestions. Friendly place with a good vibe. Everyone in our party left happy.
author: Sheri B.

description:
Friday night well spent!  Very pleased with the ambiance.  Romantic lighting but still a place to bring a group of friends.

I love the background music!  Very different from any usual bar.  They'd play a Hiphop song like Jay-Z's Big Pimpin', but the sound of their audio made it so you don't necessarily here the rapping but just the beat.

I like how you can choose if you want a 3oz or 6oz glass of wine.  Since I'm not a big drinker, I'll get the 3oz next time (also cheaper).  Took me forever to finish the 6oz.

I ordered the truffled Mac n cheese and will not be ordering it again!  Tasted more oily than cheesy.  Next time I'll be sure to try the truffle popcorn everyone raves about and their meat and cheese platter.
author: Brittany W.

description:
Great selection of wine, authentic and deeply human staff that treat people like best friends. It's pretty awesome. Happy hour is great here, and you will want to order a few things. The polenta is amazing, and a friend of mine swears by the mac and cheese. Small plates so you don't get stuffed... it's a perfect food/wine pairing in size of dish and flavor. 

Best place to get wine in the Marina.
author: Kate B.

description:
There's a reason this place has been in business for such a long time.... it's a nice atmosphere, great wine list, perfect for first dates.  I should know.  

Gee, that probably sounds like I'm annoyed and I don't mean it like that.... it really is a great date spot!!  You can easily hear the other person, they do offer food if the date is going well, open late.... never that crowded.
author: Chloe M.

description: Best wine bar in town! Our waitress treated us like royalty. We felt like guests in her home. Leah was such amazing hostess and the bartender Chris was so sweet and welcoming. One visit and it is now our go to spot. Thank you for making a special ladies night extra special
author: Melissa L.

description: I dig this place. It's not the most hopping spot in the Marina, but the service and scene were totally my cup of tea (or wine). I met a few friends at Nectar and was the first to arrive. The server got to me quickly, and when I told him I'd prefer to wait for my friends to arrive to order, he pitched me just the right amount of attitude to adore him from the start. A quick review of the menu (I enjoyed the "Anything But Chard" flight -- half price on Monday nights!) indicated that his level of snark was spot on for the environs. Kung fu movies playing on the wall and an 80s soundtrack, plus delicious bacon-wrapped dates to snack were spot on. I'm a Berkeley girl who secretly enjoys outings to the Marina and I could absolutely imagine this becoming my go-to spot to meet up with friends after work when I'm in the city.
author: Erin P.

description: Very cozy wine bar that is perfect for pre- or post- dinner drinks and snacks.  I came on a Friday night around 5 PM and was surprised at how empty it was (not a problem for me) given that they actually have decent happy hour specials (rare in SF). I ordered a few different glasses of wine (pinot noir, blend that I cant remember) and some olives to snack on before dinner.  The staff were all extremely accommodating and had wonderful recommendations.  I highly recommend if you're in the marina area and want a chill place to hang out and drink some delicious wine.
author: Raina D.

description: Nothing alone deserved a 2 star rating, but combined it was definitely not worth anything more than 2 stars. My wife and I both ordered wine flights (one red one white). The wine was average and a couple glasses actually off-putting. Service was mediocre, you really didn't feel important. The bad service was especially surprising because we were practically the only people there which made for a really underwhelming atmosphere (on a Friday evening at 9). To top things off, the two wine flights added up to nearly $50 with tip for below average wine, service, and atmosphere.
author: Corey B.

description:
Randomly found this spot on a Sunday evening: pretty empty and dark, I decided to give it a try because of the truffle Mac&Cheese spotted on the menu. 

It was a great find! 5 stars for the waiter, Jack, who was the coolest!

Got the two types of flatbreads, the Mac&Cheese and the olives ( all from the happy hour menu ) and they were all great.

Definitely worth it and a lot of the wine selection is 30% off from 5 to 7 everyday. Go!
author: Carole P.

description:
Fantastic. 

Got a couple flights, per usual the first part of the wine was less than great, but the flight got better as it progressed. The badass flight, and the pinot flight were quite good.

Dat food doe... 

Burrata - Meaty, manly, texture from radishes, salty from prosciutto, creamy, rich, dense, and a nice ample portion.

Ahi Tartar - One of the best I've had? Again, deceivingly ample portion. Great texture, very high quality ahi, perfect balance of acid, sweetness, it was SO good.

Squash flatbread - could have skipped it. The two appetizers were plenty for my date and I. It was decent though. Needed some acid to break up the richness. A balsamic drizzle or some onions would have been perfect.

The wine guy is a bit bro-y, but when it came down to it he knew his stuff, made some great recommendations, and he was concise and very friendly. 

Great experience.

2 flights, 2 glasses of wine, 1 flat bread, ahi tartar, burrata = $125. A bit pricy, but I'd say its worth it!
author: Peter T.

description: Already been to Nectar Wine Lounge twice. Will repeat! Awesome cheese selection! Intimate. Enjoyed the two different wine flights. I highly recommend and i will return for a third time
author: Drew S.

description:
Came here for happy hour, and right when it opened at 5 so we got to avoid all the lines and wait.  This place is perfect for happy hour!  The flights, though they're not on the HH menu, are worth it and you get a good taste of the different wine selections - according to the preference of wine/champagne.  We got the Salumi plate (I love my cured meats), the truffle mac and cheese (which was on the HH menu), three cheese selection (Manchego was super yummy!), and some other HH menu items....that I can't quite remember (sorry!) - all were really really good and paired with the wines perfectly!

It didn't get tooooo busy while we were there, so maybe we came on an off night - but service was great. Attentive, knowledgable, and nice! Can't ask for much more than that!  Good prices, good food, and good alcohol. Definitely a place to check out if you're in the marina!
author: Steph S.

description:
The wines here are expensive, but the pours are generous. I loved the Obsidian Ridge 2008 ($15) Cabernet Sauvignon, which was paired with a light but delicious proscuitto - burrata flatbread. 

I would return for the 50% off wines by the glass happy hour (although not all glasses are discounted), or make a reservation via Savored. However, I don't think I could justify coming here and paying regular price. Nectar is a great place for a weekend drink where you can enjoy the sunshine (two patio tables and nice indoor seating with open windows.
author: Jess C.

description:
Cute ambience and good wine! I did the "Bad Ass Reds" flight.
Will try food the on my next visit!
author: Zeeni N.

description:
Love this place; it has become my go-to when I want to go out for a drink or two but don't feel like leaving the 'hood.  Service is efficient and very friendly, they will offer as much or as little information and education as you'd like about the wines they offer, and they do it with the perfect amount of whimsy and humor.  (Way too much pretense and stuffiness among the wine crowd; Nectar is a wonderful diversion from all of that.)  Great little selection of beer and cider if you're not in the mood for wine.

  The menu is small, but there's enough variety on there for whatever you're in the mood for, whether you want a small snack or you want to construct a full meal.  Everything I've ever had there has been delicious. (My faves: grilled cheese and the polenta dish.)  Prices are fair, (maybe even a little on the low side, considering the quality of what they offer and the size of the wine pours).  And they have good HH deals and and a good wine flight deal on Mondays to help stretch your $$ further.   Recommend Nectar highly!
author: Catherine F.

description:
A+ for ambiance.  Really comfortable and varied seating, from cushioned low & long coffee tables (good for groups), to attractive booth seating, to normal high chairs for a casual conversation, and outdoor seating can get some nice sun.  A little pricey, but worth the experience.  If you're a wine-o, this is perfect for you.

The truffled popcorn is also excellent.
author: Julie N.

description:
This is the only place I visited twice in one trip last time I went to SF, and I wish I could go back right now. Adam and I were a bit early for our dinner reservation at Isa's next door, so we moseyed around a bit, just taking in the environment and beautiful weather. From the moment I saw the words "wine lounge" on Nectar's door and peered through the windows into its cozy, romantic atmosphere, I knew we had to stop in for a glass of wine. What better way to spend 30 minutes before dinner?

We took a seat at the bar and were immediately greeted, but not bombarded, which is always appreciated. It's gorgeous inside; dim lighting, dark furniture, beautiful shelves full of beautiful wine, candlelight... The bartenders are knowledgeable and personable, and most importantly, they seem to genuinely enjoy their job. It's such a relaxing and artful atmosphere that lures you in and makes you want to stay all night. We left for dinner and then came back right afterwards!

Even if Nectar had sub-par food and a boring wine menu, I'd still love this place. That's how much I enjoyed the ambiance and the service. But, of course, their menus are just incredible! This is my kind of food, y'all. I didn't eat a meal here, unfortunately, but I drooled over their menu for far too long. French, Spanish, local, and Irish cheese, butternut squash pizzetta, burrata with prosciutto, garden flatbread, baked polenta... it's a seasonal menu full of fresh and local ingredients, and each dish has a recommended wine listed beside it. For starters, they have roasted olives, bacon wrapped dates, and black truffle popcorn. Oh my gods... the popcorn. I had to have it, even though I was about to head to dinner. Best popcorn I've ever eaten, you guys. Perfectly popped, beautifully light, and perfectly, delicately enhanced with truffle. $7 for a large enough portion to share? Amazing!

I apologize for getting this far into a wine lounge review without mentioning the wine, which was fantastic. I went with a prosecco, of course. They have fabulous wine flights and descriptions with a sense of humor. "Crisp & Unpretentious Whites" as well as "Rich and Extroverted Whites." For the reds, "Playful yet Thoughtful," "Sensualist," and "Hedonist." I love it! I really do love everything about Nectar. They were even playing Valkyrie on the wall with a projectior, and you know I'm a Tom Cruise fan!
author: Kendall S.

description: This is my favorite wine and cheese place. THE BEST! I definitely recommend getting both cheese and salami plates. Mac and cheese and flat breads are pretty good too. Monday to Friday they have happy hour 30% off wine.
author: Jenn L.

description: Great wine selection, amazing service, and very reasonable prices. The bartender (he's the owner, i'm pretty sure) is always helpful in suggesting the wine that best matches your taste and he's willing to serve you a splash to make sure you like it. The food is also great. I recommend the white truffle popcorn as a snack or the butterscotch pot de creme for dessert. Haven't made it to the happy hour yet but the 30% discount off select wines is hard to beat. Definitely a spot in the marina i'll be coming back to.
author: Roberto F.

description: Love love love this place! Ryan is so helpful and very friendly! Great decor, wine selection and the food is scrumptious!
author: Elly R.

description:
Cool place! 
At a glance:
-Amazing wine list (one would hope!)
-Excellent food (each with a specific wine pairing in mind)
-Very good service
-Laid back/intimate atmosphere

Oh man, where to start! The first thing I noticed was that the menu was short, very short. The wine list was by far the longest part of it (duh) and capped out at around a dozen wines. The food was a total of six or so dishes (not counting the appetizers/happy hour snacks) and three deserts. 
My wife and I came here for a quick dinner on our way to the airport, and were very pleased. First, the one Sauvignon Blanc (from Australia or New Zealand, I can't remember which) on the list was spectacular - an explosive yet balanced first taste with a delicious lingering finish. It probably should have been paired with some of the excellent looking chocolate desserts.
Second, I was very pleased with my German Lager. Outstanding without being distracting, perfect to complement and offset a warm but stressful evening.

Stressful, that brings me to one glaring caveat: The parking. Locals will know that the area this is in is godawful for parking, visitors will not. A cross between massively busy and densely residential/popular. Scouring a ten block square for a single open space did not start out my evening well. 
However, that means even more bonus points to Nectar for making it all worth it! The friendly staff helped a lot, and the quality of food/drink and the relaxing ambiance tipped the scale into a great dinner.

The arugula salad was amazing (tart, great mixture of ingredients, served as a mighty pile of greens), and the Mac & Cheese was absolutely mind-blowing! It's plenty for one person, and was enough for us to split, and my god is it good! It's a perfect crumbly baked cheese/bread crumb crust that crumbles right through, so it adds texture without keeping a seeking fork from getting to the juicy, steaming, cheesy goodness below.

...I am going to get some food now, I can't write that without drooling. Definitely not a dish to pass up!
author: Noah H.

description:
Sunday evening I was the first customer to walk in. I didn't mind being the only one as I had some work stuff to do while having dinner and tasting wines.

I had the bubble flight, couple reds, port, ahi tartar, bacon dates, cured meats and banana bread.

Food was delicious, wines were excellent, service was impeccable, pairing suggestions were spot on. I even received some small samplers of wines I said I liked or thought about buying.

Only a few couples walked in during the couple hours I sat there while several groups leaved the door after browsing the menu at the door. While I appreciated the ability to work, I was pretty surprised there weren't more people. With this kind of concept and execution they really ought to have more customers.

If the other tourists are not able to walk few blocks or step aside from the Chestnut st. I really hope you locals find this spot. I would come here for date night, to indulge myself with wines and good food or just to enjoy moments of freedom when travelling for business.
author: Arttu N.

description:
Come here for the happy hours from 3-7PM M-F! I've been here a handful of times now and it never disappoints.
*They currently have a $10 for $20 yelp deal so make sure to take advantage of that during non-happy hour times.

Food:
My favorites are the flatbreads. 
+They change them out seasonally, but right now the Garden Flatbread pizza is rocking my world with the peppers and corn. 
+Prosciutto Flatbread- was not a fan of this one. The prosciutto was hard, chewy and way too salty. The flatbread also had a strong olive tapenade that was thrown on there in chunks. I'd rather have that smeared on the bread as a base.
+I'd get a couple of flights of wine to share because they have a great selection. Feel free to tell the manager what you're looking for so he can bring out some samples before you choose.
+They used to carry this non-alcoholic orange type drink that my husband loves, but they're working on bringing it back!

Service
A+ for service. Robin, the manager, is such a pleasure to talk to whenever my husband and I go in and ask for recommendations. He's very friendly and makes his customers feel very welcome! One time, I came in after my half marathon with a injured ankle and he brought me cloth napkins filled with ice to help. Very thoughtful of him. Katy served us last time and messed up our order and bill once or twice but she was apologetic and sweet, so we didn't mind.

Ambience:
Love the feel of this lounge. Plenty of sofas and lounge space in the front of the restaurant, a long bar and then proper tables for dining in the back. The mood, lighting, ambience and feel is great all around.

We've brought several friends here from out of town after dinner and it's always a good time!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
If I lived in the Marina, I think this would quickly become one of my frequent stops.

Call ahead or open table it, to reserve a comfy lounge seat. After about 7pm, the place starts filling up. Take note that the number of women patrons far exceeds the number of men (at least it seemed that way when we were there.)

TIP: *Fellas take note, if you want to meet a classy lady with good taste (she must have, if she's at Nectar), then I suggest going here, especially during happy hour!

The Bad-assed wine flight- was my absolute favorite and only $16-- if you are into peppery, full-bodied reds, this is the flight for you!

Take note, the Yelp offer does not apply to happy hour items, because they are already marked 50% off.

I agree with Janice C & Miss Nique F! Love the décor and the casual chic ambiance. 

Another plus is the tall, handsome manager or owner (whomever he is). He is super nice, easy on the eyes and very polite while welcoming each and every guest.
author: Cassandra E.

description:
The $10 for $20 yelp deal does not work during happy hour. I am so glad I liked this place because now I have to come back to use my $20. 

Anyway, I came here with a friend for happy hour before our dinner reservation at Isa next door. I really liked the ambience of the place; pretty spacious, with bar stools and high, long tables toward the back and a comfy lounge area in the front. Service was OK; we had to try really hard to get their attention a couple of times and they weren't super friendly but whatever. Their happy hour is pretty good: 30% of wines and their food all sounded really good! We just ordered the truffle popcorn because we didn't want to get too full before dinner, but that was amazing! Also ordered 2 glasses of wine, both good. I do recommend this place if you're looking for a nice wine bar/happy hour spot.
author: Stephanie G.

description: AMAZING wine bar! Can't say enough great things. The atmosphere is modern with a cozy feel and the service is fantastic! Our bartender was so nice and attentive even with us being at one of the off to the side small ledge bar areas. My boyfriend and I came directly from the Giants game and we're hoping to get a nice glass of wine and one of the desserts before walking home. We thought since it was later in the evening and no one else was eating, the kitchen was closed. However, our sweet tooth got the best of us and we had to ask. The gentleman didn't even hesitate and said he would absolutely check for us. Long story shorter, we ended up enjoying a delicious dessert, fabulous wine and unbelievable service! Nectar is a 10 min walk from my apartment and I will definitely be back on a regular basis. :)
author: Audrey R.

description: Just had an amazing birthday night here. Great flights, wonderful staff, and such a gorgeous space! Half of flights on Mondays is amazing. So impressed by this place and highly recommend it. They were super wiling to host a party of 10 - so great!
author: Kayla T.

description:
Cute little wine bar, with a great menu of wines and bites. The bartender seemed pretty knowledgeable about the menu, and recommended a great cabernet sauvignon for us. The prosciutto burrata flatbread was also really delicious and fresh. 

I would definitely go back, especially for their happy hour on the weekdays.
author: Vivian H.

description: Great selection of wines. Always excellent service from Chris, Leah and Jack.   Always nice that they have options apart from the norms that are found at most places.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Happened upon this place near Lombard because we were unable to find the other bar we had intended on going to but we found a gem.  The service was inpeccable and the guy at the bar was totally helpful and obliging in our needs.  Such a gentleman! We went kinda late on a Sunday, near closing so couldn't drink as much as we wanted but I was pleased.  The red wine reccommended was not exactly what I was looking for but me and the cousins had a great time sitting outside in the warm winter night, talking and laughing the night away. 

The interior decor had high ceilings.. or maybe my depth perception was a little skewed with all the alcohol consumed that night...nevertheless, would reccommend this place even for a casual date night. Great ambiance and perfect dim lighting, good service and love that it's on a quieter street away from the downtown hub bub.
author: Hanna Y.

description: Love this place. Intimate setting, great wine selection, and great food. Staff are attentive, friendly, and knowledgable about their wine and menu.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
This is only my second Yelp review and I only Yelp if it is really good or really bad. This is my first yelp for something really good. 

This is actually the best place I have found in the Marina. Great place to sit and they serve great wine. Not only that, they are SO friendly. It feels like a community. 

If I could chose one phrase to describe this place it would be --- attention to detail. They pay attention to make sure every guest has the best experience. 

Highly recommended.
author: Rachel B.

description:
The service here was EXCELLENT. 

I was in the Bay Area visiting friends and decided to visit Nectar. We were late for our reservations and were still accommodated. Food and wine pairings amazing.
author: Derrick B.

description:
I don't have much to say about this place except sorry my date left a shitty tip. I'll probably never be back either way though since I've been to far better wine bars with better ambiance. 

The descriptions of the wines are fucking ridiculous. THIS WINE TASTES LIKE FIELDS OF STRAWBERRY WITH NOTES OF OAK AND METAL LIKE THE CHAINS ON A BEAST THAT HAS YET TO BE TAMED SOAKED UNDER THE WARM RAIN OF CHERRIES AND SUNSHINE. 

Who writes this stuff??!?!?
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend after our anniversary dinner at Isa. The place is quite cute. 

We shared a wine tasting (5 wines) in the lounge area towards the front. It was cozy, but the only complaint I have is: the couches made me feel a bit itchy (!)-- they are brown and made of a fuzzy material. Would prefer a more comfortable material, something that didn't feel like a wool blanket.

The food menu looked good, so I'd be back.
author: Siv L.

description: My husband and I love coming to Nectar! It's always just busy enough to be fun, but not so overwhelming that you can never get a table. The owners are awesome, Chris and Leah really get to know their regulars, a rare quality in this city and one that has endeared them and their place to us.  The wine list is great - always something new to try. Their food menu is awesome too, seriously, one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches in the city!  Nectar is a gem in the Marina, you should definitely try it!
author: Andrea S.

description:
I made reservations for Friday night at 930pm to celebrate my one year anniversary with my boyfriend. We were able to find parking in the Lombard parking structure. $1 an hour. 

We were seated right away and greeted with two flutes of champagne by a gentleman. I wish I got his name. Sir, if you are reading this, thank you so much for making this a memorable experience. 

We ordered:
Bad ass red - the first one was our favorite. The second and third one were a little on the dry side for us. 
ABC flight - again the first one was our favorite. Very light and crisp. Wish I had more but between the champagne and my flight, I was already quite buzzed. 
Truffle popcorn - very tasty 
Smoked Salmon Flat bread - I personally do not like smoked salmon but I gave it a try. It's not bad. I sipped my wine and it intensified the salmon flavor. I ate the flat bread instead. My bf ate the smoked salmon. 
Grilled Cheese - this was very good. They were very generous with the prosciutto. 

The staff were every attentive. Excellent service. Everything was perfect. Thank you.
author: Serena F.

description: Had two different wine flights, the black truffle popcorn and banana bread desert. Really enjoyed the spot and flights. Great staff.
author: Malissa M.

description:
Love this place. 

Perfect mellow and comfortable atmosphere, food is great, wine selection is good, and the staff are awesome!

I've always had stellar prompt service, by some pretty cool people. 

One of the poor reviews on this page was written by a group my friend & I actually sat next to, which mentions use of a Yelp deal. I can tell you that the group was one of those entitled bunches and were incredibly awful and mean to the waitress, prompting a conversation with the owner - common human decency was lacking on the side of the patron. It's pretty standard to have a one deal per visit policy, and we were shocked by the blatant awfulness that was displayed over 10 bucks. Ignore EM...this place is great!
author: Abby P.

description:
My friends and I threw an engagement celebration party for one of my best friends at Nectar, and they were SO accommodating of our 12 person deep party.  Service here was pleasant, and didn't push us to order food and drink in mass quantities.  I'm currently "detoxing" from the holidays, and mentioned to a friend next to me that I wasn't going to be drinking.  The waitress overheard me, and immediately asked if I wanted to see a non-alcoholic menu, and recommended a orange ginger fizz.  She even served to me in a wine glass so I wouldn't feel left out from the rest of the crew :) I'm glad they told us about the 4 card minimum when splitting checks, we were able to move through the bill process pretty fast.  Once I'm done with my detox, I would love to come back here and hang out with some friends.  It's definitely a relaxed, nice place for a date night kind of wine bar, and you don't feel the pressure to act too Marina-ish while you're in there.

Definitely check this place out, it's got a lot of space and a good selection of both food and wine!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Always wanted to check this place out.  It looks inviting, the perfect ambiance for a wine bar.  

We finally made it in and took one of the lounge seats along the wall near the bar.  We were greeted quickly and given the menu.  

What we had:
hubby had the Pinot flight - $20 - he enjoyed it.  I'm not as much of a Pinot fan.
Instead, I chose to taste the following:
Cahors Malbec - $5.5 - quite good and smooth
Stateside blend - $4.5 - ok
Domaine Eden Cab - $7.5 - good

Tuscan Flat bread - $13 - topped with prosciutto, burratta, broccoli and arugula drizzled with balsamic.  Didn't expect it to be served cool.  The broccoli seemed odd but it actually added a bit of crunch texture.  A little too much balsamic.  

Salumi plate - $15 - house cured coppa and two styles of salami, served with crostini and whole grain mustard and a side salad of mixed greens and something pickled, which was quite delicious.
author: Gloria H.

description: We chose Leah and Chris' beautiful wine bar to host our small (~60 people) wedding reception and we're so glad we did. Leah's attention to detail is spot on. She is driven and on top of things. There's need no need worry about things going wrong in her hands. They printed the wine & beer menu and set up a beautiful ambiance. Plus their truffle popcorn is amazing. They allowed us to bring small decor items (the space is charming as is), which they used to make the space extra special for us. They held our cake in their wine cellar and cut it for us for a modest fee per slice. They moved the furniture so we could have a small dance floor at the front. Acted as our DJs by lowering and turning up the music when appropriate. We met a week before the reception to taste the wines we wanted to serve (the fun part). The day of, they were so kind, helpful, accommodating, and brought a positive energy to the party. Everyone loved them. They are reasonable, work with your budget, and are open and transparent. Leah and Chris are a wonderful couple and I wish them only the best in their business. Thank you for helping us make one of the happiest days of our lives so seamless and fun. If you haven't thought about having a unique nontraditional SF wedding, consider Nectar Wine Bar. It was one of the best decisions we made.
author: Melanie S.

description: Wow,  what a gem of a place in the Marina.  The wine selection is amazing and the truffle popcorn is delish,  but the best part is chatting with the friendly bar manager, Jack,  and watching the movies on the projector.
author: MJ D.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night after using Groupon Reserve. We were super fortunate to find street parking right outside the restaurant (it's a busy area so I recommend giving yourself 15 min - 30 min to search for parking if you have a reservation).

For a restaurant that is offering 30% off the bill, it wasn't that busy on a Saturday night until an hour/90 min after we arrived (9:00/9:30). It's a smaller restaurant, with mood lighting. Definitely romantic, intimate and cozy.  And our waiter was very gracious in recommending both food and drink.

My boyfriend and I decided to do the champagne flight set. All of them were delicious, though a bit tart for my taste. We had the burratta, arugula salad, and peach & raspberry crisp. All were delicious. 

Honestly, I can't rave about this place enough. Wonderful atmosphere, accommodating service, great food and drink, plus savings on our bill. What more could you ask for?

I plan to come back for Happy Hour.
author: Saroya W.

description: Staff was awful. Extremely slow. They forgot our drink on the tab and we didn't notice....they took it out on us and we didn't let them know. We told them we were in a hurry and took 15 minutes to fix tab. Place sucks.
author: Charlie R.

description: My friends and I came here tonight for happy hour and I can't speak highly enough of our experience! The service was SO friendly and attentive, the wine selection was delicious including both the red wine and the bubbly flights, and the appetizers we had (the olives and the truffle popcorn) were outstanding. I loved the atmosphere too! I'm definitely keeping this in mind for my next date :)
author: Chloe N.

description:
So you think you'll run into the usual Marina dbags here at Nectar?

Nope. None of that. 

You'll find small groups of friends and couples deep in conversation, laughing, imbibing on their nectar of choice. The ambiance is casual chic, lots of browns and modern touches. Imagine, I can actually hear myself talk here! (what a civilized happy hour!)  Their space isn't very large, nor is it cramped by SF standards, but come early to secure a seat. 

Wine flights are the way to go -- they have the abc (anything but chard flight), a bad assed red flight and bubbly flight, priced between $15-$17 for three tastes. Interesting varietals with over the top descriptions will surely pique your curiosity. Here's an example of a sparkling wine description: "frozen bomb boysenberry jam explodes on the palate with a fizzy whoosh of eucalyptus leaves & a hard shwack of leather that lets you know that uncle dick isn't kidding".  If that doesn't put a smile on your face, then you should order a bubbly. 

They also have a happy hour menu for apps priced between $3-$8. We loved their truffle popcorn! so yummy and perfect for snacking.

If you're looking to try a different varietal other than your normal Chardonnay or Cab, check out this spot. At Nectar, wines by the glass are 50% off during happy hour, so you can be assured that your glass will always be half full.
author: Janice C.

description:
The perfect wine lounge! A dark, intimate, trendy vibe with a nice wine selection.  I didn't try any of the food (which I've heard is quite good), but it was an enjoyable, relaxing wine experience. The servers are super friendly, as well.

P.S. It's worthy to note that the typical "Marina crowd" didn't congregate here, so it's worth checking out.

P.P.S. If you want a table, get there prior to 8:30pm.
author: Mansi A.

description:
They have a really great happy hour.  50% of glasses of wine and a menu of discounted appetizers.  The regular prices are a little steep, but happy hour fixes that problem!

I love wine, but I'm always a little afraid to go to wine bars because they tend to be kinda pretentious.  I'm young and don't really know that much about wine (although I'm learning) and I feel like often the staff and wine bars look at you like "what are YOU doing here."  NOT at this place.  The staff was very kind and attentive and I didn't feel out of place at all, but at the same time it was still sswanky.  So 5 stars for making me feel comfortable and classy at the same time!

The appetizers were quite good: truffle popcorn, what is that?  I'm still not sure, but it sure is tasty.

And of course, the wine... We got the Pinot flight and the Bad Ass flight.  Both had a lot of variety, and I liked some and didn't like others as much, but hey, that's how wine goes, everyone likes something different!

If only I didn't live so far from Nectar, I would definitely go again!
author: Sarah C.

description: I loved this place!  Very creative descriptions on their wine list.  Very friendly staff.   Best part for me is that it doesn't get ridiculously loud and/or packed.
author: Regina T.

description: I absolutely love Nectar. My boyfriend and I discovered it about a month ago and I've already been back with both him and girlfriends. Leia or Leah? The owner is so personable and friendly. Most wine bars are a bit snobby, but not this one! Nectar is great for everyone, both young and old. Their wine is great and their pours even better. We love getting their flights for only 19 dollars - you get so much wine, and I love the variety. Ambiance is gorgeous and their big cozy seats are our favorite. We will be back soon to try out the food.
author: Alexis T.

description:
I'd never been- and I am SO mad! I've walked by this place a lot but I finally went last Wednesday night with a friend. We walked in for wine and desert. 

They had options that I've never heard of before, and Matt, our server, was nice enough to let us sample a few of his recommendations which were perfect! 

We had 2 glasses of wine and shared a fruit tarte, see my picture. (its 10 X better than it looks). I had an amazing time. 

Quiet music, nice crowd, small, quaint but fun atmosphere. I was sold when I heard Kings of Leon playing in the background. 

I will most definitely be back to try their dinner! 

My recommendation: Great place to mingle and meet with friends. The white Bordeaux was my fav.
author: Heather H.

description: DJ Phillyberg on Thursdays!!!! Also the greatest wine bar in the city! Chris and Robin and Ryan know everything!
author: Adam R.

description:
A girlfriend and I were shopping in the Marina and happened upon this wine bar . I purchased the $10 for 20 deal on yelp on my phone literally as I was sitting in the lounge.

Ordered the anything but chard flight and a cheese platter. Nothing too special to be honest but the lounge was very cozy and perfect for conversation. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Nectar, where have you been all my lushy life?! This is MY kind of wine bar - cozy, casual, gastronomically enticing. I mean, who could say no to a red wine that promises "an escape for the far reaches of the earth upon a leather clad stallion"??  Giddy-up, I'm in! 

If there are movie theatres in heaven, they will definitely be serving Nectar's Truffle Popcorn - coated in luscious truffle oil and crispy chives and only $3 during Happy Hour. Pair that with a 25% off glass of crisp Favarita and your Monday just got a lot better. The veggie pizzetta was a little bland, but  a healthy way to soak up all that truffle oil. 

The fuzzy bar stool-cubes are brilliant - like drinking wine at home on the couch, but way more posh. Our server was so wonderful, handling the happy hour crowd all by himself, and so graciously. I wish they had a Nectar in the East Bay; I'd be tempted to spend lots of my free time and money there. But til then, I will gladly cross the bridge for this 5-star perfection.
author: Nique F.

description:
This is my favorite wine bar in San Francisco and continues to be a go to place whenever I get together with my friends!  It is my husband and I's favorite gem to visit in the Marina.  I stumbled upon this wonderful place several years ago when I visited the Marina and have been going back regularly since.  It has a elegant, warm atmosphere and the owners are fantastic and make you feel like home.  Though the place can get busy at night, it's always classy and doesn't have the overly crowded, drunken people atmosphere that many bars in the Marina usually have.  It is a great place to go and relax with friends or on a date.  

Service is consistently fantastic.  Love the candlelit atmosphere.  Wine list is superb to try some new wines you've never had before - Monday 1/2 off wine flights is another great excuse to go!  Food is also great as well - you can't go wrong ordering anything of off the menu and it changes with the seasons.  A couple of our favorite small plates that we order all the time are: truffled popcorn, bacon wrapped dates, ahi tar tare, and burrata and prosciutto.  Each time we order food, it tastes consistently delicious and exactly as we expect!  Signs of a well run kitchen!  

Bottom line - consistency across all facets is key when I give a 5 star review to a bar/restaurant.  Despite having gone there over 50 times, Nectar has been consistent with great service, great food, great atmosphere, and great wine list.  Highly recommend coming here!
author: Tabitha B.

description:
I love this place for a casual night out.

If you like medium-to-full bodied/big flavor reds, try the Twenty Rows cab or the Turley "juvenile" zin.

If you're looking for a bite to eat, the ahi tartare here is superb. So is the truffle mac n cheese.
author: Riz W.

description: Fuckin' A. This place is the best. Wine flights and sitting on the bench. Bomb.com
author: Collin M.

description:
A cute little marina wine lounge perfect for a girls night out. The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, with a helpful bar and waitstaff.
The menu has a great selection of small plates composed of fresh and local ingredients as well as a substantial wine list including a local and global selection. 
Tip for the ladies- if you are looking to meet a man this probably isn't the place as it's more appealing to the female race!
author: Victoria T.

description: Great ambience, great wine selection and awesome bartender.  Been there only once so far.  Will visit again.
author: Anupam D.

description: Came here after buying a Yelp deal. The wine was pretty good and the place was cute but the person helping us made me feel bad for using a Yelp certificate and would not honor it :( I don't think I'll be back any time soon even though I liked the various wine flight selection they had.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Nectar is my favorite wine bar in the Marina/Cow Hollow. They have an excellent selection of wines from around the world and half price happy hour on all wines by the glass before 7pm during the week. 

The place has a nice ambiance and salted popcorn is delicious!
author: Dilbo G.

description:
A pretentious wine lounge in Marina serving not-so-impressive small plates.  I went there because I wanted to be cool - blend in with the trendy crowd - but I realized I wasn't being too cool, taking out my Lumix digital camera every time a new dish arrived.  No one else there was doing that...oh well.  

I normally like small plate food, but not here.
Sometimes, code for small plates:
* Cut down on the serving size and charge as much as a full plate.
* Serve simple, effortless food; many which does not really require serious cooking.

PRICE / FOOD:
$15 Salumi - A plate of 3 types of fairly common meat.  It wasn't very interesting.    
$12 Shrimp Ceviche - Go to Peruvian restaurants instead. 
$13 Mushroom & cheese Panini - Good.
$15 Osso Bucco (braised lamb) - Lacked flavor.  I don't want it to be salty, but more spices would help.
$15 Small cheese plate - Decent, but not great.
$4 Anchovies - Not much to say.

As for their wine, I did like their taste size servings ($4-9), which allowed me to try various wines.

SEATS:  10-12 tables for four.  Many seats utilizing comfortable chairs you might find in someone's living room.  I was glad we had a reservation, because the place was packed.  Most people were huddled around the bar sipping wine.   Fairly hip crowd.
author: トモ T.

description:
This review is well overdue!  This was my favorite wine spot in all of SF, great prices, great food, amazing selection of wine and an even better staff!  Chris and Leah always make the effort to find you the perfect glass of wine and make sure you're having a good night.  I knew when I made the decision to leave SF that this was the place for my goodbye party.  

But my goodbye party actually turned into a surprise engagement party/wedding reception all rolled into one.  Leah and Chris were so great to work with to plan the party.  We rented the place out on a Friday night, set up was so simple and easy!  We walked into our party in full swing and surprised everyone.  Leah made sure everything was perfect from start to finish.  She listened to everything we wanted to do that night, even moved the cake from the back of the bar to the front when we realized that's where the crowd continued to gather throughout the night.  They offered a night of tasting all the different wines for us prior to the event and really listened to what we were looking for.  It was so easy and seamless. The food never stopped rolling out and everyone, even the pickiest of eaters left feeling fulfilled and happy.   We had a little bit of everything, flatbread, popcorn, cheeses, olives, etc...  I can't imagine how the night would have gone had we selected a different location.  Chris and Leah make you feel like family, and any time I'm back in SF, it's on the list to get back there every single time.  

Thanks again for a wonderful night and the perfect send off!
author: Christina B.

description: Trendy wine lounge w/ a large selection to choose from. Staff is very friendly and great to chat with. Had 2 bottles and the prices were fair. Good times!
author: Julie L.

description:
Me and my co-worker come here entirely too often. But why go anywhere else when this place has it all? The owner, Christopher, is very knowledgeable and super friendly. Robin is also super helpful and training to be a sommelier. They're happy to recommend and give a splash of something if you can't decide. The wine list is extensive and I have yet to have a wine I hated. Plus the descriptions to the wine are little literary flourishes, which makes picking out your wine a sensory experience!

They also have food, the truffle popcorn is a must. Movies play silently projected on the wall, while good jams provide a relaxed but vibrant atmosphere. 

There are 2 tables outside that catch some evening sun if its a nice day. If not, head inside to relax on one of the couches or sit at the bar to brush up on your wine skills chatting with the wine experts. 

You can also buy all the wines here at a very reasonable price. So if you find something you really like, stock up. 

Happy Hour is the time to go, all wines 50% off by the glass, plus deals on food.
author: Carlynn A.

description:
Great dinner here. All the food was really good. The serving sizes are actually very big compared to what I expected for wine bar food. The food was a great value. Only knock is that my wife and I both did different wine flights and we weren't big fans of those - they were OK...but would expect to be more impressed with the pre-determined flights. 

Definitely going to come back to explore the wine and food menus.
author: Sean S.

description: Nectar was one of first and continues to be the best wine bar in San Francisco. Amazing service from Chris and Leah and food well prepared and paired with the wine. A huge selection by the glass and a deep and hard-to-find by-the-bottle cellar. Great for dates, serious wine tasting and after dinner tipples.
author: Jerry Y.

description:
Another amazing find through Bloomspot! I am a big believer in dining out and dining out often as long as I'm not burning a hole in my pocket.

My voucher was set to expire so I made a reservation for brunch; however the day of my reservation, I received a call from the owner/manager letting me know they had to shut down for the day because of some equipment issues and that he would be glad to honor my voucher a few weeks past the expiration date. Sounds good to me!

I rescheduled for another Saturday afternoon which ended up being a beautiful day! My husband & I sat on a couch by the window and watched people walk by, enjoying the sunny afternoon in the Marina - great location and very relaxing!

We ordered the Flight of 3 Nectars which were so delicious and refreshing! The Pink Pearl was our favorite but the others were a close second. We ordered the Breakfast Pizzetta and the Frittata, based on the manager's recommendation and it was quite possibly the best frittata we've ever had! The manager was very personable and came to check on us and ensure we were enjoying ourselves. Overall - it was a very pleasant experience and we will be back on a weeknight for Happy Hour!
author: Jigna P.

description:
I like this place for happy hour for a drink or two pre party to meet up and chill but other than that its way to non-social. Very little dynamic and mostly a place where girls go to gossip and relax without us boys hitting on them. 

So to review. Lots of 2 top girls paired up. No way to chat them up.  WIne is good and servie is cool Thats about it.
author: Kris K.

description:
Been here twice in the last 2 weeks. Great little wine bar. It was some food options which is a plus; Nothing for a huge dinner meal but light bites. I typically get the Pinot flight its $20 bucks for a flight of three tastings. When you go for happy hour which is 5-7 there half off so only $10 bucks. 

They have truffle popcorn which is YES incredible so get it. Nice little snack while sipping your wine. I also go the cheese plate which was scrumptious. 

Highly recommend this place.
author: Jess O.

description:
I impressed a guy by letting the two of us compose a case of wine to take home for future enjoyment while we noshed on wonderful small plates that were just amazing.

The flights are fun and a learning experience and the small plates are elegant and tasty. The vibe is cool and relaxing.  A good place to kill a few brain cells and enjoy the dolce vita!
author: Jennifer O.

description: Really good cheese plate and cozy spot to enjoy a glass or bottle of wine. A little on pricy side but the atmosphere and good service make up for it. Will have to try the food next time, plan on coming back soon!
author: Sarah B.

description:
After dinner at Bistro Aix two doors down I strolled into Nectar Wine lounge. 

I will admit that the fact that it wasn't too crowded appealed to me. It was a Wednesday night and while I was already beating myself about having dinner in the Marina, this place was a perfect choice.

It was very classy, dimly light and had plenty of seating. There were 5 or 6 other couple there, but they were far enough away where I felt comfortable having a  conversation with my date. 

I had a glass of the roset ($12) which was a B+.

Our tab was about $27 which was a bit more than I wanted to spend, but it was worth it to be comfortable and have a nice ambiance. 

I would recommend this as a place for a weekday date.  

See pics here: http://flickr.com/photos/calmenda/sets/72157604004733483/
author: Carlos A.

description:
My friends and I went to Nectar for brunch recently after I ended a cleanse with Thrive  Cleanse. We ordered the "Good & Evil" - you receive a bottle of champagne and get to select one of three different fresh-pressed juices to try. The juices were delicious! We actually were able to try a small sample of all three - day at the spa (apple, cucumber, fennel, mint), pink pearl (strawberry, pineapple, pear, mint) and true blood (orange and red beets).

When first looking at the menu, we were worried we would still be hungry after brunch because the menu is definitely "light." We were pleasantly surprised that splitting four dishes between three people was a great option. We tried the homemade vegan juice bread - which was amazing! We also split the arugula salad, frittata (which was small, but delicious) and the breakfast pizza. The breakfast pizza was one of the best I've ever had! It was cooked perfectly and the flavors were awesome together.

The ambiance was quiet, but very nice and the staff were all kind, cordial and very friendly. I would definitely recommend going here if you're looking for a "light" brunch that is still filling and delicious!
author: Andrea T.

description:
this place gets busy during happy hr!!!

came here a while back for happy hour to do their flights of reds and whites. they had really good deal for happy hour with all the wines 50% off!!! they have a lot of selections so you can actually come here multiple times to try different things for happy hours and won't get bored quickly. 

if you're having dinner in the marina area and want to have a glass of two before dinner this is definitely the place to be!
author: Joyce C.

description:
Happy hour at Nectar Wine Lounge is a gourmet treat on the cheap.  All of their glasses of wine are 50% off from 5-7pm along with a generous menu of appetizers and sides.  The truffle popcorn was a delicious way to start off the evening, along with the crispy and savory duck confit pizza.  My friend ordered the phyllo dish with 40s bleu cheese and honey - a perfect sweet and savory combination.  There is a huge list of wines to choose from, from reds, whites, to sparkling.  

A fan of dessert wine, I enjoyed my meal with the Royal Tokaji wine. I've only seen Hungarian dessert wine in few establishments, so I order it when I get the chance.  It's quite complex and strong in flavor for a dessert wine; not syrupy at all.  The waiter informed me that the number in Azsu 5 indicates the level of quality in the wine (5 being the highest).

The place started to pick up around 6pm, but my friend and I enjoyed hanging out a our booth with its nice plush chairs.  The service was not as attentive since they seemed understaffed, but they were definitely nice whenever you could flag one down.  A warm and low key lounge environment, I could see that it was quite popular for regulars.  Fun and tasty happy hour experience!
author: Pauline L.

description:
A very cool wine bar in the Marina.  I found this spot via Yelp, and noticed that they had a '$20 for $10' special.

My girlfriend and I went here for a pre-dinner sit down.  I had the Pinot Envy flight and she went with the Bad-Assed Red flight.  Neither of us were disappointed with the wines.  We also ordered a 3 cheese plate, with Saint Nectaire, Manchego, and Humboldt Fog along with the Prosciutto flatbread...very tasty indeed.

Our waitress was fairly knowledgeable, and had plenty of suggestions for us (including the flatbread).  Good music playing, and I was really digging the decor/vibe of this place.

By the end of drinks, we paid and completely forgot about using the coupon...I guess that speaks to how well we were treated!

Would definitely recommend this place to any wine lover looking for a place to unwind or kick off a nice date night.
author: Joe D.

description:
Came here on a 1st date, easily found a good set of seats. The waiter was friendly and explained all of the different wines in our flight of reds. I thoroughly enjoyed all the wines selected. The music was an excellent mix. 

My only complaint were the chairs, it made it difficult to sit close to whoever you are there with.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Not a place for meeting new people as it's a sit down place but a great place to spend with friends or to have a first date!

This is a sit down wine bar that serves food. I love how they tone down the music just enough so that you can hear it but can't exactly tell what song it is. Perfect for ambiance and for still having a conversation without yelling.

The wine list is superb! Not expensive for the quality you get either! I had an amazing Grenache for $7 a glass! 

The service is quick and friendly and not at all pushy.  Come here to avoid the meat market Marina crowd and relax with friends.
author: Kathy S.

description: Came here after eating dinner at Isa right next door. Really cozy and romantic atmosphere, great for coming here on a date. A glass of wine will cost you ~$11, but you should try to stop by for their happy hour specials (ends at 7pm) if you can make it.
author: Angela K.

description:
Service was nice when we were here a few Thursdays ago but I wasn't that impressed with the actual tasting list.   There were a goodly amount of choices but not many of them seemed particularly interesting.  Maybe it was just me.

I did very much enjoy my cauliflower potato soup with fried leeks and truffle oil.  It was the perfect thing on a chilly, rainy Spring evening after a weekend of too much eating.  Warm and flavorful but light. 

I suppose I'd come back if we were in the area, but I'm not sure I'd make it a destination.
author: Shanna K.

description: Monday night "go to" spot featuring half-price wine flights (score!). Don't miss the truffle popcorn - decadent and complementary to whatever wine you order.
author: Beth D.

description: Came here with a Yelp deal. Had a flight of wine special and the hubbs had a beer. It seemed pleasant. Pretty packed. The beverages were tasty but I would not pay normal price for them, as for most places in the Marina, so I was grateful for the deal!
author: Nicole Z.

description:
Delicious small plates- ordered bacon wrapped dates twice, the mac n cheese and the tuna. Would recommend all of them.

The wine was terrific as well- tried 3 different wines, which according to our waiter were "all over the place" as far as taste goes- but they were all really good. 

The dim lighting was perfect for a date night. Wasn't crowded at all on a Tuesday night, but it didn't feel empty or quiet, which was nice. 

Toward the end of the night, they kicked it up with some good 90s hip-hopanonymous (probably to get us up and moving) but it just made me want to stay longer! 

I'm a fan and will definitely be going back.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
I was early for a dinner appointment in the area so I stopped by this wine bar to expand my palate. A variety of wines by the glass were half off until 7pm and there were also some specials for bar food. I had a Mongeard-Mugneret Bourgogne, which was a pinot and gamay blend. This was a softer red with mild flavors- which was what I was looking for. I followed it with a Mas del Perie Malbec from Cahors, which was spicier and had a long finish. I might be bias towards French malbecs but I really enjoyed this one.
The setting is intimate and aside from several sofa chairs, most of the seating was bar-style. Not meant for a group of friends. Staff were helpful and attentive.
Great place to take a special someone.
author: Alfred L.

description: Very nice selections of small plates. I had the tuna tartare and we shared the burrata cheese flatbread with prosciutto . The truffle popcorn is worth the trip itself. Very nice selection of old world wines. Good flight selection and even had a coupon on Yelp. Very knowledgeable staff. Thanks to Robin for turning around our evening. Hip, fun place!
author: John H.

description:
Came here with my ex-boyfriend to round out our Dolores park-ing, Tartine-going whole-day-date. Evidently he had, at one point, worked with the proprietor, and since the sun was going down and the temperature dropping and he wasn't yet ready to start ignoring me for months at a time, he suggested that we go wine tasting together. 

It was a Friday evening, around 5:30 when we arrived. I followed him in, and he walked straight up to the bar as though he owned the place, waiting for the sommelier to acknowledge him. Once he did, my date was greeted with a grin and a handshake and we were immediately shown to a table with oversized relaxed chairs and handed menus. I was introduced to our sommelier (I'm going to call him Chris, although I might be making this name up) as a winemaking student and friend and I awkwardly listened to their conversation for a moment until Chris left to attend to other patrons. I was asked if I would like to do a flight, and I happily accepted. 

Perusing the list, I found a number of wines with which I wasn't overly familiar from a variety of international wine regions. I quickly picked out the flight from the languedoc region of France and sipped on my bubbly while the darling ex studied the wine list. 

Our wine-pouring friend returned and asked if we had made decisions, and my date said "Why yes, we're going to do flights and I'm going to have..." at which point Chris interrupted him "May I suggest you try the languedoc flight?" at which point we agreed and he headed off to pour our glasses. Not long after, he returned with our flights and a map depicting the regions and describing the wines we would be tasting. 

A few moments of awkward wine sniffing later and we tasted the wines. Unique, each of them, but I wasn't highly impressed by any. We took our time drinking through the three glasses and, before long, nature was calling and it became apparent to me that I hadn't eaten a proper meal yet that day. Gracefully stumbling to a restroom in a classy setting such as this takes great amounts of concentration. Next time, remember to clear the table before you move forward. Their furniture is sturdy and difficult to upset: Score! 

Upon my return, the ex had decided yet another glass of wine was necessary and we ordered snifters full of pinot noir (I expect they were particularly generous pours from Chris who thought he was getting an old friend some action) which was, actually, quite impressive to me. We chatted through the last glass and left sometime around 7:30. Despite the fact that the wine bar was filling up and we were taking up space and not ordering food, we weren't rushed and received attentive service. 

An enjoyable experience and pleasant wines. I still prefer winetasting in Napa to any wine bar.
author: Lily R.

description: Great music and vibe, decent food, and great happy hour value; but I wish the wine selections would have been a little more varied. Will go back to see what else the wine director decides to roll in. Recommended.
author: Mark H.

description: Super friendly staff, great wine options and nice selection of appetizers. A nice place to hangout and converse. Thumbs up to the garden flat beard.
author: Anne T.

description:
Came in here last night with some friends and had terrible service.

My husband and I have come here several times before and have always had a fine time here until tonight.  From the moment we sat down, the service was off and seemed to get worse throughout the night.  We were greeted by server, Silkie (Short blonde hair with tattoos.  Perhaps, she is relatively new?) and politely told her that we wanted to wait for my husband to arrive before we ordered.  We also mentioned that some of us had purchased the Yelp deal to which she answered "I'm glad you told me now because I hate when customers tell me they purchased the deal after I've already brought them the receipt.  I then have to go back and update the receipt and bring them a new one."  We felt that was a little odd to say but decided to ignore it.  

When we were ready to pay for our check, the other server came by and we told her that two of us had purchased the Yelp deal.  She mentioned that we could only use one.  So we said didn't know that since we were planning on splitting the bill.  The server then said she would call the owner, Chris over to explain.  While we waited for Chris, our original server, Silkie came by and said "You only said you had a Yelp deal.  You didn't say you had two" in a nasty voice while pointing her finger at us.  So then we responded by saying that we didn't appreciate her attitude and would prefer to speak to Chris about this instead.  Silkie continued to badger us so we finally said that as a server she should have a better attitude and be more polite towards customers.  Silkie seemed to be in shock that she was a server because her response was "Really?  I'm a server?!".  Yes, you are a server and are there to provide us customers a service.  If you don't like that then you're in the wrong industry.

The owner, Chris then came by to discuss what happened.  He was very apologetic and seemed embarrassed by what happened, and did make up for it.  And just to note, not being able to use our second Yelp deal wasn't what upset us (we don't really care about the $10 or $20 savings).  What upset us was Silkie's unprofessionalism and rudeness.  

Needless to say, we will be back in order to use our other Yelp deal and because the owner, Chris is a really nice guy.  I guess we have to make sure that Silkie isn't working that night so we don't feel the hostility from the moment we sit down.  But if she is working, make sure you show her your Yelp deal ahead of time, otherwise you'll have an angry server to deal with.
author: E M.

description:
If you're looking for something a little different than the traditional Marina scene, then Nectar should be at the top of your list!

Whether you're looking for a relaxing, yet vibrant place to grab a great glass of wine with a girlfriend, or you want to be engulfed in a sexy setting with your beau...it's truly the best of both!

Nectar has really toned in on creating the optimal ambiance for guests to feel relaxed yet invigorated.  The energy flows seamlessly and while they have a projector playing muted movies, they also have a fun mix of music that picks up the energy level.  To finish it off, the candle lighting throughout, gives a sexy overtone to create the perfect setting. 

If you're looking for something a little fun, they have wine flights, where you get to taste an array of select wines from all over the world!  Tasting each of the wines was so much fun and a great way to spike conversation if you find yourself looking for a good "first date" stop with a new friend.

Beyond the quality of the product, the service was truly impressive.  Every member of the staff was well educated on the products and served up a wealth of knowledge in regards to the amazing wines we were tasting.  Additionally, everyone was highly personable.  It was so refreshing to see the owner and every member on hand chatting and laughing with tables, making sure each guest was having a fabulous time.

If you haven't tried Nectar yet, do yourself a favor and make the time to stop by!  

My personal recommendation...Try the black truffle popcorn and your favorite wine flight.  I promise, it will be an experience to remember.
author: Tiffany T.

description: I've only been here for a quick drink with a small group of people, early one evening on a Saturday night. Husband had the crab gnocchi which I had a bite of and it was really good. I really enjoyed the vibe here (dimly lit, lots of space, great lounge-y feel), and the service was lovely. Great stop on a first date, meeting up with friends, etc. Would love to come back to try more of the food.
author: Piyali F.

description: My girlfriends and I came to Nectar to kill time while we were waiting for a table at Delarosa. I've had my eye on Nectar for awhile so it was the perfect time to stop by. We arrived around 9pm and it was pretty crowded and super warm inside LOL. We found some open space against the wall with some stool chairs. The bartender came over right away and provided us with menus and answered our questions. I wanted to order the Fresita sparkling wine that I saw in the Yelp picture, but I guess they didn't have it *sad face*. I ended up ordered a boysenberry sparkling wine instead which was very good. Overall, our wine was tasty and although the lounge was pretty loud we were still able to converse and enjoy ourselves. I would go back to Nectar to explore the wine menu a bit more when I'm not in a time crunch.
author: Ashley F.

description: We got there roughly 15 minutes too late for Happy Hour, so that sucks, but I still loved this place. Yelpers don't lie, that truffle popcorn is delicious. Good price on the wine flights, too. Friendly, fast service.
author: Karen C.

description:
Very down-to-earth feel. We were positively surprised. Going to a wine bar in the Marina we expected a more snobby atmosphere. But they have some pretty awesome wines for reasonable prices and welcoming staff to answer any questions. 

Nice spot to hang out before a late dinner (or after an early dinner).
author: Felix B.

description:
Great wine - terrible service!

Not letting us talk for a minute without interruption but once we wanted to pay it took 20 minutes to pick up our card.

Sad because otherwise nice atmosphere...

Don't get the popcorn - way to oily!
author: Philipp S.

description:
This mission girl rarely ventures out to another neighbhorhood, but last Saturday I found myself in the Marina (YIKES), and Nectar opened herself with welcoming arms to receive me - the Marina virgin.

This little wine bar is dark, romantic with a hint of mystery that leaves you wanting more. Upon entering, I had a slight few seconds of panic: "No! I'm not in the Mish anymore.", followed by: "Ahh, pretty people, clean place." Yes, I could get used to this. 

Enough with the atmosphere and the impeccable Marina crowd. We got seated in the back and munched on truffle oil drenched pop corn, quite addicting by the way and I'm not usually a popcorn fan. 

They have a wide selection of whites, reds, and sparklings from Europe and California. The sommelier, Robin was friendly and knowledgeable and recommended just the right choice of a Santa Barbara cab for us. We were only here for the wine, but judging by their full menu, I would definitely come by another night for dinner, as their autumn roast among other food choices look quite interesting.

For now, Nectar is an impressive place for both a pre-dinner hangout or a night cap wind-down.
author: Jackie G.

description: I have been here a couple times. Nice happy hour deal on good wines. Really nice food too. Always chill here which is nice..
author: Vincent M.

description:
I came here with my Mom 2 months ago - sorry for reviewing so late, but I remember our experience like it was yesterday, I promise!

Service: My Mom had never been to a place like this before, and we both don't know much about wine so we were happy to have an awesome server who guided us through choosing 2 great wine flights. Once he served the flights, he described what flavors to expect from each wine we'd be drinking in great detail. We then ordered 3 menu items and he brought each one out with perfect timing as we worked our way through each wine glass.

Food: We ordered the bacon wrapped dates, Tuscan pizzetta, and mac 'n cheese. Each items was great!! The bacon wrapped dates offered a perfect balance of sweet and salty. The Tuscan pizzetta was not a flat bread - it was a thin wheat crust loaded with tons of yummy, fresh veggies. The mac 'n cheese was rich and creamy. I especially loved the dates and pizzetta. The mac 'n cheese was definitely good, but if I went again I would consider trying one of the salads or other items instead.

The overall experience was fantastic, and I would love to come here again next time I visit San Francisco!
author: Hollie T.

description:
Sorry Nectar but you didn't make the cut....maybe because I felt horribly uncomfortable the entire time I was there?

I doubt it was the plethora of fake tanned plastic barbie Mariana-ettes swarming the place, but more or less the waitress that kept walking by us examining our glasses every time she passed our table (which was directly across from the bar.)

Given, I do not resemble your typical patron, this does not warrant an eyeball f*ckng each time you walk by.
