I forgot why I never go to the Mariana but I'm glad Nectar is here to remind me.


Their wines, however, were very delicious, I must say. But the entire situation was just awkward and so distressing that I will never ever return. 


Unsure what Janice C. means - as evidence of those who have given this place a high rating (i.e. Heather H. , Diana L. etc.) it looks like a "usual Marina dbags" hang out spot.
author: Maple S.

description: Fantastic service by the bartender - waiter.  Cheese was great and came in a great presentation along honey and sliced grapes. Had the Pinot envy wine flight and a glass of moscato d'asti - all delicious. The pizzette (vegi) was very good and the gnocchi was delicate and flavorful. Good taste in music and jazzi ambiance. I'll definitely be back.
author: Oren R.

description: Great atmosphere, gourmet food and wine to fit any mood. Above all a down to earth place in the Marina. What's not to love.
author: Eric H.

description:
I only had 1 glass of wine here, but the ambiance was really nice.  I felt very at peace and the wine was good all around.  I came here as a 3rd stop for a girl's night out and we all had delicious wine.  One of my friends got a sweet dessert wine, and it literally OMG delicious sweet.  I got a white wine.

As you can tell, I am NOT a VINO.  Is that what you call them?  I know nothing about wine.  But i was happy with my wine.  The descriptions were super weird....but eh? It didnt' bother me.  I just asked a friend and the waitress what would be a good simple white.

It is kind of a more date spot.  We sat at a high table with high chairs, which was good for all girls.  They had like couches and candles in the back.  I would come back with the bf :D or maybe during happy hour.  Then again, it's been months since I've been, and I haven't been back....
author: Aly A.

description:
great neighborhood spot to chill with a friend after a long day. In general it's a chill place that seems to harbor a LOT of first dates. Seemed like all of Match.com was joining us at the bar. So, from that perspective if you're looking for an easy to chill date spot I'd say this could be it!

MUST READ the descriptions of the wine, hilarious! 

Also, we were just finishing 2 Pinot flights when we realized there was a Yelp deal. Sweet! I'd love to try the happy hour or brunch sometime.
author: Arianna P.

description:
The lack of pretentiousness is no myth, at least when it comes to the staff.  Nestled in the heart of the Marina, and surrounded by all of the pricier, hipster restaurants and bars, sits Nectar Wine Lounge.  Granted, I can't honestly tell you what kind of crowd you'll find yourself in here, since we came on a Sunday, and we were the only ones in there...but it was 25% off wines and the happy hour menu, and we got extra attention and awesome service, so I'm not complaining.

The Riesling flight had nice variety, the ceviche was small but delicious, and the truffle popcorn was pleasantly different.  I wished they served truffle popcorn in the theaters instead of that god-awful overpriced, artery-clogging salt and butter concoction.

I'm a little biased on the desserts since I detest strawberries (on the vanilla bean cheesecake) and not a huge chocolate fan (the caramel/chocolate thing-don't know what it's called).  However, my friends seemed to enjoy it.
author: Betty W.

description:
Excellent recommendations by the waiter.  Very good cheese plate with assortment of goat, sheep and cow milk.  The descriptions of the wine written on the menu are hilarious.  

Outside seating was nice, but the tables were a little wobbly.

I would definitely go back and recommend it to others.
author: Andrew O.

description: Had an awful experience here because of the terrible service I had from this Asian waitress who wore too much eyeliner. She didn't accept my Chinese ID and insisted that I had to show her my passport, which was ridiculous because I never had any trouble with it in any bars. Not only that she was also extremely rude and patronising and threatened to kick me out. So, if you're "foreign", I'd advise you to go to different wine bar like Amelie's or press club where service is so much better. It is not worth the unnecessary drama
author: Loretta C.

description:
This place has a great ambiance about it, without the usual Marina crowdedness. Now, if you're a Marina-ite, it seems like crowds are an attribute, but if you're like me, I prefer some space to breathe. This is a great little haven in the midst of people!

Not a huge wine list, but simple and tasty. Some good beer and food too - I'd like to try their happy hour next!
author: Brianne H.

description:
I didn't try the food here but I had 2 flights of the bubble brut rose......  it was really good, I'm def going back, trying out more of their wines and their food. 
Great to go with a few girlfriends or on a date.
author: Irma R.

description: We had a blast at this place and the food was so good. I don't know why i wasn't expecting that, but I was so happy with the food- i cannot wait to go back. As other people said as well- the environment is super chill. I think it is the perfect friday night spot or a great place to kick off Saturday night!
author: Annie W.

description:
Nectar is AMAZING!  Wine is incredible and the food is outstanding.  
Definitely order the grilled cheese, it's Nectar's original with house-made rosemary sourdough, crisped prosciutto, & mozzarella, all made with love.  
The people who work here make you feel like you belong and are extremely knowledgeable about their offerings--TRUE WINE EXPERTS...never disappointed here, LOVE it!! 
Great atmosphere, crowd, location, etc.
author: Angela E.

description:
I am not a big fans of popcorn.....  but anything with truffle oil is GREAT!!  

When I saw truffle popcorn on the menu, I knew I had to order it!  OMG, the smell/taste of truffle is heavenly!!!  But if only they have truffle fries, it would be PERFECT!!!  

I like the wide selection of wine, and the place is pretty cozy.  

One thing that's lacking is dessert....... If they serve (good) dessert also... I would be hanging out there on a regular basis!!!
author: Lillian T.

description: Nectar was the perfect post-dinner spot for a wine night cap. They almost always have a Yelp $10 for $20 deal.  Cute/comfortable spot, friendly bar staff, and decent wine selection. In the heart of the Marina so lots of bars/restaurants close by for before or after.
author: Brianna M.

description: Went here on a Thursday night, Yelp said they closed at midnight & they closed at 11 so I wasn't able to get in. There were still people inside & even the bartender saw me & just ignored me. I was so mad & disappointed. I was looking forward to try this place.
author: Cristina R.

description:
A very interesting selection of wines.  No complimentary bread or crackers for this wine tasting.  Served in sets of 3, they provide it to you at an angle.

I had ordered the set of red Wines, but also had my sips of the white wine as well.

The ambiance was good as well.
author: Kent H.

description: Cozy little wine spot. The arugula salad, ahi tartare, and truffled mac and cheese are all really good. Good wine selection. The place is a little small but I've never had a problem getting a table. I've never seen it packed to capacity, which is a nice change for the Marina.
author: Christy M.

description:
(This is based on my friend's experience as much as my own.)

The wine was good, the food was good, the service was pretty good. However, I had to ask three times for a glass of water, and I still got it about 5 minutes after asking the third time. Also, we came during happy hour but also had the Yelp coupon. We didn't realize that we couldn't combine the two, and the server didn't say anything. We ended up getting the Yelp coupon discount, but it would've cost less if we had gotten the happy hour price. It seems that the server should've A) made sure we knew we weren't going to be charged happy hour prices if we used the coupon, and B) suggested saving the coupon for later if the happy hour prices would've cost less.
author: Willow S.

description: Great selection of wine. Romantic and cozy atmosphere. Lovely service. Truffle fries were good as well as their other small   Eats. It is on the pricer end. They have a deal on yelp. It's worth your time and try if you get the deal, otherwise it'll be just okay for the price.
author: Carrie T.

description:
Nectar Wine Lounge was kind enough to host a post-screening party for The Great Debaters last night.

The wine served definitely deserves 5 stars, but the food is bringing it right on down to 3. Cheese/nut/fruit plates were sloppily presented and underwhelming, and the cooked items served-pizza and egg rolls were bland. The  spanakopita triangle thingies were good. The staff hadn't figured out a sensible way to distribute the food in the narrow, packed room. (let alone napkins)

I thought about cutting them some slack because it was a special event, but if a venue agrees to host a party they should know how to do it. Sure, it was a room full of scrappy actors and other industry people trying to eke out a living in this godforsaken backwater of a town, but then you've also got people like me who hire caterers, rent venues and throw parties...so it's worth always putting your best foot forward if you can.

Back to the wine...excellent selection served up by knowledgeable, patient folks. I'd stop in if I was in the hood for a glass. For a destination wine bar, my heart belongs to Cav, where the food is stellar.

Oh, the dirty old lady in me has to point out that the hottest juice at Nectar last night was Nate Parker, one of The Great Debaters stars. En fuego. And please go see this wonderful movie! http://www.thegreatdebatersmovie.com/
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Pros:
Good wine selection.

Cons:
This is the wine bar I just never go to.  Maybe it's the location, but I think the vibe inside just isn't right.

Fun:
People watching on Steiner/Chestnut on a good night is unbeatable. Or was the word unbearable?  I always get those confused.
author: Mike G.

description: I planned my brother's 40th birthday party here.  I can't explain how easy they were to work with.  First of all, to rent out the entire place, there was only a food and drink minimum, and a $100 deposit, both of which I felt were more than reasonable.  Leah was really responsive, had great ideas and was extremely nice.  The food was amazing.  In particular I don't think I've ever heard more raving about the bacon wrapped dates.  The tuna tartare was super as well.  They both passed plates and had stuff set out.  Music was set to my brother's favorite music, and the place was lit with candles, and looked great.  We had 50 people there, but you easily could have fit more or less and it would have been equally nice, the way the room is organized.  We had beer options, but most people drank wine, of which we had a sparkling, white, rose, and 2 red options!  The bartenders seemed to remember everything everyone was drinking!  Very impressive!  The overall bill was totally reasonable and under what we had budgeted for.  Finally, she let us bring in cupcakes at no extra charge!  I would highly recommend Nectar Wine Lounge for any event (birthday, work, Christmas party) of 30-80 people (can't remember the exact limit).  It's in a great location and we were more than pleased with absolutely everything!
author: Lindy I.

description:
Great happy hour menu on Fridays. 50% off select food items, and 25% off glasses of wine. Normally I don't order the expensive glasses of wine on a menu but with 25% off, it makes me feel less guilty. The wine list is really impressive and I've never had a bad glass of wine here.

Their smoke salmon flatbread is really good and well worth the happy hour price of ~$7.50. The truffle popcorn is the best popcorn I've ever had. I think they use truffle oil. It's $3 during happy hour as well.

The service is great, but not the friendliest. The atmosphere is excellent and the location is good as well. I've been there twice and would go back if I'm in the area.
author: Tomas P.

description:
Such a fun wine bar! I haven't been yet for their happy hour but I will definitely be going back.

A friend and I went to Nectar on a rainy Thursday night and this place was packed! It was just a little bit after 7pm, we walked in and it the place was buzzing with people. Besides hot top chair at the bar, they have small small table with comfy,  plush  chairs and a few high top tables. In the back, there are larger tables for partied of 4 or more,

We sat at the bar and ordered two flights of their "bubbles". Their flights consist of 3/4 to 1/2 glasses of red, white or prosseco/champagne going from lightest to heaviest for $14. Great deal!

We also snacked on the warm olives, butter squash gnocci and the ahi tartare. The Ahi and the Olives were amazing! great flavor. The gnocci was a little too sweet for my liking. They almost tasted like a snickerdoodle.

The wine can be a little on the pricey side but like i said, they have great deals during their happy hour and the flights were a great price. 

Nectar is located next to other local bars and food places and right in the heart of the Marina. Fun place to start or end your night.
author: Whitney S.

description:
I really like this place....excellent happy hour value....great serving staff with a wonderful laid back attitude.....the interior is like your living room-that comfy and relaxed. Loved the flights, and all the food....as everyone else notes, the black truffle infused popcorn is indeed to die for....pumpkin soup and flatbreads were all great....presentation is top notch, even the bathroom is gorgeous. I will definitely be back.

Tried Amelie's just to compare, and sadly-it just doesn't.

Don't think this place is a snooty shop just because it sits in marinaland....there isn't a snoot in the place....just nice people being cool. Love it.  A high 5 to be sure!
author: Laurence T.

description: This is a really nice lounge with an amazing cozy feel to it. Nice wine selection and pricing, although I haven't gotten to try the food yet. The waitress that helped us was knowledgeable without imposing the typical wine snobbery and jargon that you can find at some of these places. I'll definitely be back next time for another glass.
author: Matt R.

description: I love this place! It's my favorite wine bar in the marina. They have a great variety of wine and their truffle popcorn is the best! My favorite is the Bleasdale Sparkling Shiraz. Next time you're there try it! They also have an awesome happy hour M-F from 5-7 pm.
author: Linda L.

description:
As of late I'd like to think I've become a wine aficionado. I've been to various wine bars/lounges in the past few weeks (stay tuned for my upcoming wine list) and definitely have the wine scene down to a art form. 
I am also recently well versed (at least I'd like to think so :P ) in domestic as well as foreign wines. ( that whole first paragraphed was said in a very elegant British accent).

Here goes guys:
To quote the great Homer Simpson, this place is Meh. 
The crowed is annoying little rich kids, the venue itself is pretty small and tough to get around when its a little crowded, and the service really needs attention. I dont know this place has almost 300 reviews and 4 stars, really. 

Their wine selection is decent, I've definitely seen better. Their service sucks, oh I think I said that already, and their wine category titles is embarrassing to read out loud, its only funny to make fun of it out loud :P

I had to flag down a waiter for about 10m just to refill my glass of water, and their wine suggesting service (for my friends of course) is really cold. 
Oh and their food isnt anything special either. 

Would I come back here, no sir.
author: Corey W.

description: Good Wine Selection with budget conscious price points combined with a delectible ambience worthy of a romantic evening or even just for a group of wine snob friends who want to show off their newly found 101 knowledge.  Staff honored two yelp deals at one table too which was really cool of him.
author: D K.

description:
A tiny, but very relaxing lounge- great for small groups.  There were only a few tables that accommodated for a larger crowd.  My friend made reservations for a table of six; otherwise, there are more two-seaters and the bar, which makes it a great date spot.   

Great selection of wine...very extensive list, with the option of ordering by the glass or bottle.  My friends ordered the cheesecake and chocolate truffle desserts, both of which were very rich. 

Would definitely come back.
author: Lisa C.

description: Lovely atmosphere and great wine selection. Excellent date spot. I didn't have long to spend there because we were just grabbing a quick pre-dinner drink on our way to a dinner reservation, and I found myself wishing we had longer to spend at Nectar.
author: Meg D.

description:
One of the few civilized wine bar/lounge in the Marina. I love coming here for their "Bad Ass Flight" -Trio of delicious reds. They've also updated their menu with more robust food items to be paired with their wines. 
I always enjoy the artwork and the chill atmosphere here.
author: Mimi T.

description: Really a huge fan. The selection is thoughtful, and the staff and owner are super. We have been here a bunch of times and in the very inconsistent Marina, Nectar is always a friendly, mellow stop.
author: damon k.

description: Eh.  With so many great restaurants and wine bars in San Francisco, especially the Marina, this just isn't my top choice.  Service is just okay, prices are a little high but this coupon definitely helped. Go to Bin 38 if you want more choice and a less pretentious crowd.
author: Margaret F.

description:
This is our favorite wine bar in the area.  Nice selection of wine and a great grilled cheese!

Very friendly and knowledgable service.  Atmosphere is very relaxed.
author: Doran B.

description:
The first time I ever came here I thought the service was snobby and the wine overhyped, even though I'm a huge wine drinker.  But as I have come back several times now I have to say my opinion changed.  I really enjoy their wine, especially the wine flights, they are not only a great value but really good way to try some great wines.

The food is good too, I wouldn't suggest dinner here but a nice snack and drinks or a late night snack.  One of my favorites is the cheese plate with truffled honey, absolutely amazing, the pizzas are good too and the poke.  

Yes it's a great date place but also a great place to just catch up  with friends and hear each other talk.
author: Inga W.

description: Went here for a Gno. As you walk in, you hear some real good old school hip hop music, candles lit, old movies playing, very SF with their art work on the wall and SF giants framed up there too. Love it. As for their wines there were soooo many! I can't even pronounce the name of mine all I know is it had pears, apples, and lemon! It was some kind of white wine. It was yummm!!! As for the cheese plates it was alright! I am not a huge cheese fan but I wanted to give it a try. Their flatbread pizza was real good and truffle popcorn! Big HIT!
author: Jasmine V.

description:
Assorted cheese plate. Assorted salumi plate. Truffle popcorn. Wine, wine and more wine!

Their happy hour really does make you happy. 50% off of all glasses of wine. I kid you not. 

Need I say more?
author: Jenny K.

description: Got a coupon to visit these guys. Nice place but I found the waitress service was pretty basic. Not bad just the minimum.
author: John F.

description: Awesome neighborhood gem! I love this place! Nice friendly staff, good choices of wines and great food!
author: Priya S.

description: LIttle pricey, but there's a good vibe and fun wine. great way to spend some time with friends or on a date
author: Sarah V.

description: High class happy hour. If you want a fancyish place in the Marina to sip on some $7-10 wines (happy hour pricing, regular is more), and some delish truffle popcorn ($7), this is a good spot. It is lacking a TV (maybe takes away from the fancy bar I guess) for sports, but staff is attentive and the wine selection is great. Just be ready to pay $20-40 for a decent 'snack and drink' session.
author: Chuck N.

description:
I had a fantastic evening here last week, and I am already excited to go back.  The setting and decor is posh and sophisticated, but the atmosphere is casual, laid back, and fun.

Even the most well tasted wine-o is bound discover something new and interesting, but a wine novice can have a wonderful time at Nectar also.  Chris, the owner/manager/bartender/som/waiter/bussboy, is crazy friendly and his wine knowledge is through the roof.

We got the "anything but chard" flight of whites and a red flight(forgot name) as well as the little flight bites to accompany them.  Nothing was exorbitantly priced.  I think $15 for the flight and $5 for the bite.  Almost all the wines were obscure varietals and the pairings worked really well.  I should also mention that the menu descriptions are very entertaining.

This place is a must-go for anyone who enjoys drinking wine.
author: Shane G.

description: Great selection of wines by the glass, excellent nibbles available especially the popcorn in truffle oil. Been here a few times and received very attentive and knowledgeable service from the owner who is very much right there at the bar taking care of customers. I particularly like the wine menu offering a price to take the bottle to go, pretty much the same pricing as a wine shop. By far the best wine bar in the Marina, around the corner from the busier Chestnut Street.
author: james b.

description:
The only reason I can't give this place 4-stars is because my boyfriend and I paid over $30 for two glasses of wine (I had bubbly and he had a cabernet), so I know we won't be back anytime soon.

I was impressed with how nice and helpful the staff was though considering the prices on the menu. The bartender really knew his stuff and recommended a great wine for my boyfriend, which was outstanding. I also loved the champagne I got. It was pretty crowded, but overall I really liked the vibe. It's unfortunate that it's so pricey, though. Some Yelp reviewers have mentioned good happy hour deals, though, so perhaps it's better for that.  I'd say this is a good place for dates if you're looking to impress and money isn't an issue. 

Overall a good time (great wine, good atmosphere), but too pricey for me to be a true "fan" of this place.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Great happy hour but can get crowded. Must try the truffle popcorn!
author: Andrea H.

description: Really great wait staff. Showed up to a glass of champagne for a friends birthday. Will be back!
author: Natasha M.

description: First time here.  Service was great. Wine selection was lovely and appetizers were tasty. Would definitely go back.
author: D. K.

description:
This is a great setting to explore wine with friends and loved ones, given the dark, intimate setting. There are 4 flights to choose from (including bubbly) with the most poetic descriptions of the wines ;D After you get a good laugh over the poetic descriptions, if you're a fan of the reds, make sure to kick-start with the bad-ass wine flight. Couple that with the cheese plate, and you'll find yourself in a happy warm haze soon enough. 

Note : I made a reservation for a Saturday evening at 8:30 PM the same day, and was impressed that as soon as we walked through the entrance, the hostess asked my party to follow her to our table. 

This is a great wine stop for locals; however, for non-locals, prepare yourself to spend ample time looking for street parking. Parking in this side of the Marina district can be hell! 

However, the wine flights can make all things better...
author: Jane T.

description:
Amazing happy hour - 1/2 price bottles of wine...are you kidding me - this is M-F and officially my happy hour place of choice.  

I love being able to meet friends there and not feel like I am breaking the bank and we always get to try a new wine.  

Only reason they get a 4 star, I'm feeling tough today - there was a bottle of wine that was apparently the most popular (so they say on a few trips there), then one day it's gone...they said they ran out and weren't going to get anymore....what?  

Great place to meet with girlfriends and gossip or to go with a guy and visit because there is definitely some fun people watching/listening going on there.
author: Tracy S.

description:
I heard great things from Yelp about the Happy Hour at Nectar. The reviews didn't disappoint! 50% off all wines by the glass - how can you complain! Great selection and creative descriptions, I felt I had a real sense of the wine I was going to be drinking. Always a plus! 

I went on a Monday night so not too many people, but we came with a larger group so that was a positive thing. If I went back I'd try  midweek. Cheese plate wasn't my favorite, I prefer more jams accompanied with my cheese. Options were good though. For two glasses of wine, and sharing about three food plates, it was a great deal! 

Only complaints: I wasn't sold on the Happy Hour food menu and I prefer my glasses of wine to be a bit more generous.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Cool vibe, friendly service, I love the truffle pop-corn here.
author: Mayur A.

description:
Yesterday afternoon I took my odd looking crooked face into a wine shop and purchased a case of wine that had a bunch of weird names. I was going for a theme. What kind of theme I don't know, but now I am stuck with case of weird sounding wines resting at my feet.

Since I was killing time and my friend lives around the corner and she was being a slacker and working from home I figured I would drop by and let her buy me dinner. 

She wanted Chinese and I wanted something "cheesy". We decided to compromise and stoped in at Nectar. 

They too have many wines with weird sounding names and also some normal stuff too. Two things I love about Nectar 1. They use the proper glass with the proper varietal and 2. The servers usually have some pretty good insight into what they are pouring. 

The food is also pretty darn good. The menu is not extensive and limited, but there is enough to keep most people interested. We shared a few things and took bites off each other's plates. We started off with a crab and artichoke gratin thing that I loved. The gratin was a little flaky but not too heavy (just like me). 

Then came out a ahi tartare and a mac n cheese. The food paring probably not what most of you foodies would consider ideal, but I was really wanting to try the mac. I like it, but did not love it. maybe I'm used to the Bell Towers truffle mac which is one of my all times favorites. But the ahi I thought was excellent and nice and raw and I could feel the fish flopping in my mouth after each bite. 

For dessert we shared the butterscotch pot de creme. Now I am a big fan of the pot de creme at Town Hall and almost second guessed myself and did not order it. But in the end, we were both glad we did. Excellent dish!

Add one star for the rockstar parking I scored

Minus one star for getting interrupted by my friend and her constant texts from her bf.

Dude! she was my date for the night!
author: V B.

description:
I love living in the East Bay but my happy hour experience here last night made finally want to move to the city so I could be closer to this place and visit every day.  Seriously- 5-7pm 50% off all wines by the glass (maybe the bottle too?  not sure).  The bartender was so courteous, helpful when we needed it, not pretentious at all, and let us curl up in the comfy chairs with our shoes off for 2 1/2 hours.  the wine list has a great blend of whites, sweet wines, and reds of all shapes and sizes, along with humerous descriptions that are helpful while also not letting you take yourself too seriously.  Example: 2006 La Petite Ferme, Cabernet Sauvignon- an offering of dark chocolate studded with black currants & tobacco by an aromatic suede jacket clad erudite gentleman with salt & pepper temples, a silver tongue and slim buttocks.  

6 glasses of wine and $36 saved from the HH special later, my friend and I finally decided we should leave.  My only regret is that I can't go back again tonight.
author: Luthien N.

description: Fun spot with great atmosphere and reasonably priced wine flights with very generous pours! Came here with 2 friends and we each got a different wine flight. We enjoyed reading out loud the cheeky descriptions and sampling each other's wines. Worth the trip.
author: Meg D.

description: Delicious Cheese plate and fun flights of wine...we'll be back to try some more!
author: Garion M.

description:
Nectar is my favorite wine bar in this neighborhood!

The vibe/atmosphere is always perfect. They strike just the right chord between "sit-down meal" and "drop-in-for-a-drink". I get frustrated with overcrowding at places in this neighborhood, but Nectar never feels overwhelming, even though they're always populated. 

The service is fabulous. Everyone at the bar is super knowledgeable and helpful. Every time I have come in, the owner has dropped in at our table to provide recommendations based on our tastes. 

ALSO - try the truffle mac and cheese. You won't regret it.
author: Ash B.

description:
I came here for the first time during HH with a gf.  We got there at 6:30 and found the last two seats at the bar.  I'm not a wine aficionado so we picked our food first, the pizzetta, and let the menu pair the perfect wine, (2008 Babcock, Pinot Noir), with our meal.  The pizza was lovely.  I'm a big fan of thin crust and the portion was perfect.

It was cold outside and the bar, to my surprise was somewhat heated.  Heat was actually radiating from the bar!  LOVE!  My hands were freezing and I warmed up nicely.

The place is super cute and the total for the two of us came to about $26 including tip.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Alright, wasnt really feelin the overpriced drinks and food menu and the place was a little too small. However the waiter was a cool dude and was on point so that helped my outlook on the place. There were these girls that were extremely loud which made the experience annoying, especially on a first date because I hate have to yell to have a conversation. Not the bar's fault tho. Overall it was middle of the road in my opinion but I am picky.
author: Mr. O.

description:
Gotta say -- we don't know this neighborhood well -- so I was checking online reviews as we walked thru the Marina... We couldn't get into 3 other places close by (but we could walk right into Nectar, which is telling).

Service was poor, we didn't get the food we ordered and when we inquired and said go ahead and cancel the food (as we were long since done with our wine) we got the food we ordered... buy only 1 of the 2 plates.  Both waiters/bartenders seemed a lot more interested in taking care of people at the bar, rather than the 6 or 8 tables in the back.  The wine was fine, can't complain about that... but the service, all around, was just terrible.  Definitely not recommending... and in hindsight, I see why we were able to get a seat here -- and nowhere else close by.  Skip it... wait in line to get in somewhere else.


----
UPDATE:
I will say that the owner reached out, per my review, and offered free wine as an "apology" for our bad experience.  That's a nice touch, to correct the situation.
author: Chris O.

description: I'm a sucker for art. Simplicity is bliss. The waitress who assisted us at first suggested a dessert and sold me on the idea of how pleased my taste buds would be once I've devoured the product. Excited, I figured it was being prepared but it turns out she ended up forgetting to place the order I'm guessing. She never mentioned it again. Couldn't tell you how it was unfortunately. I believe it was the owner who assisted us in between but his knowledge of the products and sample tastings were greatly appreciated. He even upgraded my wine glass at no extra cost. So that made up for the mishap. I would recommend their Saracco (Moscato) if you have a sweet tooth. Very subtle and refeshing. Best moscato I've ever had.
author: P H.

description:
When I think of what a true Wine Bar Lounge should be I think of the following questions first: 

1st, are most wine regions represented on the menu? 
2nd, is there a lounge area and a sit down bar area? 
3rd, do they offer wine flights? 
4th, is the staff knowledgeable and patient with there responses to customers that may not know a lot about wine or the region they wish to try?
5th, do they offer many delicious dishes to pair with the wine?  

Guess what? Nectar is a 'Yes' on all of my top 5 criteria of 'are you really truly a quintessential Wine Bar'.

The bartenders are always helpful and knowledgeable! The place is classy and cozy at the same time; open design yet feels intimate if you are on a date. The prices are higher then some of the other Wine bars however, I still come here when I can and I love it!
author: Kristina A.

description: I've visited about five times and its always been a relaxing experience. The flatbreads are very fresh and the wine list is approachable yet adventurous.
author: SiliconValleyShoeGirl L.

description:
This is such a cute place (perfect for dates!). Definitely caters to an older crowd. I arrived at 6:55 pm (and happy hour ends at 7 pm), but there were no seats. I asked the waiter if I can still order for happy hour specials if I don't get seated by 7 pm, and they said it's totally fine. Cool! 

But when we sat down, we sadly found out we can order only ONE drink at a time, so our happy hour special was only for one glass of wine (also 1/2 off of GLASSES of wine, NOT bottles!!). We also decided to order some food. We got the macaroni, ahi tuna, and I got the gnocchi. We were hungry and they were small portions. It was good, nothing crazy, but sadness because we were still hungry haha. 

Con: parking sucks! I think I spent at least 15 minutes looking for parking.
author: Diana L.

description:
The wine selection is great! The place is fun and homey. It's small and they always project a film on the wall, so try and sit on the same side as the bar. The food is also very good, but a tad bit overpriced.

This is a fun happy hour spot - but definitely girly. It's not a place I feel like I can stay for long, because it's small and I feel like I am taking over a table that could be used. 

But overall good wine, good food, relaxing place.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Nectar Wine Lounge is a super creative, cute, and fun little spot in the Marina. We decided to try two different wine flights so that we could overwhelm our palates with variation. We decided to go with the Badass Reds and the Anything But Whites. Wow, so many good flavors! The best part about their wines are the descriptions. We spoke with the guy that wrote the descriptions, and he explained that he wanted to go above and beyond...or simply mock normal wine bars. (Along the lines of- roll down a hill into a bush of violets while rain glistens off your fingertips. Love it.) Well, if anything it helped our experience because I could tell that he really thought about it while writing them. If not, then geez...because they helped us identify new tastes and have fun while consuming them. We even decided to write descriptions of our own, which is always fun. We also tried the Black Truffle Popcorn...and omg was it delish! I soo need to come back and try more of their wines and snacks. 
Definitely one of my new favorite spots in the city!
author: Sonya D.

description: I do like this place. Always a relaxed atmosphere. Good service. Nice wine flights. Fun to sit with friends, drink wine, eat cheese and salumi's,. What can be better?
author: tom m.

description:
I've been living in the Marina for 2.5 years and I finally went to Nectar last week.... and sadly, I was not impressed.

The ambiance is nice, there is plenty of seating, and the service was good. But the wine itself was terrible. I ordered the Anything But Chardonnay flight and I disliked all three wines. The two friends I was with also hated all of their wine. 

So disappointing....
author: Julie V.

description: I remember seeing the business plan for Nectar Wine Lounge nearly 10 years ago from a wine club friend we used to dine with on various occasions.  Great spot... and it has def-ly changed since it first opened.  Ambiance is different as well... Cute wine bar in the Marina; wine list is good and the small bites are tasty.  I do recommend this place.
author: Uyen N.

description:
After reading some of these other reviews, I guess I hit Nectar on a bad night.  Our server was not great; she did not tell us the kitchen was out of one of the dishes we ordered until after they stopped serving food, plus she was not very informed on the wine list.  

normally, I'd try to forgive these things and give Nectar another chance, but two things are preventing me: 1) the wine and food I did try were just ok, nothing to really pull me back in, and 2) the descriptions on the wine list are ridiculous little stories that tell you very little about the actual taste of the wines, which I found really off-putting.  so, sorry Nectar, I don't think I'll be back.
author: Katie P.

description: It was a little noisier than I expected, but no more than most night spots like this. Was pretty chill for a Saturday night and not too crowded. The wine was great. The flights are the way to go. The staff was super friendly and eager to share info about the wines. Just a heads up, not many tables, mostly bar-type seating.
author: Tom H.

description:
Nectar is one of my favorite Wine Lounges in the city! I've gone here once on a Friday night and another time on a Saturday night and both times were really great.

The first time I went to Nectar, I sat at a table closer to the back and the second time, my gf and I sat at the bar. This wine lounge has a very cozy feel to it. They play good music and is a great place to go with a few friends when you feel like hanging out and trying some wine. Sitting at the bar was a much more personal experience. The bartender there was very knowledgeable about the wine and told us that they actually are a retailer as well, so you can buy bottles of wine from them if you like it. All the wine I've tried at Nectar has always been good. I've tried the red flight there as well as a couple of other wines.

Food-wise, I've tried their mac 'n cheese, tuna tartare, and salmon flatbread. I am a huge fan of both the mac 'n cheese and the flatbread, but not so impressed with the tuna tartare. I've definitely had better tartare at other places. 

I can't wait to go back!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Update: My most recent experience did not improve my initial impression. I came with a group of five girls on a Friday evening. What should have tipped me off was that the place was half empty, although with a group of this size it seemed like a blessing at the time. 

Pros:
- An extensive wine list (plus a star)
- Menu has expanded (plus a star)

Cons:
- The service was horrendous. They must have been short at least two people, as we sat for nearly 30 minutes without service. Our drink order was taken, then another 20 minutes passed before the bottle of wine appeared. (minus a star)
- Our food came out sporadically, and it was clear this was not intended. We ordered five dishes--the first two came together, then the third appeared, followed by the fourth. A full half hour after the first two dishes arrived, the fifth plate arrived...cold. (minus a star)
- We had to take our bill to the bar, as our credit cards sat for 15 minutes without being acknowledged. (minus a star)

Overall, great food and wine are overshadowed by slow service. If the service had been good, we likely would have ordered more than two bottles of wine in the three hours we spent there.
author: Jenn G.

description:
Good place for a nice glass of wine and a tasty bite.  The vibe is lively and just loud enough to avoid hearing your neighbor's drunken conversations. 
The food was good, I had the Duck Confit and it was perfect...served without starch other than French lentils (I am anti-starch!) I would have bestowed 4 stars if not for the fact that one person's food came out about 10 minutes before the rest of the party and that is always awkward.
author: Nilu r.

description:
It begins with atmosphere. It's warm and inviting. Next the owner Christopher who served us happens to be one of the nicest people you'll meet. He was warm friendly and offered us some free wine for us to sample and gage our opinion. 

Tuesday are 50% off bottle nights and I have to say it's a steal. We had a had the sterling reserve cab, and it was delicious. A $90 bottle for $45, was well appreciated. We also had a platter of tasty  salami and cheese, a perfect for a peckish appetite.
author: Jean Francois K.

description:
First time at Nectar...came on a Saturday night with a girlfriend and we had a great time. Couple of great pro's

1) Good wine list! I noticed there was a retail price next to each wine and puzzled I asked about it. Who writes the retail price next to the restaurant bottled price so people know how much more they're paying to drink in house??!?...The bartender informed me that they actually sell wines there as well so if you taste a wine you enjoy, they'll sell it to you for the much lower retail price...never experienced that before...can you say AWESOME?!? (also love how they present the bottle in front of you and leave it there while you wine taste so you can inspect and read the labeling to become more familiar with the particular wine)

2) Service-speedy, personal, and fun. Our bartender Alex was awesome, incredibly knowledgeable and helpful with the wine list. It was our first time there but we felt like regulars. He was funny, engaging, and personable. Later when these guys tried to talk to me and my gf...he and the other staff made sure we were okay. Everyone there was great, protective yet not intrusive, and made the experience a really enjoyable one. 

3) Food-we just tried the ahi tartare and salmon flatbread. Salmon flatbread was a tasty light treat that complements the wine pretty well. Can't say I'm a fan of the ahi tartare. I personally love ahi tartare but it didn't taste very fresh, too chewy, and not very flavorful. I heard the mac'n'cheese is great but we were going light that night.

4) Ambiance-great. Good music, good bar seating, plenty of cozy tables and couches for more privacy. Good place to sip wine at a bar, go on a date, or bring a group of friends to socialize.

Overall-loved it. The service, the wine, the ambiance....all excellent and would definitely come back again.
author: stephanie c.

description: This is a cute date night spot, a little loud. My boyfriend and I came here last week for drinks. He ordered the bacon wrapped dates and a velvety Cabernet Sauvignon. I had the bubbles flight and a carmel fudge dessert. The dates received a raving review, and the dessert was a beautiful finish. The red wine was a little heavy for me, strong in tannins. The flight was good too, I enjoyed 2/3. One has a burnt honey and old wood flavor, the others were subtle, enjoyable, but not memorable. For a bubbles enthusiast, visit Mumm winery in Napa.
author: Katie K.

description:
marina wine bar and lounge...small/medium sized dim and cozy location...easy conversations over wine...quite the friday night crowd...servicing still professional and courteous...orders taken....two bad assed reds flights $thirteen each...south american flights $fourteen...three generous pour tastings...pinot grigio glass $nine...

single choice of pinot grigio by the glass...unfamiliar name and a try...an earthy unsweetened taste...still crisp, but dull aftertaste...a poor choice....sampling of bad assed flight...quite fitting the name...in a negative way...each generous tasting unpleasant tasting...names not remembered from explanation and unknown...same problems with south american flights....bland or leaving a acidic cringe...seven wines and seven not liking...almost a bad two-buck-chuck experience multiplied by seven...$fifty-three.sixty-six and $ten tip...$sixty-three.sixty-six total...pricing lower in comparison in pours...great atmosphere, but a gamble on lower priced wines....house advantage....
author: Hen A.

description:
I needed a venue to celebrate my 23rd Birthday in style. Since I have an insatiable love for wine I went hunting for the perfect wine bar for my special night. I checked out a few venues, but I knew as soon as I spoke with Chris on the phone at Nectar, that this was the place for me. They were totally accommodate with my ideas and my meticulous requests from the beginning. 

Being my particular self, I choose all of the wine to be served in advance. I also picked out a few bites like the truffle popcorn and cheese pizzas. The best part was the huge cheese and fruit board that Nectar put together for us. 4-5 different types of cheeses, almonds and crackers. Wine was served to us all night and the reserved front area was the perfect space for our 12-14 people. 

The wine lists changes frequently and nearly all of their bottles are in the $35-50 range. The food is great and totally reasonable. I really enjoyed the space and the service.
author: Theresa T.

description:
As non-Marinistas, we look in on these streets with total curiosity. Why would one short block be lined with 8 unique restaurants piled on top of each other? Fascinating!

We wanted to wine and dine and the dine part fell short. There isn't enough food to pair with all the great wines. 

If it's intended to be a wine bar that focuses on the bottles, the ambiance is mismatched. This is a place that can get loud when it's packed and in order to huddle in closer with friends or a first date to hear each other, something beyond cheese plate and salad could go a long way!

If wine and a socialite room is what you seek, I'd agree you should go there. Give yourself 20 mins lag time for the parking karma gods to work something out for you if you decide to drive.

We loved the gentleman who helped us and how I wish I could give him a shot out here. :( Forgot your name, but not your awesome service - you were a total five star.
author: Shanta J.

description: Great, lively restaurant. The food was good and awesome wine selections. Nice ambiance.
author: Haze C.

description:
My favorite happy hour of all (5-7pm)... half price amazing glasses of wine plus truffle popcorn. Whaaaat?!?

Not the largest space and suboptimal for large groups and privacy (can always tell when the stranger sitting next to me is leaning closer to listen in), but tastefully decorated and I've always been happy with the service. 

Yes, it is in the Marina, so stop complaining about Marina peeps already. What's more annoying than douchebags is people who constantly complain about douchebags in Yelp reviews of businesses who happen to be in the Marina/Cow Hollow/Pac Heights.

It's about the wine, peeps. Focus.
author: Shawn C.

description:
This place is set up really nicely... very chic. Their wine cellar in the back is pretty huge, but their selection is only so-so. Very comfortable place to hang out.. unless you have a back problem.. those chairs have NO support! They are all cushion! I was here with two friends, we each tried a different flight of three wines. For the most part, they were very enjoyable. One of the wines in my flight was missing, so they substituted it for a petit sirah, which I am not a fan of, so I requested a change, which they were happy to fulfill.

The staff is full of pretty nice people, and some of the usual patrons are pretty nice, as well. I had a chance to talk to a few people there. Definitely a nice place to check out if you like to try out new wines. Though some of their prices can be a bit crazy.
author: Vincent D.

description: I loved the server whom was also the bartender! He ran around and did a great job of interacting just enough with me and my friend, the clients ;) As I am just visiting SF I really enjoyed the service in such a busy city!
author: Ashton W.

description: My boyfriend and I went here this past Saturday for a brunch date.  It was a beautiful day so we were lucky enough to snag a table outside.  Chris, the owner, was very pleasant and helpful!  He took his time explaining all of the drinks and gave us great recommendations for food!  I started off with the "True Blood" mimosa.  It was delicious!  To eat, I had the breakfast pizza with prosciutto, burrata and spinach.  It was fantastic!  My man had the breakfast pizza with pesto and tomatoes.  It was equally as good!  I would recommend this place to anyone!  Great ambiance and terrific service!  I look forward to my next trip to Nectar Wine Lounge!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Fun. Chill hip hop. Good looking crowd. 20% off any wines if you buy 6 or more. 20% off retail bottles. Cool. Waitstaff were really nice and friendly.

The descriptions of the wines on the menu are really superb and I really enjoyed reading them.

Pinot noir flight and bubbles (champagne) flight were both fun. Made me reconsider ordering wine flights. Tough to get a seat for more than a few friends gathering. Was worth the wait though. I hope they rotate the art in there :P good art can keep me in at a spot like this. Ended up heading over to the Haight for more "color" to finish off the night.

I agree with a couple other reviews that it's a great place to start off the night. Somehow doesn't have what I need to spend the whole night or end the night - can't quite put my finger on what it is missing though.
author: Eric P.

description: We love this place! The happy hour is great, and we just had brunch on Saturday.  They recently paired up with Thrive Juicery, so they have delicious fresh squeezed juices to make mimosas with - we had a flight of all three mimosas, which were really unique and way better than your standard orange juice and bubbles.  The owner, Chris, is so nice and always happy to talk wine and food.  Definitely one of our favorites!
author: Hana D.

description: Great atmosphere to enjoy a fantastic glass of wine and nibble on little bites. You should stop in Monday-Friday from 5-7pm for happy hour. 50% off all glasses of wine and specials on food as well. Friendly and knowledgeable staff working behind the counter. They also had some great art work on the walls done by a local artist.
author: Ian C.

description:
Half off wines by the glass? YES PLEASE!

Monday through Friday between 5pm and 7pm any wine by the glass is half off...which means I got an amazing Reisling for $6. The glasses were poured with a heavy hand too. Fantastic.

It's a nice little space too. It feels more like you are in your living room having a drink than at a wine bar. The chairs are really comfortable with little tables between.

I'm not sure I would suggest this as a dinner place but definitely a great place to catch up with an old friend over a delicious glass of wine.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Generous FLIGHT portions! 

Wine and cheese.. Yes, please. Last minute, spur of the moment with some great friends. Luckily we had no wait. 

My drink of choice-- Flights! I had the Santa Barbara Flight; a taste of 3 of Santa Barbara's best. A "taste" may be an understatement since they were quite generous on the portions, but who's complaining?!

My suggestion-- Anything But Chard Flight.

Our snack of choice-- combo of 3 cheese & salami platter, black truffle popcorn, buratta salad, pizzetta.

All in all, a fantastic night! And I'm thirsty for more. Between 3- flights, that's 9 glasses in all and the food above, we each paid $40 (3 person). I say that's a steal especially for the amount of wine they gave us.
author: Gerard B.

description: Nice atmosphere. Decent wine. Salad was drenched and the sofa wasn't the most comfortable. Used the $10 for 20 deal.
author: Matt M.

description: We have been here a few times for their amazing happy hour, but went recently for their Saturday brunch. It was phenomenal! The breakfast pizzetta was a great dish and the house made juice bread was a great way to start. We also did the Good and Evil (a bottle of champagne, and all three of the freshly made juices they offer). The whole thing made for a great start to the Saturday. The wine lounge is cozy and has great decor! You will not be disappointed by the service either. We had a great time with the owner, Chris, and he could not have made it a better experience. I am pretty lazy and don't usually take the time to write a review, but this place deserves the time! We were very happy with everything, and strongly recommend this place to anyone!
author: Chris M.

description: Attended a private event last night at Nectar. Both the wine and food was amazing. The prosecco and Malbec  were delightful and the flatbreads were savory. I'll try one of the wine flights the next time.
author: Shannon B.

description: Great cheese plate. Good service. I think there were more dishes I wanted to try but its a little hard to get to the Marina for me. We live in the Castro and parking is harder in the Marina than we are used to. The truffle popcorn was really good though.
author: Chris Y.

description: Nice spot.  Had the champagne flight which was tasty. Flatbread pizza was just OK. Nice environment but nothing spectacular... especially for the prices they charge.  I don't live in the area and I would not make the drive again from the South Bay to come here.
author: Jason B.

description:
Love it!
Arrive early for the best seats and give yourself  time to sample their champagne flights. Tuesday are the best night  Happy hour 5-7pm 50% off all wines by the glass.Appetizers olives cheese and the menu changes often .Try their black truffle popcorn which is delicate and yummy.
author: Susie C.

description:
I love this place -- and not because they have amazing half-off wine deals during the week, or because of their outside seating (a rarity in this neighborhood), and not even because of their tasty appetizer pizzas and super-friendly service...the top reason? I've left my iPhone charger no less than five times here and it's always there safe and sound behind the counter when I return (head hung low) the next day. 

Note: beware of rogue strollers that crowd the interior -- moms love bringing babies to wine bars - don't get it.
author: Somer F.

description:
Nectar is worth a visit just for their descriptions of the wines. They're like horoscopes crossed with the J Peterman catalog. 

Another plus is that the place rarely gets super crowded.
author: Ranjit S.

description: This place was an awesome little find. We got in on a Yelp deal of $10 for $20. The menu selection is great and the price is really fair. The owner was really friendly and personable and he would make good conversation with you. The atmosphere was really nice and it would be an awesome night for a chill Friday or Saturday night.
author: David S.

description:
oh i love this place and come here very often.
Great place. Awesome wine and champagne samplers. Good looking crowd and great location since after few too many drinks you can walk around to the nearest places.
I had a beets salad last time with my champagne sampler and it was really good - oh we also had the flatbread pizza things.
They also serve olives, cheese with wine.
Very creative wording on sampler wines (hint*flight).
I am not a wine snob. i just know what i like when i taste it and i have not been disapointed coming here for their wine.

I will be back here again. I introduced many of my friends to this place and they are all fans.

Cheers,
author: C A.

description:
1. parking sucks around here 
2. cool, trendy joint
3. lots of wine choices
4. trying too hard
5. maybe pretentious
6. gave us the small water glasses, while all the Douches and Miss Douchettes got the large water glasses
7. expensive as fuck
8. had to ask them to bring bill
9. had to ask them to take bill
10. not that special. fuck it.
author: Rick H.

description:
My new favorite wine bar in the marina. Located within a few blocks of Bin38 and Wine Merchant, this establishment has far exceeded my expectations. 

Very quaint atmosphere, ample seating, a great selection of wine and the food menu is unbelievable. Personally, I am a fan of the Beer list which, in true Nectar style, features some tasty, unique Beers which I have never seen anywhere else. 

Staff is amazing, friendly and accommodating and would highly recommend this place for a glass, bottle or case of wine !
author: Rob H.

description:
I am a big fan of this place.  The staff is welcoming, warm and acutely aware of making their customers' wine tasting experience worthwhile.  As you walk in, the lighting consists of a soft hue from the candles against the brown suede background of the couches and chairs.  The art on the wall serves as fantastic conversation pieces.  Since this is a wine bar, one could easily expect that the menu consists of only California varietals.  Not the case, there are many great labels from around the world.  The best way to introduce yourself to this place is via one of their flights of wine.  

There are about 20 tables and when it is crowded share a larger table with others and relax.  The best time to visit this place is during the week, it can get crowded on the weekend.
author: Richard R.

description:
I came here on a date a few weeks ago and I was less than impressed.

It's not surprising, because my overall view of the Marina is thus: The Marina thinks the Marina is the best part of San Francisco. I forget I'm in San Francisco when I'm in the Marina. I hate forgetting I'm in San Francisco.

It took us 20 minutes to order wine, even though we were seated at the bar, the place was busy but not packed, and we were quite obviously ready for quite awhile to order our drinks. The bartender was friendly enough, but after 3 go rounds of "I'm getting to you next" we lost our steam.

There are far better wine bars in this city. In far better and less pretentiously lost in 1994 neighborhoods.
author: Rachel F.

description: Great place for wine with a cool vibe. But food is average
author: David B.

description:
My work computer blocks me from having access to the website, so it has to be good.

Great wine bar in a cool setting.  The space is long and lean, with a lot of dark wood and original artwork.  You can sit comfortably at the bar (I would not feel awkward drinking alone here), or meet up with friends at a table for a relaxed evening.  Mature crowd, and by that I do not mean old, I mean not immature.

Thanks to Suzanne B, I went to Nectar last night for a tasting featuring "Pinots from the Sonoma Coast" and had a marvelous time.  Not only was the wine delicious, but the pours were generous, and the prices were extremely reasonable (under $25 for most).  Our two favorites were from Copain and Elizabeth Spencer, but I honestly liked all of the wines that we tasted.

Aside from the Hidden Vine, I don't know when I've had such attentive service.  Our server paced the tasting very well, and gave detailed descriptions of each sampling, in a very friendly and personable way.  The manager also came over a lot, and was genuinely interested in what we thought.  It was almost as though we were guest of a good friend who collects wine and was excited to share his latest finds.  

I ordered the seared ahi, and it was a perfect for a light dinner.  The ahi was tender and peppery, and it came with a green bean & potato salad that was fresh and crunchy.  The portion was ample.

I enjoyed perusing the wine menu with its clever, colorful and very original descriptions .  It's refreshing to read something other than jammy, berry, smoky, and big for a change.  

I will definitely be back, and that's saying a lot about a Marina joint.

UPDATE 12/06:  Upping my rating to 5-Stars.  Beef Cheeks on Truffled Mashed Potatoes + Yummy Cheese Plate + Bad-Ass Red Flight + Free Glass of Sparkling Shiraz = + 1 Star!  Having a great time laughing with Suzanne B. on a Monday night, Priceless.
author: Liz S.

description:
I have three favorite wine bars in San Francisco.  Why three you ask?  Well, it's sort of like having several pairs of black shoes.  Lace-up patent leather stiletto boots and demure Mary-Jane pumps usually work best with different outfits or moods.  I find the same is true with wine bars.  I have one for when I want quiet enjoyment with friends, one for that romantic evening when I don't want to pick my own wines and one for when I feel festive and fun.  Nectar is my festive and fun choice.
 
I've come to Nectar on several occasions, often for the special wine flight tasting nights, and have been extremely impressed.  The tasting flight evenings are often paired with visits from the actual winemakers, which is a big treat.  The wine list lends itself to build-your-own flights since the number of wines available by taste or glass is extensive --- and I would come just to read the wine descriptions alone, they are so ornate, funny and over the top!

Oh, and those 'tasting' pours...um, these are not your 1 ounce pours folks, but a serious mouthful that lets you really experience the wine!

The staff really knows their stuff, too, and all are willing to give you the time to describe and/or recommend, even when it's busy.  Their knowledge of the wine list and the food menu is fantastic --- I can (and do) trust any recommendations they offer.  

And sign up for the emails from Anton - be sure to scroll to the bottom of each and read the cheeky notes.  I think I know who wrote the wine descriptions...
author: Suzanne B.

description:
Ok.  When you think of the Marina, you don't necessarily think of quality.  When you think of a lounge in the Marina, you think of the center of hell.  I get it.  

With that said, however, Nectar has continued to surprise me with its un-center-of-hellishness.  Unlike its competitor around the corner (Wine Merchant), it is spacious with comfortable places to sit.  Even when Chestnut, and every bar in the surrounding area, is packed, this place is tucked away on Steiner St. with plenty of seating.  And speaking of seating, the place is scattered with big over-stuffed arm chairs that you can sink into while sipping red out of a big beautiful glass.  

The biggest surprise offered by Nectar, though, was the food.  I went last night with my husband for an after-work glass of wine or three, and ordered for the first time off of their dinner menu.  I had the pork tenderloin, which was CRAZY good.  For a place whose focal point is wine, the quality of the food threw me for a loop.  Very small portions - but that's the intention.  Just meant to give you something small to enjoy that brings out the flavors in your wine.  Pork tenderloin with a potato terrine, wilted spinach and cranberry was only $10.50.  It was the perfect compliment to my wine.  Afterwards, we had a cheese plate.  My only complaint is that they have pretty boring cheeses on their cheese plate.  All very mild cow's and goat's milk cheeses.  No blues at all.  

An all-around cozy place to unwind.  Lots of pros, but two cons:  1.  It's in the Marina, and 2.  The cheese thing...cause I like blue cheese.  

They have a Morgan "Twelve Clones" Pinot Noir right now that is really great, by the way.  Go.  Tell me what you think.
author: Lauren S.

description: I kinda forgot about this place until a friend invited me to go next time I'm up in the City. This place is not that big but makes up size in the form of an extensive wine selection. Similar to Vintage Wine Bar on santana row, the place is welcoming and has a cozy environment.....definitely a good stop for a refreshing glass of pinot grigio or rieseling (sp?).
author: Joey C.

description:
The Marina incarnation of this wine bar doesn't have that je ne se quoi the Burlingame counterpart has.  It has a similar menu.  Mushroom pot pies, cheese plates, superfluous descriptions of never-miss wines, but it falls a few steps short of the magic available at Nectar Burlingame (see ROTD http://www.yelp.com/biz/nectar-wine-lounge-burlingame#hrid:7vtDlrqo36ATeejahQlG3g).  

The area and the weather are normally beautiful, as in Burlingame, but the main accoutrement  they lack is the windows that open up the world outside, while still keeping you safely tucked away inside the wine bar.  Nothing like people watching on a Sunday afternoon in Nectar Burlingame.  Yet I digress. 

On a blustery night in the Marina with a group of wonderful ladies, I had a very nice time.  There's something to be said about the clientele at Nectar that the group stayed only the lovely ladies.  No unwanted additions to who have just found their way out of the primordial ooze and into the first bar they spooted (see Orson review http://www.yelp.com/biz/orson-san-francisco#hrid:oa85SKxq8GqIt5yF0euYLA).

A place I can be classy and buzzed.  I love it.
author: Shelley H.

description:
What a great place!  Nectar has an upscale yet cozy atmosphere and a great wine selection. I had a bold Argentinian red and my date had the ros.  
To be specific: 2006 Amancaya, Cabernet Sauvignon/Malbec from
Mendoza, Argentina and the 2006 Le St. Andre, Ros  from Provence, France

This is a great place to come after a nice dinner and talk with your date.  The big plush chairs are big enough for two.

I can't wait to go back for their upcoming feature of wines from Spain.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I'm into the whole wine bar revolution that has descended upon SF in the past few years. yes, i'm really into wine. i love wine. wine wine wine. i could give up drinking except for wine. seriously. 

last night i checked out Nectar (love the name of this place...hot!) after a special movie screening of 'The Great Debaters' at Presidio theater. Nectar was privately opened to us after the film, so i can't speak much for a regular night there. they had a wonderful selection of 4 or so wines (me=pinot noir) and they served small bits of food that complimented the wine perfectly. cozy/sexy feel to the place and beautiful art to compliment the space...next time i find myself in the marina (which admittedly is not often) i would return for sure.
author: Isabel C.

description:
Nice place, very very good food, lovely leather chairs, soft yellow light... but the service was painfully slow every time I've been here, so minus one star.

I come back for the food and wine... which says a lot for a restaurant, now that I think about it..
author: Liza P.

description:
I came here when it first opened and it was empty.  They have managed to fill the space which makes it a nice place to hang out and get some decent atmosphere.  It isn't loud, and they have a great bar area as well as comfy chairs and lounging areas.  I liked the bartop which was glass.

The wine list is extensive and unique.  They also have flights.  The glasses are decent which is key.

This has become my favorite wine bar.  Their glass list is incrediblely diverse and they have small pours called a taste.  You can try different wines without getting tipsy.  The wine descriptions are a bit heavy handed but hey no one is perfect.

A good place for an intimate conversation with a friend.
author: apple r.

description:
UPDATE:  The business recently contacted me about this review and offered their apologies for the bad timing.  It is nice to know they care so much about the business.  The jury is still out, though, on whether I will try going there one more time.   I'll think about it.  

***

What's the deal?  I have tried and failed to experience this place on two separate occasions.  The first time we were chased off because it was later in the night and I guess they wanted to wrap things up for the night. (update:  in their note, they explained that this was because of the restrictions on their liquor license). The second time, a reality TV dating show was being filmed there and the proprietors couldn't be bothered to accommodate us (note: they apologized for not better explaining what was going on that night to us).   Bad timing?  Maybe.  But in life, everything is timing, isn't it?  And in a city like SF where there is so much competition for my business I am hard pressed to give someplace a third chance.
author: sarah k.

description:
Simple, elegant, warm and inviting.  

Extensive wine and champagne and drink menu.  Short and simple food offerings but all of it delicious.  They have small little snacks to nibble on, salads and sandwiches, all paired with recommended wines.

They have weekly wine tastings where the winery comes in and discusses the wines, and where you can taste a flight for a reasonable price, and buy the wines at a discounted price.  

Love the atmosphere in here, and the staff and service is excellent!
author: Denise B.

description:
Had a fabulous time at Nectar last night.  Normally I am not a Marina crowd kind of girl, but Nectar was a pleasant surprise.  Attracting a slightly older crowd than the typical early-20s bunch in the Marina really helps.  

Besides two specific wines we wanted to try, we put 4 additional tastes into the hands of the bartender (and maybe partial owner?).  He gave us some wonderful tastes, we weren't sure we liked the Malbec, so he replaced it with an Italian wine.  Absolutely delicious and only $20 a bottle retail, so I bought one.  Although I have to say, I'm not sure I came home with the right bottle because I distinctly remember the wine being a long Italian name starting with an 'N', but that's not what I have at home now.  I'm sure this bottle will be great as well.

The gnocchi and beet salad were pretty good.  Salad was a bit over-dressed, but tasty nonetheless.  Also, I HIGHLY recommend the butterscotch pot de creme with the Hungarian dessert wine they had.  Coming from someone that just really doesn't like dessert, this is really a big compliment.  

I wish Nectar were closer to where I lived, as I would definitely frequent it, but being so far out in the Marina is a bit of a deterrent.  He might be opening up a new place in FiDi, so I early await it.
author: Olivia T.

description:
Oh, the Marina....again I find myself here...luckily, I have more shit to talk.

Nectar is the only bar in this neighborhood where three chicks can meet for a glass of wine and not be approached, harassed, annoyed, stalked, pulled in ten different direction by aging frat boy types. Rather refreshing if you're already stewing in the conformist soup that is the Marina.

Wine flights are $13-$18, which is very reasonable. The service people, however, were literally breathing down our necks the entire time. I guess we weren't looking at the menu fast enough nor guzzling our wine in that aggressive Marina-cougar fashion. The servers interrupted conversation about every three minutes. I wish I had one of those fly squatters....

Otherwise, this place is superb.
author: Carrie R.

description:
This was my second visit to Nectar.  The first visit was about 6 months ago and I wasn't too impressed.  Although, I now believe that had a lot to do with the company I was with (an ex who turned out to be a major A-hole, so I now realize that I was probably surrounded by all kinds of negative energy on that first visit).   

However, tonight I was in good company, with one of my best girlfriends, and we had a really nice experience.  Our server, Alex, was so knowledgeable, professional, attentive, nice and just an over all delight.  The bar wasn't too crowd, but just enough where we didn't feel like we were the only ones there.  The wine selection was really diverse and extensive and those that we did partake in were great, and the food we ordered (the portobello flat bread pizza) to accompany our wine was very delicious and quite complementary.  The music was nice and appropriate for the ambiance.  Overall, a great experience.  I will definitely return!

Oh, and if all this isn't enough... Nectar has the most creative wine descriptions I've ever read.  Whoever pens them has a wild imagination!
author: Ms. M. M.

description:
This place was amazing. Caught up with a friend there was in town. The owner was amazing, new everything there was to know. We spent about 4 hours there and just told the him to bring the next glass of whatever he thought we should have. 

I will definitely be back.
author: allan d.

description:
This place is awesome. They have an incredible wine list..im a fan of sweet wine..so I def went with riesling. 
The truffle popcorn was tasty.
author: Rose W.

description:
What a first class place. I love everything about it. But make sure to get a reservation, as it is small. Speaking of small,  I love the small plates. So many yummy things to try. Also a really good value. Not small however is the wine list!! Lots of interesting and fun bottles to try and so little time!! And did I mention the great staff?
Great date and special occasion place.

Update 9/3/06
I have been back several times now and this place is just amazing! The staff (Jennifer) is great and they really make you feel special. You have to check this place out!!

Update 4/11/2007
Hate to say it, but service has gone down. The last time I was here, I sat at a table for over 15 mins and no one acknowledged me! I ended up walking out.  Total bummer :o(
Place has gone from 5 stars to 3.
author: Lisa A.

description:
I went to Nectar after a great wine class for my birthday and was pleasantly surprised to find the wine flight to be smart and well designed.  The place was pretty dead though, which seemed odd to me considering its location and price points in the Marina.  

I'd recommend Nectar for a glass of wine before dinner.  Afterwards head over to A-16 for a juicy filet and some more vino.
author: John M.

description:
nectar has been one of my go-to's in the neighborhood because of the extensive wine list and HH menu but after last night i won't be returning. i've always had great bartenders and servers but last night someone new was running the show. after being ignored at a table for 15 mins (not a busy night), he finally came up with waters and a wine list. once my friend joined, we were asking about certain wines on the list- instead of describing we got a douchey "well it's amazing, otherwise it wouldn't be on the list". um, i'm sorry, but really?! at any decent wine bar in SF they will give you a run down. this happened with both of the wines we ordered. later, while he came to drop off our app, my friend and i were checking our work emails and he made a rude comment about how "we'd have more fun if we actually talked to each other". thanks for the unsolicited advice. to top off our night, when it came down to paying the bill, he didn't think the tip we left was "good enough" (we did actually mis-calc) so he came back and asked if "we were really going to leave such a bad tip" forgetting to hand me back my card. 

thanks nectar, it's been a great run but after that experience with your entitled, lame staff, i think i've had enough.
author: Lynelle R.

description:
I love this place.  They have a great and ever changing wine list and a truly great sommelier to help you navigate.  Alex is not just incredibly knowledgeable, he's so genuinely excited about wine that it's infectious.  This has become our "happy place".  If The Captain and I are senselessly bickering at each other we go over to Nectar and we've usually forgotten about it before the first sip.  Alex really loves everything that he's recommending and wants you to love it too.  So far, he's never let us down.  We just walk in and put ourselves in his hands as he puts glasses in front of us.  

It's a lot more "glass and chrome" and, well, Marina-ish, than Hotel Biron, but Alex makes you feel like you're visiting a friend who happens to have a lot of wine.   And he's a virgo.
author: P J.

description:
Smart, witty, hillarious and sexy! No, I am not talking about the writing for Sex in the City, I'm talking about Nectar's wine descriptions...

"Sultry eyes which smolder into your palate, with subtle hits of cherry and raspberry which together make sweet love" 

-What else could this be other than a Malbec, right?!  

My girlfriend and I went here to Nectar to grab a glass, and some bites for dinner.  We did the "Bad-ass Red Flight" and giggled like school girls, when we each sipped, and read the wine descriptions (much like the above) to eachother in our sexiest phone-sex voices.

The wine, although not as satisfying as the "paper-back romance novel" style narrative.  Definitely left us red in the face, and amused.

We shared the phyllo mushroom triangles, which were good, but not extraordinary (see Costco brand for similar effect) 

The cheese selection with figs, honey (best honey I have had), and nuts were very tasty.

And the most suprising menu item of the night was the Pizetta, which was topped with thinly sliced zuchinni, roasted peppers, and fresh basil.  Almost like I was in Italy (seriously good)  

Go for the Pizetta and a giggle!
author: Sara Ann S.

description: Been wanting to try this cute little wine bar for awhile.  Nice decor.  Worst. Service. Ever.  We had the brunette server this past Thursday night.  She acted like we were bothering her.  Seriously doubt I'll be back.  Wine list was okay, but was not that impressed with the flatbread or the grilled cheese.
author: Nicole W.

description: Food and wine outstanding; reservations definitely necessary. It's a small, crowded and popular spot, so it's a bit noisy, but that Bad-Assed Red flight was worth the hassle of parking. Also the mac and cheese.
author: Chaney K.

description:
Nectar used to be 2nd choice after Ca Wine Merchant, which, despite that it's awesome, is always too packed for me to want to hang there often. Now I gravitate to Nectar (right around the corner on Steiner) because it's got a wide variety of great wines by the glasses, cleverly divided sections described with culinary adjectives.  This method to their menu is very creative and helps you remember what you like.  You can also order wine by the taste, glass or even bottle, and the bottles do not seem to be priced beyond what they would sell retail.  As far as the selection, there's a nice blend of old world/new world styles which has helped me to venture beyond sticking to California to stay safe. 

They also seem to keep expanding their menu and every dish I've tried is surprisingly delectable. They go way beyond the standard cheese and meat plates most wine bars offer. 

The only disadvantage is that the seating for two along the side of the bar is really awkward for couples trying to create intimacy, which doesn't matter as much to me as I much prefer sitting at the bar- of course.
author: Kerrie T.

description:
Fortunately for Nectar (and unfortunately for my wallet and sobriety), I work just upstairs. I can't tell you how many times I've gotten off at ten to 5 and lurked like a peeper outside its doors, just waiting for someone to beckon me in and say, "sure, we're open!" 

Since I do usually go immediately after I get off and just before they open, I am also usually the first one there. This means that I can't comment on the crowd - I'm guessing that it does get busy, but busy with people who can actually wait a civilized hour before needing to swirl wine down their throat. Alas, that is not me, and I savor my alone time at Nectar.
