They always provide me with a glass of water along with my wine, and take the time to have me taste 5 wines (even opening bottles just for a small tasting), when they know I'll be spending around $20. The phyllo-wrapped mushrooms are delish...actually, just decided to have them this evening. At 4:55.
author: Annie B.

description:
This is my go to Happy Hour spot.  Very modern and very hip with probably the best cocktail hour deal in San Francisco.  

Typically, I order the flight of champagne.  Clean, crisp bubbly in beautiful, tall glasses. After a long day, there is nothing better than being served three glasses of bubbles and having that first sip.  Their HH menu is just as grand.  I cannot leave the premises without sampling their black truffle popcorn which is simply to die for.  

Arrive early for the best seats and give yourself ample time to try one, two or even three flights of champagne before starting your evening.
author: Bridget W.

description:
Hung out with a friend at Nectar the other night.  Parking is always a little tricky in the Marina, but the parking gods were with me this time.  Wine is certainly my drink of choice, but even after all these years I'm still amused by the vivid and colorful descriptions wine lovers and sommeliers often use to describe a drink.  Maybe my taste buds are jacked considering my love for habanero peppers, but for me its usually one of 3 options:
1. this is a great glass of wine, I'll have another
2. its pretty good, but I think Ill try something else
3. or I think you poured me a glass of vinegar, where is the bottle of olive oil, and bucket of bread?

I too aspire to taste, chocolate, fruits, spices, wood and everything in between in my pour, but for now I'm going to have to stick with the 3 basic categories.  

The service and ambiance were good and the petite syrah that was recommended to me I ordered another glass of.
author: Vivek N.

description:
To put it quite simply, Nectar is a great wine bar.  A well groomed wine list, a more than competent staff to guide you around your wine journey and extremely well thought out wine flights.

The wine descriptions are priceless.  What a concept!  Wine descriptions that are actually fun to read while getting the point across! Nice.  Very nice.

Overall, this is my favorite wine bar in the city, and it should be yours too.
author: Mark G.

description:
I guess my first mistake was that I mistook this place for a restaurant after seeing it be a part of my cozmo deck.. My Lillie and I ventured into Nectar with the hopes of eating dinner. What we realized is that it is a very tapas style wine lounge... luckily I was not extremely hungry so the small plates didn't scare me too much.  The portions are really small. The cheese plate at $15 had three very tiny rations of cheese. The kobe beef was delicious. The desert was my favorite, the berry.. pear.. some sort of crisp with vanilla bean ice cream... YUM!

The service was fast, our waiter was nice. The furniture, while it was pretty, was super uncomfortable... not very lounge friendly. 

Sum up- Expensive.
author: Rada I.

description:
comfy spacious bar with plenty of interesting people, good wines and not only Norcal wines that are always on the menu at every restaurant. Go check it out.
The barman is hot.
author: Rod M.

description: What a major AHOLE with an attitude! Major ego maniac! Service sucks do not waste your time here, the place is nothing special and the service is horrific!
author: Igor T.

description:
I'm a bit of a girly girl... seriously though... I am! 

You may see me at a sports bar having a beer and cheering on my team, or playing flag football in GG Park, I also like to veg on the couch and watch NCIS 

HOWEVER... I also LOVE getting a little dolled up and meeting a fabulous friend for a night of class. 

Nectar is the perfect place to experience this! At first I thought there wouldn't be enough seating but it continues for a ways, and there was plenty of space. We settled in and ordered a bottle of wine. The waitstaff was superb, very friendly and informative, really enhancing the experience. 

Appetizer: the truffle popcorn.. a surprisingly delicious flavor, a bit oily 
Meal: spinach salad with pear vinaigrette (and actual pears yum) and feta cheese. This salad was amazing I loved it 
Desert: We split the maple and pecan cheesecake. I wanted to lick the plate clean, but remembered I was in a nice outfit and being a classy lady for the night :) 

On top of the food being delicious and moderately priced, the presentation was beautiful. 

Of course we had a second bottle of wine... we sat for hours being intelligent sexy ladies having great conversation and laughing with other guests. Nectar is the perfect place for a girls night out!
author: Hailey P.

description:
I absolutely LOVE this wine bar! Not only does it have a hip ambiance with classy decor, and music that is audible but not too loud, but it also has fantastic seating! ah yes, this does indeed matter. 

How often are we all cramped together, nearly sitting on one-another, looking for a reasonable place to place our clutch or hang our ginormous handbag, not to mention drape our jacket? Much less sit comfortably with our companion... Well, at Nectar, have no fear! No one gets the better seat (i.e. bench vs. chair), as the both of you get your very own huge, comfortable couch/chair! Nectar is one of the few places where I have thoroughly enjoyed my seating arrangement! (yes, I'm a nerd for actually having an opinion on seating arrangements...) :)

OK, back to the basics. The wine was fantastic! My friend and I ended up starting with a white flight  to cool-off (since this was the Friday it was SOO hott in SF recently). Since Nectar changes their flights frequently, it's hard to recall the name of it, but it was something like "anything but chard" (though now, 5 days later, they ironically have an "everything chard" flight) cute. :) So ours had a green wine from Portugal (I believe), something with the taste of pineapple muddled in it, a fabulous wine reminiscent of a viognier, and a couple others. 

Our second flight was all malbecs. To our surprise, we discovered we actually favored a non-Argentinian malbec! Of course now I don't recall it's origin, but how often do you find non-Argentinian malbecs anyway? Very peculiar, and a most delightful flight!

Most importantly - I love that Nectar actually pours you sufficient liquid to do a proper tasting with your flight. Unlike many places, Nectar's flights are substantial and very reasonably dispensed. Instead of giving you a meer few sips per wine, they actually give you nearly a glass per. We were both very appreciative that they actually wanted us to sample and enjoy the wines. 

To accompany our malbecs, we ordered some beef carpaccio - delicious! And we sampled some crazy-yummy cheeses! 

Ever the romantic ambiance, but also perfect for a girls' night out! I loved the wine, food, and ambiance, so definitely a 5-star venue!
author: Sally M.

description:
i had my 40th birthday party at Nectar and it was FABULOUS.  The staff is friendly and accommodating (and I am not easy), the wine and food is great, the ambiance is wonderful.  I could not have picked a better venue.  

I will also say, that prior to my party, I frequented Nectar and it is definitely a "go to" place for me any day of the week.   I just can't say enough good things!  If you haven't been, definitely go!  

Oh, and definitely try the butterscotch dessert.  Yum!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: The wines are good and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable but the noise level is ridiculous.
author: Dani D.

description:
My date and I did a walking tour through the Marina type of thing so we only spent a short time in Nectar.

I vow to spend more time here.  I could seriously sit and read the menu over and over. It's intriguing reading.

I enjoyed being able to taste a little bit of various wines and the decor is relaxing but chic.
author: Mona M.

description: I LOVE this places wine list. Amazing selection. The truffle popcorn...well enough said there, it's truffle popcorn, and the 1/2 off bottles of wine night on Monday nights is a ridiculous deal. I like to go and get champagne on these nights. I usually just do apps and wine here (delicious cheese plates) but so far everything has been great and Chris, the manager is an excellent and knowledgeable bartender/wine guy.
author: Brooke h.

description:
The best thing about Nectar is the quality wine flights.  They are all pretty good values and you get ~ 1/2 a glass of each wine.

The second best thing about going here is that you can see exactly how much each bottle of wine is marked up.  They list the "to go" (retail) price next to the "drink in" price of each bottle.  

The worst thing about Nectar is the service.  Very   S...L....O.....W.

The second worst thing about Nectar is the value of the hot foods.  The cheese plate and the meat plate (it was the special) were both good and not too unreasonably priced.  The hot food that we ordered was disappointing, especially considering the price.

I'd come back for some wine and a snack at the end of an evening or maybe for happy hour before dinner..
author: Alicia A.

description:
This place is money. First time we went here was on a Friday night. I expected it to be extremely crowded and that we'd have to wait a while but when we got there, there were plenty of seats available at the bar. Unlike some other lounges I've been to, it was very laid back with some mellow music in the background and dim lighting filling the room. The bartender was very helpful and recommend excellent selections of wine. The food is great. I would definitely have the smoked salmon flatbread. The bartender was also kind enough to let us keep a menu so we wouldn't have to remember the names of the wines. 

This is a great place to go if you just want a place to chill and relax for a while.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Ummmm...I LOVE Nectar. I've found many of my favorite Chardonnays and Zinfandels here. Their wine list is simply fabulous, and always changing, so you never get sick of the place. Their red flight is always great, and usually a good deal as well.

Oh, their descriptions of wines always crack my shit up too. They described one Chardonnay as having "hints of artisan roasted marshmallows." Ha ha ha...not your regular Jet-Puffed Marshmallows, ARTISAN!!! That's gotta be better, right?

Last time I was there some drunk dude thought I was Julianne Moore. That was pretty cool.
author: Brianne K.

description:
Pretty nice wine selection, kinda expensive though. You are probably paying the fact that you're having wine in a fancy location, in a fancy neighbourhood (compare the price of a bottle drank over there or brought home). They had a St. Emilion 2001 for around 40 dollars. Ok, let's have it! Well, they were out of it at the very end and the guy came to us saying: " We can give you a 2003 for the same price". It's ok, it's ok....but you know that 2001 was a special year for France in that region, right? Silence. I love to talk about wine even before drinking it so that silence disappointed me a little bit. Cheers.

UPDATE: No seriously, you cannot pay almost 20 bucks for two tastings. My Willamette Pinot Noir (Panther something) was utterly flat, roaming with sulfites while my girlfriend's glass was nothing more than a punch of acidity and a burst of alcohol. Take care when you read the description of the wines, they're well designed to look and sound good but when you have the glass in front of you, be ready for a disappointment. They would have been acceptable for 10$ both.
Pricey, pricey.....
author: Dario B.

description:
Let's set the scene...

I was shopping with my boyfriend at Pottery Barn on Chestnut. We had accidentally paid $10 for parking since we couldn't find a spot, so we decided we needed a drink to make our parking fee worth the excursion.

We saw Wine Merchant across the street, but this place was so busy, loud and crowded. Definitely not the place I wanted to go for a kickback glass of wine and some good conversation with my honey.

I remembered reading about Nectar on Yelp and recommended we go around the corner and try to find it. All of the reviews are true, this place is great if you fancy a nice chill atmosphere and good wine. It wasn't too crowded so we were able to chat and get a place at the bar. The wine was great and the bartender was knowledgeable and offered good recommendations. The best part was you could create your own flight if you didn't like the ones that were preselected.

Aside from great decor and an educated staff. I really enjoyed the wine list they had. It wasn't so huge that you had no clue what to pick, but was very comfortably sized. I great selection of American and international wines for every palette.

I hope to be able to stop by weekly.
author: Aubrey W.

description:
Tucked away on mini restaurant row.

I like the joint because it's real chill.  Somewhere you can bring a date, talk about nothing, and pretend you know something about wine.  Throw in a few buzz words like 'hickory, chocolately, fruity, almondy, with a lemon finish" and you're all set.

I like the vaulted ceilings, low lighting, and candles.  Not to mention the sleek modern decor.  The sommeliers are usually very friendly and won't embarrass you if you're a newbie.  I always just pick a color, provide a price range, and end with a phrase like 'something real nice'.  And viola, done.

And if you really want to have some fun, I would recommend some of the tasters they have created.  Usually comes in a 3 glass set, but if you talk to them, they usually can tailor the mix to cater to your palate.
author: Isaac L.

description:
Loved this place... The way they describe wines is so unique and refreshing... really gives you a feel for the experience of the wine rather than the usual staid three adjectives, plus they have an awesome selection of wines at great prices!  What's not to love???

Then you get a great atmosphere with pleasant (if somewhat cool) service and delicious snacks.  

My friend ordered the vegetarian pizza at which I turned up my nose then helped him to devour, it was so tasty.  Onto our second bottle of wine... ahem, we had lots to catch up on... we ordered the charcuterie platter, which was incredibly generous with its serving, albeit we asked for a second pickled onion.  Anybody tried splitting a cocktail onion in two?
author: Lorraine F.

description:
I am not a serious drinker; Nectar is literally the only place in the world I will consistently enjoy a bit of wine.  Why?  The staff has an encyclopedic knowledge of wine.  They have very interesting bottles from smaller vineyards to please a range of tastes.  Their menu is probably the most entertaining, thoughtful, and whimsically well-written document in the restaurant business.  

The place is lively with an attractive clientele but not too loud nor wholly Marina.  Attractive decor.  The food menu is innovative and a very pleasant surprise, too.  Worth the trip.
author: Chris N.

description:
This place is so chic, yet totally comfortable and sweet. I went there on a date, and I gave him an A+ for the location. He knew the owner, and she was so nice, and offered us all these goodies. The cheese plater was delish, and the wine selection was incredible. I'm not an expert on wine, so I let my date order. Overall it was a lovely place for a date. 
I would  definetly recommend trying it out.
author: Anna S.

description:
Yum!

I went with two other mommies, so i'm not sure if it was the wine & food, or just the fact we had an evening away from our monkeys :)

We did the champagne tasting flight - all were great.  Nice size pours too.  The food was fantastic.  The bartender/manager gave us a little popcorn to start - it was a little slice of heaven - truffle oil, chives - it was divine.  Duck spring rolls - yum.  Smoked Salmon -yum.  Cheese tasting plate - yum.

Highly recommend!
author: Whitney S.

description: Fun hip place to hang out for a few glasses of wine - and the food is fabulous too if you want to have dinner or appetizers.  Good selection of wines with detailed descriptions on the wine list to help you decide.
author: Vicki A.

description:
Besides the terrible parking, the unbearably slow service (Rick is right, we had to ask for 1. menus, 2. someone to take our order after a millenia of neglect, 3. our bill-twice, 4. someone to take our bill and change), and the limited seating... are one and a half person chairs really efficient in such a skinny space... where was I going with this? Oh yeah, there is no 'besides'.  I didn't particularly like it here.  

HOWEVER. 

It's so much much more worth it to go to the one in Burlingame.  It's larger, looks better,  has lots of parking, seating is more comfortable and sensible, the staff is so much more timely, helpful, friendly and cute. Their food and food service is also very good.  They have a private party section in the back.  Yeah, I guess just check out the reviews for the Burlingame one.
author: Marjorie B.

description: Great atmosphere! Friendly staff! DJ spun some good stuff! Would def hang out here again!!
author: Jen W.

description:
If you haven't tasted sparkling red wine - I didn't even know it existed before - then you can give it a try here. I don't necessarily crave it at this point, but it was interesting and worth trying for the experience alone.

I like the vibe here, but if you go in a group of larger than two, be prepared to hover like a vulture around the tables... and when a bigger one looks like it's freeing up, you'll have to POUNCE hard!  But it's chill for a wine-loving twosome.
author: jenn h.

description: I really want this place to be great, but it really is just average.  every time i come back i am disappointed a little. The wine is good and the food is fine, (the new remodel is good) but it is honestly the bar tenders that drop the ball every time.  whether its forgotten food, or just being forgotten at the bar entirely, something is always amiss.  It amazes me that Nectar has higher ratings than Wine Merchant.  I really wish Nectar would step it up, they have most things going for them...
author: Joey E.

description: Great wine selection, delicious food, fun + swanky atmosphere... and to boot, the owner, Chris was such a friendly host.  He was very knowledgeable about wine but in a non-pretentious way.  When I visit SF again, I will SURELY return!
author: Ariel D.

description:
"Half your age plus 7 years" is apparently the formula for figuring out if you are too old to date someone, my friend tells me.  So we did the math, and my date was just past "appropriate".  I really didn't care, and he suggested Nectar for our date, not so far from our neighborhoods at the time, and he probably figured I'd get bombed since I did mention I love love love wine.  
   Even though I was "cougaring it" that night and being oh so "inappropriate" as my friend put it, laughing at me. .  my date was the one who needed reading glasses to read the wine list, and he had forgotten them.
   We sat at a little seating area near the bar, someone came out and served us, always quickly, and made very helpful suggestions based on our tastes.  I was pleasantly surprised at how fast the service was, so many places in SF leave you wondering if someone had to make the wine before they brought it to you, and here he always was. .  bringing us a new glass immediately.  He even helped my far-sighted friend read the check so I didn't have to see it (I know, a GUY actually paid for a date in SF, in this day and age . .  so crazy!). . Anyway, why haven't I gone back there?  Oh yeah, because I don't really love the Marina so much, but I would make an exception to check it out a second time.

My only complaint was it was really hot in there, I was dying when I first got there, but then again I'm always late and pretty much "power walking" everywhere so I take half the blame.
author: Muriel D.

description:
First off, the place smells narsty; secondly, they have a crappy iTunes mix of 50-cent and R&B tunes to pair with your wine, and finally, the waiter ruins your buzz when he informs you that the place closes at midnight on weekends.
My girlfriend asked for some chocolate or cheese to accompany our bottle, and was told that the kitchen is closed. 
Not interested in giving this place another shot.
author: Jason N.

description: Great variety of wines and cheeses.  A great place to sit down with friends after strolling around in the city.
author: Warren M.

description:
4 star given for the wine bar.  They have a nice selection and the servers are very nice.

But THIS IS NOT A RESTAURANT.  Do not come here expecting to get a full meal.  And the snacky food that is served is rather pricey.

Do come for a few glasses of wine then head off somewhere else for dinner.
author: Lev E.

description:
Nice outdoor seating, pleasant selection of wines but the douchiest descriptions you have ever seen. 

Granted, most people have no clue about wines anyhow but "a well chiseled lad" or "an invigorating gum of Kentucky blue-grass" as part of the description? 

Just shut up and pour, we pay enough for the stuff without having to give up our dignity as well.
author: Jan Michael K.

description:
Yes yes yes!

My friend and I went here for drinks the other night and it was great. They have an extensive wine lists with multiple price ranges and you can buy the wine you drank and take it home after for a pretty reasonable price.

They also have flights which I love (not to mention they have cool names).

We only had a small app (the crab and artichoke gratin) which was just ok. But the rest of the menu looked good and I'd come back and eat there sometime. 

Will definitely come back for drinks or dinner.
author: Ana H.

description: I've been to Nectar twice and although it's not one of my favorite wine bars in the city, it's okay.  I like that they do have small plates if you are hungry but they're kitchen closes early.  My girlfriend likes that they have a bubbles flight which is good but I have never been too impressed by the still flights on the menu.  It's also a bit pricey for what you get.
author: Carly P.

description:
I loved this place! Granted, I've never been to a wine bar, so maybe this is too high of a rating, but whatever. I had a flight of white wine for $13, and then my friends and I shared almost every possible small plate. The portion sizes are awesome.

Definitely get:
fig appetizer. SO GOOD.
pizza. YUM.
sandwich. Double YUM.
baby gems. if you like bleu cheese...

Service was great, and OMG. you must read the wine descriptions. Some are quite sexual and hilarious, especially if you've already had a couple glassfuls...
author: Carol L.

description:
You have to try to O'Reilly's Pinot Noir.. one of my fav's. The staff is really nice and helpful. The white pizzetta is amazing.

Looking forward to going there again.
author: Puneeta S.

description:
So, I went to Nectar with a few girlfriends to have a few drinks and dessert.  There weren't many people at the restaurant because it was a Monday night, so we thought it would be relatively quick.  

Overall, I was surprised by the poor service.  When we sat (ourselves) down, we had to wait a bit for menus.  And when we ordered, many of the items on the menu were not being served that day or they were out of it...and the server didn't tell us until we attempted to order them.  We ordered goat cheese crepes with figs and a chocolate mousse thing.  The cholocate mousse came out very quickly, but it took longer for the crepes.  10 minutes later, we asked about them.  The server, in one of the most condescending tones I've ever heard, said, "I know you still haven't gotten your crepes.  They are made a la carte, so they take time."  I don't think she realized that a la carte means on the side.  Whatever.  After another 10 minutes, no crepes.  We ask again, she said (again, rather condescendingly), "I already told you they take a long time.  I'll check again but I know the chef is making them."  After another 5 minutes, we ask again, indicating that if they don't come out soon, we don't really want them anymore.  She finally goes to check on them and tells us they would be ready in two minutes (which they were).

Since I've only been there once, I would attribute this bad experience to that particular server because everything (and everybody) else seemed great.  The manager or owner (whoever he was) came over to our table afterwards to apologize for the long wait and explained that the long wait was caused by the fact that the crepe batter is made when the crepes are ordered (our server's speak for "a la carte").  An explanation for why it was taking so long was helpful for us to understand what caused the long wait rather than just putting us off or making excuses.  He also didn't charge us for the dessert.

If the owner/manager hadn't approached our table at the end of the meal, I definitely would have given Nectar a lower star rating.  Instead, his explanation and nice gesture left me with a positive feeling that almost made up for the terrible server.
author: Wendy L.

description: This place is a fun destination spot if you want to try something a little different.  We are into wine.  The atmosphere is great and the wine selection very good.  You must try the happy hour. Also try the popcorn truffle.  Very tasty.
author: Barbara S.

description: Food and wine was pretty good, but a bit overpriced. Ambiance was great. I might come back for happy hour!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I've walked down Steiner 92837492837 times and never noticed Nectar, but the other night I had to do an about-face after walking into California Wine Merchant (I just hate conflict, don't you?!) and when we were looking for other options, I was pleased to find this little gem.

I had a glass of some very nice Spanish red -- I really would love to know exactly what it was, but I'm not good at retaining details after close calls ;o) If you go, try to sit at a little table along the side... the chairs are big and fabulous and you'll feel oh-so-important drinking your $10 glass of vino.

The crowd wasn't bad, minus the three Marina kids that were sloppy and yelling -- a good place to go if you just wanna chat and drink. Or if you want to save yourself from someone at the CWM!
author: Heather L.

description:
Wine: excellent

Cheese plate: so-so

Bartendresses: SNOOTY when it comes to asking for help selecting a wine...!  The response I got when asking for some opinions was a  very snooty "depends on what you like"  DUUUUH!!  No kidding...really?  what I like?  I was thinking I'd try to order something I'd reallly hate.  Just a tip for the bartendress: offer your opinions in a kind and enthusiastic way, offer a taste or two....and pull the stick out!
author: Chris P.

description: This place was the only establishment and visited twice on my recent trip to the Bay Area.  The staff is totally not intimidating and go out of their way to set you up with wine that caters to your specific tastes.  Recommend anyone visiting this area to head out to the Marina and check this place out.  Be warned that you need some karma when it comes to the parking.
author: jonathan f.

description:
Would've given it four stars if BF didn't suffer from indigestion after.  The food was really so-so.  The wine list is superb!  But it is a wine bar.

I would come back for wine only! $100 before tax and tip for 3 glasses of wine, 3 entrees, 2 appetizers and indigestion. That's for two people....gosh, I feel like a pig.
author: Carrie-C N.

description:
Finally made it to Nectar Wine Lounge and it was a really cool place.  Our server was very knowledgeable about their wines and helped us make our selections.  I wished he would have come back to see how we were doing or even to ask what we thought of our wine selections since we had spent a few minutes chatting about the wines.

Atmosphere was MUCH better that the place down the street although I wish it could have been a little better laid out so that it was conducive to chatting with others.

I have to say that the wine descriptions are unlike any other place I've been to and seem to be spot on!
author: J L.

description:
Have an hour to kill before your dinner reservation?  Have a drink here.

Didn't like your dinner somewhere else and skipped out before dessert?  Have a butterscotch pot de creme here with some dessert wine.

Want to sit in a comfy chair with a bunch of your other overdressed girlfriends, drink bubble flights and giggle?  This is your place.

Never overly packed, food better than average, drinks not horribly overpriced.

If you are near the Nectar in Burlingame, it's a nice place to have lunch as well.
author: Poppy C.

description: I like Nectar. I've been a couple of times. They have a decent wine list and some tasty small bite selections. The server was attentive and engaged with the guests. I found the people at the bar friendly and out to enjoy themselves.
author: Michael L.

description:
I'll be honest and say I'm not a wine guy - by any stretch. I don't enjoy it much and I enjoy the culture even less sometimes. It's not for me. Still, I know that I can have fun at a wine bar. There are wine bars that work for me, and are comfortable, hip places. Hotel Biron I suppose is one. Jungle Vino in Reno is another.

Nectar is a most-despicable wine bar. It represents many of the things and people I despise in the Marina. Still, it could have been saved with the slightest ounce of creativity...and it wasn't. 

One thing Nectar has going for it is their actual wine. They have a serious selection, and my wino friend and his sommelier roomate both confirmed this. In fact the sommelier roomate went there to blind taste and study for her level 2 sommelier exam. That says something to me and that's why Nectar gets 2 stars instead of one.

However, everything else was bizarre or out-of-place. The crowd was old for the Marina (30-50's). But the music was too young (early 20's, Kanye West?). The sommeliers knew their stuff cold, but had no passion/presence. They looked like disgruntled waiters. Lastly, the space, which is narrow and awkwardly set up, was totally unoriginal. The ambient light was very high. The art on the walls was actually nice, but again didn't fit the space. The whole design felt lazy. I'm not a fan. At least the Nectar in Burlingame looks the part.
author: Tolga E.

description:
Nice atmosphere but underwhelming flights.

I had the bubbles flight and was not overly impressed by the three sparkling wines I had. My fiance's white wines flight was really disappointing, especially the wine he was recommended to have last. As our friend commented after tasting that third wine, the wine "died on the palate." Tasted very watered down. 

The apple crepes were ok. Just ok.
author: Jenny K.

description: Really savory bubbles flight, charmingly intimate setting, and attentive staff. The happy hour deals are what enticed me initially....  Very reasonable prices for the quality of vino you get:)
author: dorothy g.

description:
3.5 stars.

I don't think anything else could have gone wrong while I was there but despite that, I still had a great time. It's a nice spot and the bartenders are very friendly and very helpful (although not always present and sometimes hard to flag down). I ordered a champagne flight and the 2nd champagne of the flight was out of stock. That being said, they opened up a nicer bottle of champagne and served it, and it was definitely the best champagne of the group. Then, we ordered a port wine and after opening the bottle, the server immediately knew it went bad. He poured it into a glass, sniffed it, and pushed it to the side and then let us smell it to get a sense of what a bad wine smelled like. He then opened another bottle and served that one. We then ordered the chocolate souffle. Warning... it's extremely SMALL!! Like.. half the size I expected it to be. Well.. it came out but they were missing ice cream so they offered to bake us another souffle free of charge. But of course, after 10 minutes, they came out to tell us they had run out of souffle and instead, would be giving us a butterscotch mousse. OMG.. I am SO GLAD that they were out of souffles! This dessert was DELICIOUS!! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. It has yummy cookie crumbles on it that just make it delicious. Normally, I find butterscotch to be too sweet and overpowering but this one was just right.... creamy with good flavor but with moderated sweetness. And then the wines that were recommended with our desserts went just perfectly!! I was absolutely stunned. 

The only downside of this place in my mind is price. It's ridiculously expensive! I mean.. I got the bill and just sat and looked at it for a while. Apparently, a glass of the port wine I drank cost $14 and the pours weren't even that large! The trick is that they have a couple prices listed: pour, glass, bottle. Beware of not just looking at the number on the left; it's the itsy bitsy pour price and it will trick you as it did me!
author: Lauren C.

description: Great service. The Yelp deal was great and very easy to use. Had a lovely girlfriend evening and really like the atmosphere. Great place!
author: Daniela K.

description:
Couple things:

1) Don't go here for dinner.  Its awesome as a wine bar, and the food is good, but the plates are very small and you will drop a c-note.
2) Don't order their specials.  I had a French red  at special price and for sure that thing had gone sour because it was left open too long. 

Otherwise, go here.  Good selection, nice atmosphere, good time.
author: Marc M.

description:
This place is lame. The atmosphere is great -- for a hospital cafeteria or lounge. I like the comfy upholstered chairs, but everything else about the place just didn't do it for me. The white walls could use a nice rich color to warm up the atmosphere of the place. 

There is a good selection of wines, but the menu is extremely limited. We had the prawns wrapped in prosciutto and those were very good. The suggested white wine pairing was very good as well. But the "jambon et gruyere" sandwich was a very sad, sad grilled ham and cheese -- not good at all...and I am not someone who easily turns away from a grilled cheese sandwich! The red wine pairing with that was so-so, but not fabulous.

Overall, I just don't see what the fuss is about this place. There are better wine lounges in the city. We ended up going next door to Isa for a bunch of small plates and a couple half bottles of red. Fabulous restaurant! 

We really loved Isa. Nectar on the other hand is just average and the place has no ambience.
author: Christine P.

description:
My friend and I went here for dinner and drinks on Friday night and just loved it.

Started out with flights of the red wine - nice pour/price ratio.  Had the cheese plate which was delicious!  3 different types of cheese with awesome add-ons, especially the green grapes tossed with jalepeno and cilantro.

Next I had the champagne flight which was also totally satisfying..main meal included Kobe beef asparagus 'lollipops' and a cheese and mushroom panini.

One more bottle of wine and we were happy and too drunk to get mad at the final bill...the only reason for 4 stars here was it took a lot outta my pocket.

Atmosphere was great - we sat at the bar and chatted with the servers and the people sitting around us.  Very cozy!
author: Lauren V.

description:
This is where we had our holiday party. Since it's a small and narrow place so we were able to book the entire lounge.

I had to give a shout out to the bartender - Mr. Jim from The Office Look-alike. You are so awesome. Thanks for turning me to that Belgium beer, "Sierra Point" LOL. Sorry I still don't remember the name. And thanks for letting me sip that special wine - it was really good. Should be for 1997!

We were served a lot of different types of appetizers. From what I can remember, we had - crab cakes (yum!), ahi tuna (it was ok), scallop cerviche (yum!), flank steak (would be better if it wasn't cold), duck egg roll (not a fan), and a cheese plate with candied walnuts (yum!).

The staff seemed really knowledgeable on wines. I caught Mr. Jim Look-Alike reading a book which I initially thought was rude but he was just reading on a wine that they had. Apparently, the staff get tested by the owner daily basis and they go to wine tasting a lot. Also my husband who's not big on wine, forgot what kind he had and one of the servers were able to tell him by looking at his glass (is this possible or was I already drunk and easily impressed).

The decor was nice. A lounge look. The loungers were comfortable and nice for a intimate conversation.

The only thing that would suck is that there's no parking but that's the Marina for you. Overall, I like this place and would come back.
author: Alice C.

description:
Went on a date here so the guy wins mega points for taking me to a wine bar. Wine is the most direct way to my heart. Sat at the bar because they claimed that they were all full, but in our entire 2 hours of being there, the place was only half full. Oh well, the bar was nice because the bartenders are friendly as well as the fellow patrons. 

Sat next to a wine distributor who was a bit "quirky" but knew a whole hell of a lot about wine so it was fun to talk to him. He let us try his crazy good 1997 Port off menu. Amazing. I love friendly wine bars.

Kinda pricey but what do you expect, and don't plan on going on an empty stomach (apps are teeny tiny). Apparently they have different wine events every Tuesday. Guess I'll have to stop by!
author: Sarah P.

description:
The ambiance at Nectar was really nice, with a lot of candles and outdoor seating.  There was a good crowd there, some people eating dinner, others sipping wine at the bar.  They have a huge selection of wine by the glass, half bottles, full bottles and even magnums.  Now I'm always down to drink; but unfortunately, my friend didn't feel like drinking so we each only tried a glass o_o

The food was pretty good, a lot of your typical Californian/French influenced fare.  We ordered 3 appetizers (mussels, seared ahi & salad) and shared an entree (steak). It was good, but not spectacular.  I think for the same type of food, SF actually has more to offer compared to LA, not to mention that the best Californian/French restaurant in the country is just a short drive north of the city.

Though the food was just ok, I'd still recommend this place to anyone who happens to be in the area.  I had a really good time hanging out there, just chilling with my friend.  I only wish I had the chance to try more other types of wine though. =P
author: Ta K.

description: I went here to celebrate my birthday (thanks again for all the wishes from all 7 corners of the world) hoping to meet some mates there. I met the barstaff and had a great time with them. Good cheese, and I had my first glass of Lebanese wine, from the Bequaa valley. It was actually a bit smokier than I'd have liked, but it was good nonetheless.
author: Hasan D.

description:
So I live a few blocks away and always think of this place as a place to go for HH but never do.  My date wanted to try a another wine bar on Chestnut but I think of that one as having the "Marina attitude"so many "comment" on. I convinced her of Nectar and she was ended up happy.

Nectar is relaxed, loungey. The HH is a good deal (on par with other wine bar HH)  and the wine selection is more than good enuf for me.  The olive plate is great and (two) orders of trulfled popcorn were tasty and hot (thou not sure if it fits with the red wine).

It's not as bustling as my fav wine bar Amelie, and maybe that's a good thing.  

 I will come here more often, I never had a reason why I didn't frequent it more except for timing.
author: K L.

description: I no longer live in the bay area, but on a recent visit I finally got a chance to try this place after some old friends had insisted upon it.  I'm so glad I did!  The pizzetta was fabulous...the atmosphere was cozy and relaxed...and the staff was very friendly.  The girl who was serving made us feel right at home, and was very knowledgeable and helpful with our wine selections.  I definitely plan to come back next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Rachel P.

description:
Update: I had Nectar at 5 stars for years, but the last few times were a bit disappointing. Perhaps 3.5 stars would be more fitting. Not sure what has happened. Too many staff and perhaps chef (?) changes. For example, went in to celebrate my sister's engagement and had to wait at my table 10 minutes for a wine menu and then 10 more minutes before the waitress came back for my order, and she knew I was interested in ordering a bottle for a special occasion. Things just have been inconsistent: sometimes good, sometimes I've had food orders lost (always comped when that happens, but still....). 
I occasionally go back, but not nearly as often. Hoping to rekindle an old flame with this place. Is the magic gone?

Previous
I love this place. Thomas offers great wine recommendations and seems to always know exactly what wine will fit my mood. This is the perfect place to share a bottle of wine and catch up with friends.
author: Pamela B.

description:
Lovely atmosphere, and descriptions of wines which are perhaps more wacky than useful, but fun nevertheless.  They have loads of wines by the glass, but also four different  flights, which each offer a tasting glass of three wines, themed differently.  I had the big reds flight, which was let down by a Rhone wine which was so young it was almost undrinkable - but the others were good and the helpful bar lady poured me a different wine to replace the undrinkable.  Perhaps I should have declared more to be poor!!??

The food was a bit of a let down compared with the atmosphere and the wine.  I had a soup which was too heavily spiced and then I had a plate of three cold meats.  With better suppliers, these would have been a deal better.  Not much green stuff on the menu, though.
author: Norman B.

description:
Okay this is a nice wine bar for a glass with a friend if you are stuck in the Marina.
 
Not a pick up scene and not a party place.  

A few of the staff are terrible and rude - the women (not sure if she is still there is consistently horrible.  The main reason I rarely go.  The guys/gal behind the bar seemed to know his/her stuff and were good.   

One night ,after ordering two bottles of wine and food,  I had another couple come in to join us and the waitress actually told us they couldn't join us at our table.  Your kidding - the place was half empty! And there was a ton of room at our table.....  This is not the only example to!!!!

Again plane old wine list and expensive.  The food is again not exciting...  good for a glass i guess

I guess the one thing i don't like about these places is the bar tenders, and they are bar tenders, work slowly.........  Give me my damn glass of wine....  Urggh
author: Cristof E.

description:
The only thing Nectar could do better is open earlier!  5pm on the weekends?  What about those of us who enjoy drinking wine all afternoon?

But...I love this place.  The wine selection is terrific, changes frequently, and features some of the most outlandish, hilarious, and ridiculous descriptions I've ever seen.  

The food - yum.  I have become nearly as addicted to the parmesan with figs/dates and truffle honey as I am to wine.  I'd like to bathe in that truffle honey.  Everyday.

The portion sizes are perfect if you like to share.  Depending on the size of our group, we usually get some combination of:  the cheese plate, my beloved parm w/ truffle honey, one of the pizzettas or flatbreads, a salad, and sometimes the meat plate.  The last couple of times we had the tuna tartar which was also scrumptuous.

The atmosphere is nice, too:  loungy, comfy, never too loud or too crowded.

I dig it.  I'm going to need to go back this weekend.
author: Bette K.

description:
Nectar is as lovely as its name describes. Warm lightning comfy chairs, sweet wine and tasty treats. 

I had a glass (or two) of the Cold Heaven and it truly was just that, good thing that I went with someone who knows how to order wine, or might have been a little lost with the menu, there was a lot to choose from. We also ordered the tuna tar tar, cute presentation and was a nice snack.
author: Lisa M.

description:
What a find in the Marina...  A friend of ours made reservations for my partners birthday and I have to say we were a little skeptical but ended up being pleasantly surprised!!   We were promptly seated and the service was great.  We actually went for dinner, not knowing they only served small plates.  But WOW.. Every dish we ordered, we ordered about 8 dishes, but everyone was delicious!!!!  Plus the wine selection was incredible, we started with a chard from Australia.. it was good... then we went to the Chappellet Merlow (2004).. Wonderful!!!   

We'll definitely go back!  You should give it a try!  Very friendly attentive staff but not overly so...
author: Dale T.

description:
Organic ingredients!

Free parking was a biatch, but well worth the hunt once we sat down in the comfortable seats.  The warm, soft and dark browns exude comfort and class.  The tables are well spaced.  

Our server, Tiffany was friendly and described the dishes well.  She was attentive but not hovering.

The dish portions are typically what one would find in a lounge- tapas size.  We ate two flat breads (pizza style less the tomato sauce), thin and crunchy crust:  salmon and the other, mushroom.  Very delicious and not soggy.  The truffle popcorn was creative and tasty.  The tuna tartar wasn't fishy and well presented in a slice of cucumber shaped as a ring.  My wife and I shared it all.

We enjoyed a bottle of Bordeaux 2004 Chateau Bolaire Superieur a blend of Petite Verdot, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.  The bouquet was fabulous, the pallet was silky.  It was fruity yet earthy.  It didn't overpower our dinner or dessert.

The chocolate souffle was dreamy and sinful.  The dark chocolate was rich and gooey, and the creme anglais was thick and creamy.  My sweet tooth was satisfied.

We'll be back  to try more of the wines, the flat breads and souffle.
author: JOHN J.

description:
Nice place, very very good food, lovely leather chairs, soft yellow light but the service was painfully slow every time I've been here, so minus one star.


 I come back for the food and wine which says a lot for a restaurant, now that I think about it..
author: lizok

description: Nectar is the quintessential place for people to come together and share a fun, but relaxing evening with close company. I came with 4 of my my girlfriends and found great seating that accommodated us all. The music wasn't too loud, but just enough to be fun, but still have dynamic conversations. There was a couple on a date next to us who looked as relaxed and happy as we were. Chris the owner was fantastic! He helped us choose the wine that would best compliment our palate and was very open and inviting. The wines were fantastic as were the snacks! I will go back again and again!
author: Desiree P.

description: Cannot beat happy hour from 5-7pm with 50% off glasses of wine.  Chris was very helpful in picking out a wine that would suit my fancy, and the white I chose was delicious!
author: Sona P.

description: I've come here twice and both times the service was wonderful, the menus were clever and the vino was tasty. Girrrrrls night!
author: Lulu B.

description: Ok- I had been to Nectar before and never really was that excited.  Always over crowded and I felt a bit pricey for the service and crowd.  My girlfirend and I went last night by chance for happy hour.  WOW - what an amazing difference.  We were able to sit in two lounge chairs, sip some wonderful Sauvingon Blanc and enjoy the truffled popcorn.  It is now on my must do list!
author: Annette M.

description: This place has a great happy hour! Half off wine glasses and flights! Hoooo-weeee take me away! During my visit last week, I also fell in love with a new wine that seemed to perfectly blend my two vices: coffee and wine. It's called the Diemersfontain Pinotage. Get it while you can - like all great wine bars, they change their wine menu pretty often.
author: Lizette R.

description: I love Nectar! It's a very quiet, chill relaxing atmostphere with a great selection of wine and dessert menu! I've never had the food here but I really enjoy the atmostphere and service. Our server was super attentive and had great reccommendations for us! Lots a seating and tables so it's still fun on a busy night. Nectar is probably one of my favorite wine bars in the city!
author: Marissa P.

description:
I love this place.  It has a welcoming ambiance and the bartenders are great, knowledgeable and friendly.  One of them also helped me fix my phone so I'm particularly happy with the place.  

For food I love the truffle popcorn.  I could live off of it and their small pizzas.
author: Molly R.

description:
Excellent pre or post dinner spot.  The flight pairing is always fun, and prices are reasonable.  Not overly crowded, so conversations are a breeze.

Sea bass was good.  

Big fan of this place.  Just a nice place to relax.
author: Jacob J.

description: Nectar Wine Lounge is one of my favorites in the city. It's small and a bit quiet, so smaller groups are preferred. Perfect place to take a date! Very cozy and comfortable seating, although sometimes a short wait is necessary on a busy night. They offer an extensive and very unique wine list along with small plates and cheese and meat platters. They allow you to sample wines before ordering and the atmosphere is very loungy so you never feel rushed. The only downside is this wine bar closes a bit earlier than most. But everytime I go back, I have a wonderful experience...which reminds me I should probably make a trip here very soon.
author: Vivian D.

description: Great neighborhood wine bar; truffle popcorn is unique and awesome; good wine selection; very cozy and intimate though draws a great crowd.  Bravo.
author: Ashley E.

description: Great wine selection, loved the descriptions which were both interesting and accurate. Yummy cheese plate and great service. Also has an awesome happy hour!
author: Samantha M.

description:
Great Atmosphere. Very relaxing and inviting. Our waitress was very nice and attentive, as well as the bartender. The wine was excellent. The food was VERY good! My only quarrel... the plates were cold. 

Hot Food = Hot Plates
Cold Food = Cold Plates

Other than that, this chef would definitly go back again. Its my type of place, with my type of crowd, with my type of food and wine! Cheers!
author: John M.

description:
Tried the "Flight" which serves 3 wines of your choice...
I tried sparkling wines and my boy friend tried red wines...awesome!!
I liked the decoration of the place too
author: saroj y.

description:
Wednesday night is a tough night to go out on.  Entertaining some friends I figured the Marina would a be a nice place to hit up.  Unfortunately the whole of Marina was dead.  Hopping from bar to bar this was one of the stops.  I really wish Kirti P's review of her experience here would have been the same night my friends were her.

I think my friends would've liked Hilary supports and not for their politics.  Ha!  I'd come here again and maybe, just maybe it will turn out to be a great night for politics.
author: Po L.

description:
Found this place to be very good for wine.

Extensive list and tnhe right amount of appetizers.  Try the Truffle Popcorn.  Wow!
author: Dee F.

description: Great place to chill out with good food and good wine.  The chair pairs with the little tables were fun and different.  They have regular tables and chairs as well.  I'd specify in my reservation to make sure you get what you want.  Excellent pizetta.  Their famous truffle popcorn is interesting, but is really just popcorn with truffle oil.  Housemade salume platter (which must be mandatory in San Francisco this year) was also very tasty, though two of the meats were indistinguishable.  They have an extensive wine list, their literary descriptions don't do much to help you pick out a glass of wine, but they make great reading.  Service was attentive and helpful.
author: J.D. W.

description: Wow!  I just had the best time at Nectar on Saturday night!  The menu is set up in a genius style you can order small tastes of everything so you can fully progress through one style of wine or try a bunch of things before you commit!  Our server, Robin (that was the name on the check) really made our night fantastic.  He was super knowledgeable and had great recommendations for our choices and even offered us tastes of a few wines when we were indecisive.  He really made the HUGE list approachable and fun.  The entire staff was really attentive and kept stopping by to check in even when it got really busy.  We didn't eat much but the tuna tartar was delicious, really clean flavors and texture.  We stayed much longer than planned and still escaped with about a $100 check for 3 of us.  I love Nectar and I think it's a great value and can be a learning experience too.
author: R G.

description: Had the 2008 kaiken malnec, argentina and was happy to meet Robin who told me all about the wines. A nice little wine bar with a staff that is passionate, friendly and just plain cool. Like San Francisco, Nectar is sophisticated without being pretentious, and lends its self to an eclectic mix of varietals.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Yes I am still a huge fan of Nectar... I frequent this intimate Marina wine bar 2 to 3 times a week, so I am not ashamed to say that I am a proud regular happy customer.  I always take each and every friend of mine that lives out of town, here to my favorite wine bar. 
Ok I admit that I'm bias in regards to its location... Ok so I'm a Marina girl; I favor most... in my neighborhood.  
But it goes way beyond the fact that it's geographically perfect for me, the friendly astute sommeliers, especially Alex influences me to return again and again. They seriously give the most knowledgeable advice of their impressive selection of wine.  And the overall charming ambiance: big loungy loveseats, swanky inviting bar, music not too loud that conversation with friends or a date is comfortable... all leave a smile on my face. The appetizers or small plates compliment the wine perfectly. The only slight dissappointment was they changed the Ahi Tuna Tartar. It no longer is presented in a round shaped with the thinly sliced cucumber. But they do have Mac and Cheese which is absolutely delicious!
Definitely one of my all time favorite places!
author: Myra M.

description: Just went to Nectar tonight for the first time. I loved it! Great selection of wines. We had 2 glasses of wine each at half price and they were all wonderful. We sat in the chairs against the wall and they were cozy and comfortable. I've been to quite a few wine bars around the city and so far I like the selection here the best. While others might make fun of the descriptions of the wine, I found them really fantastic...very creative and on top of it they seemed to be correct....Nice music was playing and the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Will go there over and over to try all the different wines. Thanks so much for the relaxing evening!
author: ellen m.

description: I've been to Nectar Wine Lounge a number of times and have always had a really nice experience.  Very comfortable place for a first date, or meeting with a small group of friends.  Excellent wine selection and the menu is great!
author: Jane D.

description: I have only been here once, but had a fabulous time when I went! I did the sparkling wine tasting and the white wine tasting, loves! And for dinner I got one of their pizzas (shared with a friend). Love the vibe and decorations, and lighting inside. Sat at a table with about 10 friends for a bday party. Great place, love the tastings and food menu!!!
author: Chrissy A.

description:
you know whats the best thing about having a friend thats studying to be a sommelier? helping them study means you drink the wine they are "studying".  besides BEING a sommelier, i think helping one studying has got to be the best job in the fucking world. 

the staff was freaking awesome. from reading the reviews, i guess it can be hit or miss. the lady that was helping us, jenn, she took a whole bunch of time explaining things about the wines, about being a sommelier (fyi she had just passed her advances certification). she even brought us a semi blind flight of some blaaablaablaaa i cant remember valley old world wines. she wanted to see if little grasshoper can fetch the pebble. grasshopper needs more practice. 

the place looks nice, the crowd? ehhh im not there for them, i was there for us, the staff, JENN IS AWESOME!!!!!!!! thank you. 

personally, im much more of the casual sit back and relax person that is the hidden vine, but once in awhile you gotta class yourself up. this is going in the rotation mos def. ummmm did i hear correct? 700+ different wine? thats nuts. i mustve been "studying" too much. 

will go back for the food *reserving one star for this* and wait theres cougars there on the weekends? damn this babyface is SOOOO there.
author: Euge L.

description: Great selection of wine, a very chill place but the menu has dwindled. It is easy to end up spending a good bit here. The Ahi Tuna is delicious and they do excellent pairings. It is a great place for good food, and ambiance just wish I could afford it more. They have a great happy hour from 5-7 M-F which I have to remember it is 50% of wines and on Thursdays they often have a DJ playing.
author: Natasha M.

description: Great wine, amazing atmosphere, and awesome staff!  The cheese plate was delicious and the truffle popcorn rocked!  A great spot to drink with some friends and enjoy some tasty wine and food.
author: Carolyn D.

description:
A seasoned Nectarphile introduced me to the flights on special last night in a show of true camaraderie.  The place was busier than she was used to, so sharing it with newbies may not be a good idea.  Lucky for me, this lovely lady is not selfish.  Or she just didn't know any better.  No mind, score for me!
We had a nice flight of four wines from Spain and Portugal, and Luis (the distributor I believe) came by to chat several times.  On his first stop he gave us a great, in depth description of each wine which was fun and helpful.
The staff were absolutely fabulous and totally entertained us in the devious scheme we hatched over our final glass of wine.  They even doled out a couple of free glasses after I saved the place from burning down!!!  Hey guys, be careful with the paper menu-votive candle combo; I may not be there to bound to the rescue next time.  I'm a wine superhero!  Let's pick out a name for me!  Dionysus' Avenger?  Bacchus' Protector?  The Exaggerator?
The truffle popcorn was delish and the little pizetta was so good I seriously had dreams about it that night.  Maybe just because I hadn't been expecting much and the flavors were so fresh and simple, but it seriously hit the spot.
Not the cheapest spot on the face of the planet, but so incredibly worthwhile it's not even funny.  So good I didn't even notice the Marina crowd in fact.  Okay, well not much at least.
author: Jennifer D.

description: On the pricey side even for a wine bar. The seating is a little uncomfortable. I don't live in this part of town and would definitely not travel over here for this spot but I guess I would stop again if I was in the neighborhood with a friend and they knocekd me out carried me over their shoulder AND paid for my drinks. Oh and the servers are birdbrained and the food is dull.
author: Adrienne P.

description: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday last year and it was a great choice. Order the molten chocolate cake and a "kick ass red wine flight".  I also had the best shiraz/port combination in my entire life. I dream thinking of that glass of wine.
author: Maria D.

description: I finally had the chance to visit Nectar and am now wondering why it took me so long! The space itself is warm yet modern, and oh so welcoming. While the showcase here is of course the wine, Nectar also doesn't disappoint in the food department. Anything from the cheese plate to the duck is excellent, and I'm looking forward to trying their lamb sirloin and tenderloin kebab. In regards to the wine, one of the owners stopped by our table and suggested two fantastic offerings - a zinfindel and syrah - but it's so easy to try a flight or order a glass and exlpore a little. Come to think of it, I might do that now...
author: Nish N.

description: Very cool atmosphere.  Great wines.  I love this place.  One of my favorites in the city.  It's not super crowded either so you can actually get a seat.  I love bringing out of town guests here.
author: Kim D.

description: I'm all about wine bars. And I have to say I enjoy the atmosphere, wine and cheese selection here... but the service... not so much. I find that if I'm sitting at the bar, the service is much friendler and more attentive than if I'm sitting at a table. So the four stars go to the bar. As for ambiance, I love the loungy feel... and I'd also say this is one of the few places that gets the music level just right. You can hear it - yet carry a conversation at the same time - a rarity in this town.
author: a p.

description: great atmosphere, over the top but funny wine descriptions, and friendly service. i recommend the truffled oil popcorn with chives for a late nite nibble.
author: Helen Y.

description: that the wine-list is more extensive (and infinitely more reasonably priced) than Gary Danko says much for this upstart trendy wine-bar that challenges the notion of what a wine bar should be.  Beat up wooden bar with beat up wooden gray-hairs snarfling stale pretzels at the trough?  Not here...sleek glass and brushed metal greet the well-dressed relatively youngish who groove to french d.j. tunes and scarf down ridiculously good (if small) wine friendly cuisine while laughing at the outlandish (if accurate) wine descriptions.  there are definitely a few dogs on the list, but overall the selections are well-thought out and very well priced.  If you're more than two, definitely hit that Bottle List...the chatty guys behind the bar seem to know it like the bible.  a chill place to kill an entire evening, it hits that balance between cool/fun and seriousness about wine just right.
author: Kosuke I.

description: Love the cozy chairs, the knowledgeable and friendly staff, and lengthy wine list. Definitely eat before you go because you will want to drink a lot and the food, while delicious, comes in pricey-for-the-tiny-size portions.
author: Leigh M.

description: Finally made it to Nectar with a girlfriend after work for Happy Hour.  I absolutely love their wine flights.  More wine bars need to have flights.  It's a great way to taste 3 different wines.  Anyway, I had the red wine flight and the wines were amazing. The wines were from Portugal, Spain, and Argentina.  Absolutely fabulous!  Each glass was about 1/2 full, so it ended being about a glass and 1/2 of wine.  Very generous!  The decor is great; dark and simple.  The only complaint I have is that the chairs were not the most comfortable.  Great place to go after work if you live in the area!  OH, and I'm moving to Nob Hill, so if anyone knows of any wine bars in this area, recommendations are much appreciated! Thanks ;)
author: Jenny W.

description:
after eating at bobo's on friday night, my bf and i came here to grab some drinks. 

i loved this place. Great selection of wines. very friendly staff. trendy, playing hip hop music. dimmed lighting, this is a great place for couples and groups.
author: Steph S.

description: This is my favorite wine bar in the city because it was where my man and I went on our first date. ;) Perfect date ambiance... Quiet, dimly lit and cozy. Great wine selections, neatly grouped to make choosing one easier! Prices are a bit steep ($12-15/glass) but the wine flights are a good deal. Desserts are tasty (though a bit small for my sweet tooth). It's definitely my go-to place for a romantic evening.
author: Grace M.

description: They certainly know what they are talking about when it comes to wine... maybe that's why it's so pricey.  The menu is extensive and every wine has an "easy to understand" description. I've never been disappointed with the tastings or glasses I've ordered.  Also it's essential to partake in the cheese plate and at least one other nibble while you sip you wine.  It just completes the experience.
author: Zoe K.

description: Nectar successfully walks the fine line between being overly trendy and being a cool spot for consuming fine wines. The servers are knowledgeable and happy to field questions and make suggestions. While you won't get a complete dinner, Nectar does offer a good array of tapas-style nibbles. The wine flights are eclectic and ecleticly named. If you're looking for something a bit more casual, check the California Wine Merchant around the corner on Chestnut (specializing in California wines).
author: Patrick B.

description: Nice atmosphere and great wine, but make sure to double check your visa bill later.  They charged me twice on my card for the same bill, so I had to call and clear it up.
author: Sonia A.

description: Started off my bachelorette party here and what a good start. They set you up with enough wine and champagne to drink that it becomes bottomless. Not to mention delicious platter of cheeses and meats. They are very attentive and not one single girl lifted her hand to pour or cut anything. Friendly management that ensured seamless running of the whole entire affair. i would choose them again for any big or small event. Lovely people, fantastic location, great venue. Then ambiance is great, truly what you want a wine bar to be.
author: S P.

description:
How could one not be intrigued by a place serving wines described as "a lithe, leather-clad greco-roman wrestler...and an afterthought of earthy tannin that lingers like coliseum dust" or "a midnight tryst with a well chiseled youth who daubs his adonis temples with raspberry &
white pepper cologne"?

We got a kick out of reading the wine list before we visited, which has enough metaphorical descriptions of fantasy erotica characters that you'd feel rather unadventurous ordering the "plush yet prim, velvety plums rolled in bitter cocoa and exotic spice" instead of the "dust enrobed gladiator bedaubed with sandalwood who proffers a regal repast of ripe melons, clove dotted pineapple and fennel-pollen coated guava on a platter of pine boughs"...

You can get wine flights (3 wines) for $14 or taste individual wines for $5. Each are about 1/2 a glass--great deal.  Some of the wines were on the light side, but all were very aromatic. Two friends and I had the rose, five whites and a red, described in detail below.  Generally, we found the wines to be aromatically complex and very exciting on the nose, but a few were too light on the palate.

The foie gras terrine was nicely plated with a tasty huckleberry compote, but actually it was the phyllo-wrapped mushroom duxelle which blew me away.  They were just-out-of-the-oven, irresistible puff pastries on drizzles of tangy garlic aioli.

Wine reviews below:

Anything but Chard Flight
2006 Catelle, Fiano 'Alticelli', Salento, Italy
This smelled fantastic on the nose, like peach schnapps and lemon zest as described, but was disappointingly fleeting on the palate.  We actually wondered if the tasting glass had been watered down.

2006 Ladairo, Godello, Monterrei, Spain
Nice and medium-bodied, yummy almond flavors on the nose with syrupy undertones.  Less "manly" than described ("a muscular, dusty & austere spanish lad whose bitter almond breath recalls the fate of unrequited love"...maybe the sweeter implications of unrequited love escaped me when reading the menu)

2006 Chateau de Campuget, Viognier 'Cuve Prestige', Rhone, France
This one's a star!  I thought I was smelling jasmine and fruit tea instead of wine.  Intensely aromatic and deliciously fruity.

2006 Le St. Andre, Ros (Cabernet, Syrah, Grenache, Cinsault) Provence, France
My friend proclaimed this "all apple juice" and I agreed.

2005 Cliff Lede, Claret (Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc) Stags Leap, California
Another star--props to the waitress who recommended this.  Very full-bodied, intense berry flavors, smooth and velvety texture.

I'll definitely visit again!
author: Christine S.

description:
the most entertaining part of this wine bungalow was it's wines-by-the-glass menu! my favorite one was describing a pinot noir as something like a burly man's chest. hMm. who writes this stuff?! i commend you!

apart from some light and giggly reading, the service was prompt and considerate. on a busy saturday night, it was pretty much one guy running the show, making sure that everyone was happy and serviced.

side note: you can make reservations people! do it if you know your plans. also, the crowds peak at about 9:50pm it seems.

the wine list is extensive; it attempts to go for breadth of countries more than quality wines. there are some interesting small wineries listed though, so if you like those random corks, it might be for you!

otherwise, this really is a bungalow. it is on the small and narrow side, gets really warm, and requires raising of the voice to be heard in conversation. the convenient location works well for post-dinner drinks - i would come back with friends to socialize, but not necessarily to experience the wines. 

sweet, yes. sugar rush, not quite. though i may be back for that burly man. haha!
author: Diana L.

description:
Last night was my 4th or 5th visit. I consistently enjoy this tucked away wine bar. The food is tasty, the service is very good and friendly in an unpretentious way, and the wine selection is wonderful. It's worth it just to go and read the descriptions in the wine list, an evenings worth of entertainment can be had reading them to one another at the table. 
Last night the ubiquitous Mr. F and I nipped in after a  lovely beer and cheese tasting at the SF cheese school. We were in need of some protein and carbohydrate back up after foundering ourselves on cheese. We ordered the Charcuterie platter with the house-made pate, the lomo, and the braseola. They were all very good, a testament to the beauty of porcine and bovine fabulousness two small ramekins of mustard, a dijon and a seedy brown along with olives, some thinly sliced onion, capers and bread made there way to the table with the meats and we're rapidly consumed. We followed that up with the smoked salmon flatbread. It was tasty, and the crust was crisp and light. I would have liked to see a little more lemon zest in the creme fresh topping, I felt it needed a little more zing and I was unable to detect any lemon at all. Mr. F had a flight of bubbles and I had the Anything but Chardonnay flight. I enjoyed the minerally, crisp Riesling that presented itself first and the Verdejo. Mr. F enjoyed his bubbles and we finished up by sharing a glass of Uncle Dick, the sparkling Shiraz, which, I lamented I hadn't ordered earlier because it would have been lovely with the charcuterie.
author: Joyce H.

description: One of my favorite places to hang out.  It is never overly crowded, has pleasing decor, wonderful small plate offerings and fantastic wines.  The owners really put forth the effort by not just offering the "same old stuff".  Chris is very knowledgeable and is quick to offer great suggestions, so don't be intimidated by the wide selection, they are there to help.
author: Max C.

description: Great place to go if you need a good glass of wine and some effortless but yummy appetizers. We went on a Friday night at 8:30 and it wasn't as crowded as most places in the Marina. Walked right in and got seats on their comfy chairs.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Never too crowded, okay service, good selection at decent prices, great ambiance.  I haven't had the food here but it's cozy and small, but not loud or too crowded even on weekends.  I think it closes earlier than the other wine bars in the area, though.  It's just an easy place to meet a friend for a drink, and it's near my apartment so I don't have to look for parking, which can be tricky in this area.
author: James B.

description: This place is FANTASTIC!!  I have been here several times and it does not disappoint.  I have tried every flight and they are all excellent  and the food is also amazing.  One caveat, while it is fine for groups, the furniture is not of the "lounge-y" variety which made it seem a little uncomfortable with a lot of people crammed around a smaller table.
author: Cassandra E.

description: If you're in the Marina district and have some time to kill before a dinner reservation, I recommend this spot.  Very cool and hip place to pay for overpriced glasses of wine (this is expected).  The service was great, we were moved due to a party that showed up late and we were given a complimentary glass of dessert wine of our choice for each us.   I need to learn more about the old world wines, but I do know the pinot in the desert section is damn good.
author: Jason A.

description: I was fully for an extremely awkward "I'm doing great, how are you" drink with my ex here.  Instead, the atmosphere (friendly without being date-y) made us both feel at ease, the wine list was great, and it wasn't too noisy.  I even had a great time! Great place to grab a drink with a friend or to keep the ambiguity on a non-date.
author: Sloane R.

description: Great wines, delicious food and exceptional service.  Chris, the manager, even let me in before business hours one day and poured a glass for me in an effort to help me figure out what I had the last time I was there (weeks ago).  Spent 3 hours there last night and never felt rushed, in fact, we were treated like old friends.  So nice!
author: Beth D.

description: I love the space...but I think their wine list is awful!  I'd much rather take a trip down to the wine merchant on Chestnut which a selection that FAbulous daaaaaling...muhahahaha.
author: Sarah D.

description: Great wine, enthusiastic staff, great fun location, a bit upscale but this can be fun, outstanding "small plate" food.  I've been here a few dozen times and always loved it.  Watch you wallet, your tab can run up fast if you are not careful.
author: Art A.

description:
DISCLAIMER: I am a Marina novice, and intend to stay that way. eh, call me closed minded.

Nectar was not our original destination but it seemed like a decent place to hang out while we waited for our table down the street. From the minute we walked in, I noticed that there was only one male in the entire place. One would have thought there was some Hillary Clinton fundraising event going on...turns out it was just a regular night at this place.
author: kirti p.

description:
I came here on a singularly terrible first date a few years ago---no fault of Nectar's, but instead a failure on the part of my better judgment---and have been raving about the wine, and ranting about my company, ever since.

I want to know who wrote the Nectar wine-by-the-glass menu.  You read the description, and then you sample your flight, and you think, "How in Hell did they put to words this taste?!"  They write, "a shadowy girl with smoky celadon eyes," or "an autumnal forest zephyr," and you say, "Exactly!"

Wines are "extroverted" and "thought-provoking," and also reasonably priced.  You can buy bottles for in-restaurant consumption, or at retail price, to take home.

They also serve food, and while I wish I could speak to its quality, I can't: That miserable date I mentioned earlier ate every last morsel of our pizzetta and artisanal cheeses.
author: Hannah J.

description: Chic wine bar offering an excellent selection of wines and food pairings.  Choose from a huge selection of wines by the glass or by the bottle..the wine descriptions are quite wild.  If you are new to wine or an enthusiast this is one of the best places in the city to explore your palette.  The staff is very knowledgeable and create a very comfortable setting for you to enjoy your wine.
author: Keith S.

description: Love this place. There is another wine bar around the corner that is always packed and appears to have 1/2 the class. The servers are knowledgeable and not snooty - hard pair to find in a wine bar. The menu is fantastic and I could eat their cheese platter all night. Sign up for their mailing so you can be on the list for the 50% off nights but be sure to ask for that special menu (the old one) or you might be ordering off hate new menu - which is sure to be good - but not at discount. Go for a date or just to chat with friends - it is perfect for both.
author: CarOline C.

description:
one time, my friend sternkid and i came here for a flight. we sat in the corner and watched a marina girl be devastated over something her boyfriend did, or ex-boyfriend, or maybe it was her failure to make the abercrombie and fitch sale on time. anyways, it was sad to watch, as she cried up a storm. why? why? why?

then she tried to stand up, and we realized that although she was sad, she was even more hammered, possibly way beyond what's humanly possible. and she stumbled and clawed her way around, bumping into people, crashing into walls, and it began to look like something jim carrey and will ferrell would have a wet dream about. i mean, it was like she was walking on an earthquake. 

that's how her sadness became funny.

five stars.
author: Steve T.

description: Attended a friends surprise birthday party here and lucky for me it was a private affair with a dozen or so people. I had the fortunate experience of having the various wines already picked out to go with amazing dishes prepared especially for us. Yum, yum, yum, and yum!
author: melissa g.

description:
Nectar has some nice little wine tasting deals; we chose a flight of sparkling wine, and got generous-sized tastes of three pre-determined sparking wines. (There were two champagnes and a Prosecco, and all were delicious.)
Having had a mishap with a muddy box of kale earlier in the day, I wasn't looking my best, and was somewhat reluctant to go, but seeing as my co-worker was looking very good, I figured I would go and just kind of hide behind her. At 5:00 pm when we arrived, it was very quiet, with just one other group of people there. Soon afterward, many, many gals came flocking to Nectar... the ratio of women to men was similar to that of a nail salon... or a convent. My friend and I were the only people of color in the place, except for our server, who was also a person of color, and who seemed to hate our guts. She gave good information about the wines when we asked questions, but she did so in an utterly bored, rote recitation sort of way. 

At Nectar, it's fun to read the extremely poetic and fanciful descriptions of the wines in the wine book (something about toasted almonds kissing a tear stained cheek in autumn and a caress of spearmint... no kidding), the selection is vast, and the bar, excuse me, lounge, is pretty inside.
