It's apparently a place where you can bring a baby, get drunk, and no one looks askance: a Marina MILF- type teetered over to us on her narrow heels, smiling expansively, and told me her son had a huge crush on me and couldn't take his eyes off me. The son in question was an infant so young I don't think his eyes were even focused.

*edit* 

On my second visit to Nectar, I tried two appetizers-- one was a phyllo dough-wrapped mushroom puff with two dabs of aoli... yummy but teeny-tiny. I guess that's to be expected. The other was their black truffle popcorn. It's super salty and oily and you can taste the delicate black truffle flavor. A big yum when you're getting slightly drunk! 

(Appetizer prices will run up quickly, so if you're hungry and budget-conscious, just get the black truffle popcorn to nibble while you have a drink and then stagger right next door to Barney's for a burger and fries.)

 The service was nice this time around so I changed my stars from 3 to 4.
author: Dani Y.

description:
Nicely done,  overall. So hard to know the variables of a new cafe industry in a trendy neighborhood...how casual to get, what level of  wine sophistication, how to make flights work for generic as well as refined wine consumers...

Nectar seems to have a good idea of what they are putting together, especially with staff. Very approachable with a variety of customers er...guests (as I heard the pourer correct himself).

As with all food purveyors, for the consumer it comes down to a connection with the staff more than a connection with the wine.
author: salty j.

description:
This place kills me.  First off, I have to say I've never eaten here, only have a bunch of wine, so I can't speak for the quality of the food (although I did have a pretty good cheese plate once).  Having said that, I love coming here.  They generally have a very good, if somewhat eclectic, wine selection and the servers are always ready to recommend something that's often, off the beaten track.  I've had several wines here that were from producers I've never heard of and all were good, with a couple being legitimately excellent.
The menu/wine list is what brings me back here.  I'm still not sure if these guys are unsufferably full of themselves or just have a wicked sence of humor (I suspect maybe both) but the wine list reads like a great magazine article.
Describing wines as being "reminicient of a lingering kiss with a dill pickle" and "Tasting like the bright dewdrops of a spring morning," is 200% awesome.  Wine bars are generally waaaaay too concerned with their stuffed shirt, holier than thou images to surrender to the kind of sharp humor that Nectar write into their menus.  Bravo.
author: Joshua L.

description: I really can't say enough good things about the truffle popcorn -- magnifico! I also am a big fan of the malbecs this place serves; they're excellent. If the chocolate souffle is on the menu, do not pass it up!
author: Andrew K.

description: Oi.  Pretty place, pretty people, pretty high prices for pretty average wine.
author: Tara H.

description: The service is horrible at the Marina location. They didn't have a menu for appetizers and the waitress was rude when we asked for a menu. She yelled that they don't have a menu because their food changes everyday. What place serves food but doesn't have a printed menu? When we wanted our bill it took forever. Then she took her grand time to pick it back up. The atmosphere isn't very well thought out. I thought the lighting, painting, and furniture didn't mesh well. The wine I ordered was really good. Probably one of the best glasses I've had in a while. So if you are going with a group of friends and you can ignore the service/atmosphere then Nectar is okay.
author: Deepak J.

description: I thought this place was a perfect little nook for a wine bar.  The dishes were small and perfect to share.  I went with group of girlfriends and we shared some mushroom flatbread, a cheese plate, and many bottles of champagne.  It was a very casual and relaxed atmosphere.  The service was attentive and warm with their suggestions.  It is a perfect place to start the evening for a ladies night out.
author: Lyndsey H.

description:
This is the best wine bar in the city, if you want to focus on wine. The staff are far more knowledgeable than most wine bar servers. Every time we come in, we meet others who know a ton about wine...and often share their bottles and knowledge with us. This is the only place in the Marina that I set as a special destination. (Lately it seems like weekends in the Marina are filled with wannabe sophisticates who are severely lacking.)

Surprisingly, this place has a high percentage of true wine lovers - about 25% of the customers (compared to about 5% at other wine bars). Another quarter of the customers are out for a nice evening out, where they enjoy the wine. The other half are normal Marina restaurant-goers - they seem like mate hunters from the suburbs and other neighborhoods who just want to feel and look fancy.
author: Look and C.

description: Ok, here's my thing with Nectar: I can order a glass of viogner for $12 or I can buy the bottle for $19 and walk out the door.  I don't have an issue with the $12, but what this says to me is, "for $7 you can have four more glasses if you'll just go away".  Please don't share your hideous mark-ups with me.  Thanks.
author: Amy K.

description:
Love this wine bar because of the great wines and the great staff.  I've been here several times now and I love trying new wines and appreciate a knowledgeable staff.  I like being able to tell someone the types of wines I like, ex. Burgundy,  and what kind of mood I'm in, and have them pick a flight spanning varietals and country of origin or region.  Damn near prescient!    

Seriously, in all my years of drinking wine and in all the bars, wine bars included, which is a lot spanning the globe, well who's counting, they are by far the most knowledgeable.  They are friendly and not the least bit snooty.  Kudos to the Nectar sommeliers and bartenders.  Never been poured something I did not like.  And never ended up with a bill that was ridiculous.  

On top of which, during happy hour, every glass is HALF off.  Every glass in the place, not just the crappy wines most other wine bars are trying to pawn off as great deals during happy hour.  How can you beat that?

This place is first class
author: Julie C.

description:
this is one of my fave wine bars!! i love the atmosphere, it's sleek and loungey, but not overly pretentious. there's nice mood music, but it's still very easy to talk to whoever you're with. they have a nice lounge area in the front , and tables along the wall and in the back, if you're coming more for a meal. 

i've never really had a full meal here, usually just something to munch on while having a glass of wine, or two, or three...but the food seems really good. the bartenders are always really knowledgeable and friendly and i've never had a bad glass of wine here!!  the service is great, they're as present as you want them to be. if you're at the bar, they're happy to chat with you about wines or whatever, but also happy to leave you alone if that's what you want. and they're quite inobtrusive, clearing each of my glasses as i went through the flight and filling my water glass without me even knowing!! hmm...perhaps the conversation was pretty engaging too.. 

last night i did the bubbles flight (yay, for bubbles), and then did the 'tour de espana' flight, which was also quite tasty. my date did the pinot noir flight and then the bad assed reds flight, and i tried one of them which was pretty good.  

this is a great place to meet up with friends or a first date or for whatever you want it to be!
author: Angela W.

description: While the descriptions of the wines are at times a little...a LOT...over the top (I believe my selection was described "Thigh Quivering")...this is a great place for an upscale experience without an upscale price.  The wine menu is extensive and adventurous, and while I haven't come yet for the food, I hope I can come back.  The host is very accommodating, friendly and will keep an eye out for you for a great table.  One star off for our waitress, who was brief with us, and more eager to keep her eye on the clock (it was near the end of the night) than on our table.  If you like your wine selection, you can take home a bottle at retail price, which is great, and I scored a WONDERFUL Argentinean wine at a great price!  The ambiance is dark and warm, and the walls are donned with unique art and paintings, all for sale, and so I assume changes frequently.
author: Cathleya G.

description: Lovely and cozy place for anyone who is interested in good wine, good conversation, and good service.
author: Anya B.

description: Went there for the first time last night for an AOL party.  It was pretty hip and happening.  The wines on the list for the party were all very nice and the service was very good, especially since we being served were a bunch of intoxicated freeloaders.  They had some really yummy o'doeuvres, my favorite was the pulled duck.
author: Steve S.

description: Love their flights, always a fun time with the ladies... Miss it so!
author: Jessie H.

description: You have to love a wine list that describes a red as having flavors of "seared ahi"...interesting wine list and great small bites...
author: Katie C.

description: I really enjoyed myself here the other night. The selection is excellent and well diversified. I had the flight of Reds which was excellent. The atmosphere is very relaxed and doesn't take itself too seriously. The bar was full of cool folks who seemed genuinely interested to their wine drinking and conversation. I did not eat here so I cannot comment on the food but it looks as though other reviewers enjoyed it. The only reason why I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because our server was a little "stand-offish" and just gave my friend and I a weird vibe. Otherwise, I would say that this is a fantastic place to start your night.
author: Gabriel R.

description: It's cool because it's small and unpretentious. Sure it's sleek inside, but that doesn't mean it's stuffy. I like reserving a table for a small group of friends and just kick back and enjoy some tasty food and wine from their extensive wine list. Plenty of wines by the glass, but the best thing would be to have at least four people in your party so that you can share a couple of bottles. We had six and went through a red, white and dessert. Vino is always better straight from the bottle...never know how long some of those bottles have been open when you order by the glass.
author: Virg Y.

description: A bunch of us randomly strolled in here one night looking for a place to hang out.  Everyone ordered their own flight of wines but no food.  Wussies.  The white wine flight was just ok.  I don't remember the wines specifically but I remember they were nothing spectacular.  The red flight was a little bit better.  The atmosphere of this place is very cozy and laid back.  I liked how the lounging area had true lounging couches and no chairs.  For larger groups this isn't a good place to go.  We had 6 people and we were already crowded.  The only complaint I have is the spot we were sitting the AC above was dripping down on the manatee.  Yeah she lives in the water but not AC water.  She only likes sea water.
author: Fatty A.

description: Even the name is sexy--Nectar suggests the essence and the pure lust of experiencing perhaps the forbidden fruit, or as an oenophile, a flight of wines.  The lounge is plush yet simple, elegant yet casual.  We opted to share several offerings of cheese, duck and chicken all which paired nicely with our Syrah and Zinfandel.  This is a place to explore your intrigue with wine, try a little bit of this, a little bit of that, and ask for the ever gracious Chris Potter, owner and sommelier--he will make your visit extraordinary.
author: Jaena G.

description: Lovely decor, kinda ikea meets industrial.  Amazing wine selection. I had an Austrian Gruner Veltliner that was extremely yummy.  Just a nice place to hang out with friends, have some good conversation and some good wine.
author: Lauren G.

description: Beautiful atmosphere and great to meet a date. The small plates range from around $12-19, although I wouldn't order the Kobe beef and asparagus- as the beef is overcooked. To be honest, I wouldn't order the small plates as I think they are too expensive for the portion- however, if you're there for the wine, the bartender knows what he's talking about and there is a large selection.
author: Noel H.

description: This wine lounge didn't strike me as particularly pretentious as mentioned.  Extensive wine list and the wine flights were reasonably priced.  We were on the early side so I couldn't really determine the vibe, but I think it's a good Marina date joint.
author: Amy Z.

description: I liked it, really liked it.  It's got a much more inviting feel than ca wine merchant and much more room to lounge. Friendly staff that gave some good reccos on wines.
author: Amanda H.

description: Super Swank!!!  This place was so unexpected as my sis and I strolled in!!  I just cannot get enough!!  Their cheese platter was sooo perfect and perfectly paired to our libations!!  The ambiance is so rad..dim, warm, soft colors and the stewards!!  ohmigoodness, i believe one to be the owner and she was so incredibley helpful!!!  Their wine list is as long as the hearts I have broken!!  I am so in love with this place!!  Great place to go with the girls or a date!!!
author: blair k.

description: Excellent wine tasting flights and winelist!  Love their starter dishes that complement the wines.  Very stylish and trendy place to lounge before/after dinner.  Not ideal for a large group.
author: Gina W.

description: I am generally a beer/martini person, and tend to limit wine drinking to eating, but Nectar is such a great place to relax, I am willing to forgo the usual beer and vodka for a few, expensive, glasses of wine. Been to less pricey places with more choices, but I can always find a Cab I like here.  Great place to get a buzz (or drunk if necessary) before moving on to dinner, although I tend to stay too long and have missed one or two reservations.  The bathroom situation, however, is troubling: they only have one single user bathroom.  For the angst that causes me, minus one star.
author: Brad Z.

description: Of the Marina wine bars, Nectar is my 1st choice (In part because Wine Star can be so hit or miss).  Their food is solid, but not overly memorable.  The seating is totally variable -- and can make your night or leave you feeling underwhelmed.  The witty menu earns them a star...
author: Heather C.

description: Love this wine bar.  It's in the marina w/o the typical marina crowd.  Pretty classy bar, which I like.  Went with a friend and we shared a flight of reds and an appetizer which was a bit pricey (I think $19 for 4 pieces) but great nonetheless.  I love the vibe inside and the artwork.  Yes, it's small but since the crowd was cool, I didn't really notice the size.  I also saw a good number of couples here so it seems to be a popular dating spot.
author: Nene K.

description: After vacationing in Florence for a week, I came here on Saturday night with my two Italian friends.  Although a wine producing country, Italy/Florence doesn't really have a "wine bar" quite like what we have in SF. I tried a bubbles flight for $16 and liked each of my bubbles. My friends got the chard and red flights, which they enjoyed, which means a lot since Andrea's family makes wine in italy. To accompany our wine, we had the truffle popcorn (very very good), I had corn soup (really tasty and creamy, but not too creamy), they choose the cheese, we had the ahi poke (yummy with the sesame oil), pizza and carpaccio. All of the food was really good and I like sitting at the bar.
author: Natalie S.

description: Came here on a wine-and-cheese specialty pairing night.  My friend and I agreed that the cost was worth it for the pairings, we probably would not come by otherwise -- we can't handle a place where there are only a few choices by the glass under $10.  Not saying I want to be cheap, but $12 for a glass of Conundrum -- a bottle that retails around $24 -- is getting steep.  The setting is beautiful, though -- a wonderful place to hang out with friends.
author: Nat K.

description:
the waitresses here are super nice and i especially liked them for their fabulous taste in music. ryan adams, wilco and the shins were in the rotation. love that. 

seven of us shared some of their small plates a couple bottles of wine. the pecorino cheese with figs and truffle honey was a nice way to start. the sausage flatbread (probably the most substantial serving) was really nice too.  also liked shrimp ceviche. skip the kobe beef asparagus lollipops since the beef puts the kobe name to shame. the food is worthy of only 3 stars, but you're really here to drink the wine and lounge in their very comfy chairs.
author: rachel p.

description: What a Marina favorite of mine. Affordable wine flights and awesome food to share! I would love to share with you what we ordered but my procrastination lead me to carelessly throw away the receipt listing all the great food we ordered. Sweet Place. Coming Back. -Matt
author: Matthew C.

description: Overpriced. Uncomfortable seating. Don't go for any of the entrees or desserts -- choices unexciting and portions tiny.
author: David P.

description: Great place to get a glass of wine or two before heading out for dinner on Chestnut Street.
author: shoba d.

description: Great wine bar! The wine list was fabulous! So much to choose from! I loved how you can get "taste" of various wines. Not too much, so you don't get drunk too fast. My friend and I also had dinner here. We started with the crab cake, which was delicious! it was huge, crispy and full of meat. Next, we had the skirt steak with frites! Yum.. it was lean, rare, and juicy. The last samll plate we had was the pork ribs. I thought they were a bit dry and tough, but it was okay. For dessert, we had the mexicano chocolate cake. It didn't impress me much since it was too dry. Overall, I think this is a great place for wine, but not really for the food.
author: Denise L.

description: I had a good friend of mine work here and really she is the reason i even started drinking wine. I love the variety o this pace. It is a bit small but I'm more of a weekday person so the crows generally aren't that bad. The food is excellent. I'm a little afraid to try things on my own so I usually come here with her so she can hold my hand. The decor is just beautiful and the peeps are usually pretty laid back. It can get loud, but again this generally is what happens on Thur-Sat nights.
author: Alia D.

description: I've been here a few times and it has been good, but not particularly memorable.  Definitely a good wine bar, but with a new Wine-O hangout popping up every month in the Marina, I'm curious as to whether or not this one will make it in the long run.  Differentiate or die!
author: Nate H.

description:
i hit 5 stars because i had a true relaxing experience.
great bartender(very nice and he listen to what i was looking for and his recommandations were more than satisfying!)
great wine.
great cheese.
lynda ate a great pizza.
great music and atmosphere .
great ...SMALL ...check!!!
so yes...5 stars .defenitly 5 stars.
i loved it.i want to go back.
author: marine m.

description: It's tricky to review establishments that aren't food-focused because a) I have to increase coverage of a) ambiance, which rarely figures prominently into my assessment and b) alcohol, on which I'm not much of an expert. Suffice it to say that the various times I have been to Nectar, I have greatly appreciated the ambiance as well as the wine.  Nectar is exactly the kind of place that one would expect of the Marina: dim lighting, art deco lounge chairs, contemporary artwork, and candlelit tables. Top that off with a dressed-to-kill crowd and Nectar could be a wine bar in any of America's various glamour cities. Luckily for me, every time my friends and I have been to Nectar, we've overcome all pretenses of sophistication and have instead lost ourselves in conversation and, of course, wine.  Read more on The Ballyhoo: http://www.ballyhoo.us/restaurants/review.cfm?review=65
author: Baochi N.

description: Wine descriptions on the menu at this wine bar are unbelievably fun to read!  And the bar itself is really cool - comfy bar stools and great art to look at.  They have a good selection of wine by the taste and glass and it's nice that they tell you bottle and retail prices!  Definitely plan on making it back to this wine bar..
author: A L.

description: This is a great place for a blind date (like the couple sitting behind us), a double date (like the four-some sitting behind my date), or for liquor-induced, blatant people-watching and eavesdropping (like me).  The cushiony seats are so comfortable, I pretty much melted into non-existence.  Great wine paired with decent small plates, all offered up in a cozy atmosphere, I would recommend this for a pre-meal or post-meal drink.
author: Liz C.

description: I liked this place.  I was a little concerned because it's in the Marina (for those of you who know So Cal, the Marina is Manhattan Beach north.  Over it).  But, the cheese plate was yummy and I love their flights.  I had the sparkling flight and all were super good.  The waiter was also informative and friendly...even on a Friday night.  The crowd was a little pretentious, but I didn't feel uncomfortable wearing my jeans that night (They were 7's though...who knows if I would've been thrown out if they weren't).  Really, though...if I'm looking for a wine bar, I'd rather stay in Russian Hill or venture out after work in SoMa.
author: Susan L.

description: Maybe I went at the wrong time? Service was only so-so, music was bomb! (gotta love Jack Johnson!), wine was pretty good though the other people in my group didnt love their flight. And the food, eh. I have had better. Hard to pick off the menu b/c it was too simple, boring and predictable. Very dissappointed since it was a bday dinner. Dont think i will be going back or recommend this to anyone.
author: Kai T.

description: Great little wine bar in the marina, not stuffy. Came here after dinner with some friends, comfy seating, mellow DJ (I don't think there's always a dj though). Great wine selection, bartenders are not pretentious and we got a sampling of the truffle popcorn on the house, YUM! I'll be back.
author: christina C.

description: Definitely a Marina vibe here.  Modern space showcasing some decent local artists.  The owners a friendly and go out of their way to keep the music fresh and interesting wihtout being obtrusive.  The wine selection is pretty good, but from what I sampled, all tasty.  The descriptions on their menu are pretty entertaining.
author: J P.

description: Nice and knowledgeable staff, good wine list by the glass with some special bottles as well and the food is fun. The crowd can be young.  It's a nice stop on the way home after work.
author: Ron O.

description: Huge, extensive, and delicious wine list.....My biggest gripe is that this place is tres pricey.....before you know it you spend $ 38 on two glasses of vino....sure went down well.
author: Tracy M.

description: Love the idea of flights, but I wish they would change the list occasionally.  Don't get turned off by the ridiculous descriptions of the wine, just ask the sommelier what's good that week.  I've never had a problem finding seating for a small group.  A quiet, sophisticated way to spend the evening with friends after dinner.
author: Helen C.

description: Nectar is to Marina what Myth is to North Beach... a refreshing escape from the mainstream clubbing scene.  This place is awesome!  Not because of any one thing that is special about it, but because everything is just done so well.  The decor is trendy but comfortable; you can chill on the couch, sit at a table and have appetizers or sit at the bar and talk a knowledgeable bartender.  The wine selection is vast.  If you don't believe me, put aside the regular menu they give you and ask for the full wine list -- it is one thick book.  Every time I've been, it was never too crowded/loud and the atmosphere was very relaxing.
author: M P.

description: I like this place...cute wine bar with a nice wine list with wines from a variety of countries. I haven't tried any of the appetizers though, so can't comment on that. The first time I went there, we ordered wine flights and seriously tried to do a real wine tasting. All in all, a nice place.  (Plus it's quieter and less packed than the California Wine Merchant nearby)
author: Rosie S.

description: This is definitely your typical yuppie Marina gang out bar.  I came here with a group of girlfriends, and managed to get a table with some very comfortable couches.  Nice wine selection, good service.  The cheese plate was a little over priced to me, but that's the Marina for ya. It can get crowded, and be hard to find a seat.
author: Amy L.

description: No parking. Nectar is located in one of the most difficult areas in the city to find parking. But everyone still goes out that way to wine and dine. Nectar was nice but nothing awesome. Wine selection was good. My friends and I each ordered glass and thought it was okay. The snacks were also just okay. I was very disappointed in the tuna tartare that was lacking something. Pizza was the best on the menu. Atmosphere was more like a restaurant than a bar. Not as lively as I had expected it would be.
author: Royce L.

description: Parking sucks.  If you are into quite time and restaurant atmosphere, this is the place for you.  As for me, I found it boring.  The food wasn't great.  The wine I ordered wasn't great (that's probably my fault).  The service isnt' that great either.  Our waitress seem like she would rather be some where else.  Maybe District??  jk.  We headed to District afterwards.
author: Jules M.

description: Went there for a pinot tasting with co-workers. two of the four wines were good, the others ok. The appetizers - duck rolls and cheese plate could have been better.
author: Brian S.

description:
excellent, extensive wine list
don't remember what i ordered exactly but whatever the heck it was, it was AMAZING. i only ordered a half glass because i was so full from dinner, but that half glass was soooo beautiful, floral and fragrant. i couldn't get over it. 
knowledgeable staff, but they could be a bit more attentive

yeah, i'm a comin back......
author: Heidi L.

description: The amazing Som formerly at Absinthe (sp?) has worked here for the past few months.  She is awesome, and has great knowledge, and is very helpful.  For that alone, the place is better.
author: Kapeli M.

description: The wine flights are amazing, reasonably priced and nicely paired. We shared a bunch of appetizers that were all amazing. I especially liked the corn soup with heirloom tomato and crab salad, mmm. The decor is modern and trendy and the seating is very intimate so you can hear the people you're with despite the crowd. I went with a group of 4 and it was amazing. We made a reservation online at open table, which I would recommend because we got a great table!
author: Cassie H.

description: Nectar SF is a great place to sit around with friends and share small plates and a couple bottles of wine.  The wait staff is friendly and well-versed in wines and cheese.  The last time we were here, we had a tart riesling and a really oak-y cab.  Both were great wines and suggested by our server!  The four of us also shared a cheese plate, the smoked salmon flatbread,  roasted red pepper and zucchini pizzetta with pepperoni, braised short rib, and beef carpaccio.  All were very tasty and perfectly prepared and certainly more than enough food for us.
author: Veronica C.

description: I've been back here a few more times, and yup I am a fan.  The service is excellent, the wine list has a wide variety of really good wines, and the food is well perpared and very tasty.   Highly recommended.
author: Kurt L.

description: Every time I walk into Nectar, I feel like staying for hours. It's a delightfully inviting, very warm atmosphere. The staff is very friendly and helpful and they know their wine. All I have to say is the type of wine I'm looking for and either the staff or the owner selects the perfect wine. They are very attentive and they listen to what I'm looking for.  I went here for New Years Eve, and even though its a wine bar, there was a DJ and the atmosphere was so fun. I loved the intimacy and energy of the bar and it was a great place for me and my 10 other friends to chat and have a great time! Overall, with the quality of wine, the carefully selected food pairings, and the entire atmosphere, this is a place that cannot be beat.
author: SK G.

description: We stopped by this chic wine bar to top off a meal down the block at Isa. We have a great bottle of rose champagne, which I will probably order again! Wonderful wine selection, and polite service that really excelled at politely handling "those girls" who had already had too much wine at dinner. I'll be back, but hopefully better composed next time!
author: Kelly C.

description: Every week, we swear we will go somewhere else for dinner....but we still got to Nectar...it is THAT GOOD! The wine flights are amazing, and the staff are as well. They have great recommendations for food and wine pairings, and are very friendly. If you actually take wine seriously and enjoy branching out, Nectar is a great place to try different wines from across the globe. If I could eat and savor wine here every night, I would!
author: Megan W.

description: Great place for wine and some appetizers. The wine is continually changing and always adding something great to try. Good atmosphere for catching up with friends without worrying about a pickup scene.
author: Not M.

description: Random Monday at Nectar with multiple wine flights and snacking on way too many tacos, I realized I like this place. Great selection of wines and champagne, which was my main reason for going anyway.
author: Palak P.

description:
fun place for a fun wine flight. I love having options, and they had several, even one for champagne.  

the food on the other hand was just okay, the warm food was average at best, nothing outstanding or impressive. 

this is a great place to start a chill evening, grab a glass of wine, nibble on some cheese, and  catch up with friends.  

My ideal night....a flight of champagne and the cheese platter at nectar and then dinner next door at Isa =)
author: Joy Y.

description: Never been here before! This place was really cute, comfy chairs, cool set up. The wines were good, and the civche was yummy. Cant tell you how bad the bill was i never got the chance to see it...lol its a good place for a first date. -Even if it doesnt get off the ground at least youre drinking good wine.
author: Farrah S.

description: I went here last weekend with some friends that were in town from southern california. They wanted something mellow and nearby thus I took them to Nectar. I have been here a few times and knew that it was probably the perfect fit for what they were looking for. The wine flights are large enough so with 3 you feel like you get your money's worth for around 14 dollars. The olives, cheese plate and pizette are all great and easy to share. Needless to say we had a nice mellow night catching up and they walked out impressed with my decision.
author: Erin R.

description: Ok, forget you are in the marina b/c everyone else there is pretending like they dont want to be in the marina either, so enjoy the greatest wine list ever! no, not the best selection of wines, but not bad either. Its the descriptions, which alone make this place worth a visit. so go, enjoy, and once you are done, then worry about the marina, but i doubt you will after a few glasses of wine
author: Rich B.

description: I much prefer Nectar to it's neighbor, California Wine Merchant.  It has a great selection of wine and a much superior atmosphere and staff to CWM.  I was there one evening around when they were closing and the bar tender poured tastes of a high quality bottle of wine that was left open for my date and I.  Great place for a date or drinks with friends.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Small plates are very creative.  Nectar is definately a fantastic wine bar with a wonderful cheese collection.  The food, the ambiance, and the service is very modern, simple and friendly.  If you're not in the mood for the A16 wait and over pricing... walk over a few blocks and check Nectar out.
author: Grace K.

description:
most enjoyable!  a friend & i visited during Nectar's 2nd anniversary party --- great crowd, superb wine, delish array of small plates and an oh-so-cleverly written menu.  the ambience is terrific; modern, comfy & chill.  very knowledgeable and gracious staff to boot!

terrific place for a nite out with friends or social dinner-date.
author: Kayse G.

description: I'm not much of a marina girl, however I did really enjoy this wine bar.  The server suggested really nice glasses of wine, which complimented our food.  I love cheese, and the cheese plate was delicious.  I love that it features fresh figs and honey.  Such a sensual plate.  If I remember correctly the owner is from Hawaii, which of course I love.
author: Sarah F.

description:
two stars...

tragic really.

this place really would have gotten higher honors if it wasn't for the craptastic service. my date and i walked in hoping to enjoy a few glasses of wine but was greeted by a very rude hostess who made sure to let us know that because we didn't have a reservation, we would only be able to sit for half an hour or until the reserved guests show.... ummm.. mmkay? we didnt see a red velvet rope outside!

we really should have turned and left, but we really wanted to sit at a nice warm place and get out of the rain... and we did a lot of just that.

sit.

and get ignored.

we had to literally grab the hostess to take our orders and serve us. and the most beautiful thing of all? the place was never crowded and there were empty tables here and there... 

wine wise, i was very satisfied and we ordered a few snacks- the olive platter is really good by the way. I don't think I will be returning to nectar which is too bad- its such a cute place to relax with a glass of good wine and some great company.

parking was a bitch- but just pay 10bucks at the wells fargo lot around the corner and youre pretty much good to go for the night =)
author: Annie L.

description: I've only been here once, but it was a very good experience.  The wine we had there was unbelievably good.  And the small plates of food were perfect.  The servers are very helpful and suggested fabulous wines based on our description of what we were looking for.  The place is pretty pricey, but it's definitely worth it if you're looking to experience some really great wine.
author: Katie J.

description: Cute wine bar, great wine selection - great date spot or just to grab a glass of wine with a friend.... but really bummed they changed their happy hour special from 50% off to 25% off.
author: Kayla P.

description:
swanky digs and not too much pretension, nectar is a good spot for a glass of wine and some nibbles.

the wine flights are a good deal and the pours are a healthy size.  three 3oz glasses for 15 bucks.  not too shabby.
author: Tony A.

description:
Randomly came here with a friend to have some girl talk on a low key Saturday night. One thing that I thought was surprising is that they also post the retail prices of the bottles along with their mark-ups - refreshingly honest, and opens your eyes to how overpriced bottles of wine can be. Anyway, we were seated immediately (with no reservations) which was really nice and the vibe was great. Cozy, buzzing with people but not overcrowded and annoyingly noisy.

Food was excellent and very shareable. Great vegetarian selection, with a good mix of flavours and textures. I was in the mood for something sweeter so I had the bubbles flight which was exactly what I was looking for. I'd definitely go back!
author: Mina R.

description:
Lovely place. 

Great wine and service. Our server was excellent--very informed about her wine. 

I really enjoyed this place. Go try it!
author: Nicole R.

description:
This place was recommended by a colleague who raved about it.  I agree the service is good, as were the wine list choices.  I particularly liked that each dish had a suggested pairing.

One HUGE disappointment was the cheese plate. . . I've never seen a smaller cheese plate.  There may have been 1 ounce of cheese total on the plate.  While I realize Nectar is all about small plates, I've been to several small plates places that have a decent cheese plate.

I probably won't go back, although the prosciutto and mozzarella panini was quite tasty!
author: Kristin L.

description: Great selection of wines, but can be tough to get a table.
author: JP D.

description: Had a "semi" private party here for about 20 people.  The nice thing was they did not force us into a $minimum (on a weekday) and I explained how much we wanted to spend per person and they suggested a menu and wine flights to meet that number.  It was perfect.  They set up a small buffet and reserved several tables for us.  Great service and very flexible with number of attendees til the last minute.  Everyone also enjoyed the food- truffle popcorn, salads, pizza, mac and cheese.
author: Jill K.

description: Lovely ambiance, great date place. I have had some wonderful wines in there and the customer service has always been attentive and they know their wine. The food is above average but its all about the wine, expert knowledge and ambiance in there. Tough to find parking but there are some local garages in the neighborhood which are some times full too.
author: lamia b.

description: I was impressed by the service, the bar tender listened to what we wanted and helped select the perfect wine for that description.  I also enjoyed the food and relaxing ambiance.
author: Sarah S.

description: Nice place, kind of cold, very chestnut streetish.  Comfy chairs though and fun flights.  Glasses are kind of expensive considering the small pours.  Nice decor.  All in all, nice place, I didn't try the food but some of it sounds interesting.
author: john s.

description: A small nice venue.  A good place to meet up before going out or to enjoy a more relaxed evening.  There were a couple tables outside and a few along the side wall, which I noticed tended to fill up first.  The wine bar was well stocked and the staff was knowledgeable and friendly.  This place is good for couples or small groups between 4-6 but I would say no more than 8.  The dishes served here are on the lighter side and the wine selection is decently priced.
author: Daniel D.

description:
oh?! i thought i had already written a review for nectar awhiles back, but i guess i hadn't ... thanks to C, it was brought to my attention since he wasn't able to find my review, so alas, here it is, my review of nectar.

***

FIIIII~~~~~~~~~NAAAAAAAAAAAAAAALLLLLLLLLL~~~~~~~~~~~YYYYYYYYYYYYY!!!

Now, this is MYYYYYYYYYYYY kind of spot. Fin~~~~~~~~~~~ally! No more ghetto wetto cheapo rowdiness to be.  Intimate, sweet, cozy, extremely chill,  and DEF a great place to come with a date.  You want to make me happy, just take me to Nectar or anywhere remotely similar! I have to say, after numerous attempts in exploring SF, I hate to say this, but this place and MatrixFillmore has to be prolly the tops for me. 

Now, THIS is WHY I LOVE SF. More lounges, and more wine selection, not that I know anything about wine.

Their interior gives out this romantic vibe, with the darkness and their 
candles... OoOOh, I LOVE IT. 

OOH, I LOVE HOW THIS IS WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE FROM ME.
I LOVE THIS PLACE... I LOVE LOVE LOVEEEEEEEEEEEEEE THIS PLACE ... =) 

don't get intimidated by the 30 some page manual ... the latter pages are simply bottles .. :) honestly, the guys who were there were slightly pretentious, but nectar's environment apparently did a faboulous job with their interior that it didn't bother me, or mebe i was in my own lil wine land to not notice .. 

I LOVE YOU NECTAR, FINALLY a PLACE THAT I CAN SERIOUSLY CALL A PLACE OF ITS OWN... =) where have you been ALL ALONG?!?!?
author: Jennifer S.

description: cute wine bar in the marina, cause thats so rare.  we had a cozy time - plety of seating and a good wine list.  our service was really just okay though.  i might go back, but honestly i dont think its any better than some other wine bars that i like a lot more.
author: Carolyn B.

description: nice little wine bar ... and i do mean little.  rather limited seating here, especially when you consider how many marina folks are probably into wine.  anyway, the selection here is decent, but the main side entertainment can be found in the menu.  the descriptions for each wine is hilarious.  well, maybe not all of them, but i do wonder who goes for the wines reminiscent of "stinky feet" or of "pencil lead and cigar smoke."  and oh the "taste"-sized glasses are still really good sizes.  service was definitely lacking though.
author: spiff e.

description: Semi-swank wine bar in Hoboken (aka the Marina). Their descriptions of the wines is fabulous.  The list is long, but not overbearing.  The soft sofa seats are good for one on one. They also have a small bar and tables in the back for groups of 4-6.  Try the portobello mushroom and artisan cheese dishes. The dishes are small (which enables you to save more room for wine).  An added bonus -- they change the art work out often so the space has a different look and feel each time you are there.
author: kimberly t.

description: Never had a bad experience.  Wine selection is extensive (as a wine bar should be), many descriptions are quite witty, all food items have a wine paring suggestion.  Staff seems very knowledgeable about all their selections without being snobby.  Service can be slow, but I think that is more for you to be able to enjoy the wine without feeling rushed.  They are happy to help when you get them to your table.
author: Erin W.

description: Overrated, overpriced and attitude.  And what's with the chairs along the wall across from the bar.  It's not set up very well, that's for sure.   You're better off at The Wine Merchant or Bin 38.
author: Brian L.

description: I absolutely fell in love with Nectar the first time I went there. I love the decor, I love the menu, and I love the wine. I have been back a couple times since, and it has been great. Once I went with an out-of-town guest on a random weekday, and we were the only ones in the lounge, which was fine by me. I love their wine flights because they let you taste different wines that you definitely wouldn't be able to otherwise. Another cool feature is they allow you to buy "to-go" bottles of wine for market cost, so if you taste something you like, you don't have to pay double for it to buy it from Nectar. Plus, if you're hungry, they have a great food menu to snack on. Sadly, this place is a little out of my poor-grad-student budget, so I can't go to it as often as I'd like. It is in the Marina, so I wouldn't expect it to be cheap, but still... it can't be 5 stars for me unless it's amazing AND worth every penny. But Nectar is definitely 4.5 stars in my book.
author: Bridgette A.

description: My one and only experience here to date was after a lovely long day at ZAP.  Yes, I hit a wine lounge after tasting wine all day.  That sadly meant, I was not incredibly tempted by the wine list, however, I felt compelled to review the spot in any case as I felt the wine list was fantastic with generous taste portions, ability to make your own flight, and oh, people who really know the wine they are serving.  Kind of key for a wine lounge!  I love the notion of a tapas dinner, and by the same token, there are times I like the same notion for my wines, so I can't wait to come back and really give that a go here. The wine descriptions are fun to read - very creative.  The staff is great.  There was a very charming guy behind the bar who had to contend with one of the other ZAPers who had not ensured through the day as well as my friend and I had.  The 'bartender' for lack of a better word (but there must be one, right?  it is too early and I am uncaffeinated, so I can't pull that term up right now!) was so gracious with this very intoxicated guy who really was just looking for a spot to eat his deli sandwich he brought in while he tried to order some wine.  The bartender tried to help him figure out what he really wanted without any success.  Throughout the whole time (and mind you, my friend and I were both a bit concerned this guy who drunkenly had sat at the bar next to our table and could have easily fallen off the comfy, backless bar "cube" chairs -- and likely would have 86'ed this guys if it were up to us) the bartender was very kind and never escalated the situation.  Onward -- the food menu was also very pleasing -- we had a few post wine tasting snacks and were quite happy with our choices.  Very tasty and paired with wine well.
author: Danielle R.

description: This is the best place ever...I love the way they describe their wines, it's like the J. Peterman's of wine...not an urban sombrero to be found here though....just decadent wines and a staff of knowledgeable folks who listen to your likes and dislikes and suggest wines that you can't even believe exist....and did I mention the food??? Well, it's fresh and delicious.  And happy hour is half off during the week.  They also sell wine at retail prices to take with you.  That's just plain dangerous.  Love this place. LOVE IT.
author: H. E.

description: there wasn't really anything extraordinary about this place. i went on a weeknight with a small group of friends. it does feel more like a restaurant than a bustling, lively wine bar. the menu consisted of some tasty small plates, snacks, and bites. extensive list of wines by the glass, but unfortunately due to my growling stomach, i could only try one. service was quite sketchy. we were served appetizers without plates and by the time the waitress came back around, the large plates were out. while i understand that each dish may only consist of 3 pieces, i'd still prefer a plate to eat off of.
author: helen l.

description: Ok, so now that I have been to Nectar several times, I wanted to update my review. Best night to go: Tuesdays. Every Tuesday from 6-9 a different winery hosts a tasting for about $20/person. If you have been to Nectar before, you would agree that they give generous tasting portions there, and $20 for about 2 glasses (4 tastings) of wine is a pretty good deal! Not only do they have this great special on Tuesdays, but I have tried several of their other dishes which have been pretty good...the short rib, gnocchi, and the soufflés are some of my favorites. The gem of this place is Alex, he serves the wine at the bar and he is very knowledgeable and personable. I am still very new to drinking wine and whenever my boyfriend and I ask him questions he always has great answers and teaches us so much about the wine. This is probably one of my favorite local places to visit in the marina...i love that it is also 4 blocks from home! We really enjoy coming here and will be back again soon!
author: Michelle N.

description: Nectar is such a good time out. The wines are excellent and affordable. I even like their cheese plates! Generally not crowded or loud (unlike the Wine Merchant place around the corner). Very comfortable seating arrangements with an intimate and cozy feeling. Love watching single thirty-something women's head swivel when any man walks through the door. Perfect for a pre-date drink or to unwind after work.
author: Mama L.

description: Duh, how have I not reviewed this place after being there so often.  The staff know their wines and I love that. I love bubbles so when I see a flight on the menu I'm thrilled.  The food has never let me down and it's just a great spot.
author: Misti L.

description: this is definitely one of my fave places in the city.  fun apps and flights.  i just don't recommend playing credit card roulette here...
author: Amy K.

description: All in all the food is what saves this place, because with so much wine bar competition in San Francisco these days, Nectar's wine selection was merely competent, the prices were tolerable, but not great, the service was quick, but the girl had the personality of a roof shingle, the flights were fairly prosaic, my date even commented that virtually every wine on the flight list she had recently seen at numerous by the glass restaurants and wine bars, in fact the Cazar Syrah was also being poured one block away at the lively California Wine Merchant. I do think it's a great wine, but once again, at Nectar's prices they need to do something to separate themselves from the pack. Still, we both enjoyed a really fantastic bottle of Grant Burge, an Australian Rhone blend and both thought that the food was certainly terrific. The Arctic Char was killer, the cheeks were perfectly done and the Tortellini was also fantastic. The space is bit weird, kinda feels like your in an abandoned museum, and there is no real bar scene here by any means, so more of a date spot. So, Nectar was OK, and in San Francisco, I'm not sure  just OK is enough to make me go back, because honestly I prefer District's imaginative wine selections, chic food and ambiance, or the bustling noise, rare California Pinot's by the glass and late night bar scene of the California Wine Merchant
author: Steve l.

description: I have had great nights at Nectar, drinking wine with friends.  And, I have had experiences there when it wasn't crowded at all, and I got zero attention from the person behind the bar.  So somewhat spotty on the service front at times.  But great, interesting wines, and really nice atmosphere.
author: B J.

description: the great thing about nectar besides the great ambiance and art on the walls, is that this is a wine bar with a serious up and coming chef in the kitchen.  when i went, the kitchen just switched over to their summer menu, and for a crew serving up a new menu, the quality of the food and attention to detail was tremendous.  we were guests of chef armando (remember his name because he will be one to follow thru the years to come) and we nearly had every item on the menu.  what chef armando has done is create a menu that  truly marries the flavors of the east with a french sensibility.  the dishes are complex without being overbearing and confusing, sophisticated without being haughty , and artfully presented without being fussy.  chef armando's strengths is his attention to mouth textures and how he draws out the subtleties in all his ingrediants as well as the flavors in the superb wine pairings.  one of the most delightfully satisfying dishes was the spinach and wild mushroom gruyere custard.  its a steamed egg custard so rich yet so light, one is reminded of foie gras.... the perfect dish for a summer evening.... rich, mouth satisfying, yet light and clean.  his flavors are subtle, but not bland.  if anything is lacking, its in his heartier meat dishes, which could use a more robust treatment.  the fried dishes (such as the soft shell crabs, potato cake, and duck breast cocooned in crisped rice noodles) were a little too heavy in the fried department, esp. with the duck which got trumped by the oil and starch in the crisped rice noodles.  the triple cream (cow, goat, and sheep) cheese is oh so groaningly mouthy good as is the secret-spice-infused chocolate lava cake (try it... can you name the secret spice?).  after eating there, i felt like i had gone through a tasting menu at masas..... and i had to remind myself.... this..... at a wine bar?!  yes.... go there for some of their wine flights, but this wine bar is packing a hot kitchen with a hot up and coming chef
author: Curtis Y.

description:
sure, the wine list looks great, the flights are creative and affordable.... 
but the hostess practically corked the wine with her nasty attitude. when we walked in, she totally gave my sister the once-over, that "checking you out in a bitchy way" stare, even though we were coming with a decent sized party (read: high bill) and the lounge was totally empty. In fact, she was so terrible that I was tempted to ask for the manager just to explain that we were so disappointed. it was like she was actively trying to be mean to us! She almost wouldn't seat us in the back, even though it was empty. Her question was, "well, are you sure that there are people coming? because i don't want to put you at a big table if they're not going to show. *sneer*" (our friends were politely waiting outside so as not to crowd the patrons sitting in the front of the restaurant). My mom was in from out of town, and we had guests visiting from abroad, and it was so embarrassing that she was so unwelcoming in a place that I had talked up. Nectar is supposed to be a classy place. Bad service, slow service, little errors, forgotten orders... that I can handle. It's a restaurant, people are busy and things are bound to get mixed up. But meanness?? Are you serious? Epic fail.
Needless to say, I would never go back here. And, if you are bringing someone with you, you might want to test the waters first alone. I would hate for others to have a similar experience; thankfully that block of Steiner Street has other place to go-- where the hosts are welcoming and, believe it or not, where people are still nice.
author: Christine M.

description: i really like this place. i went here with a girlfriend after dinner at mamacita's. its cozy and its quiet so it's easy to talk to the person you're with. i think we must have walked in on date night because we were the only non-couples there. great wine selection and vibe. i would go back here - date or no date.
author: Miss O.

description: What a disappointment! I wanted to throw my friend a surprise party, and chose Nectar Wine Lounge. I booked the party with the owner, Chris, and was never told about minimums, or emailed/faxed a contract to review. When the party arrived, we were waited on by a server named Shree. Having been a server in the service industry myself, I can tell you that HANDS DOWN Shree was the WORST server I've ever had. In fact, she was downright mean to the guests, got angry with me about "minimums" I'd never been told about in front of the guest of honor without pulling me aside to discuss (even though we had enough to eat/drink to surpass her "minimums" of $40/$50 dollars per person), we waited at least 20 minutes for every request - from more wine to simply asking for a menu, she overpoured the champagne I had pre-ordered (up to the rim!) and she never once smiled or asked us if we needed anything. Basically, Shree ruined the vibe of the party. We finally packed up and left to go somewhere else because we were tired of Shree's unacceptable attitude and waiting for our requests to be met. When I called Chris to discuss her absolute disregard for our table, he told me that he had a hard time believing me, and said only that the issue would be 'addressed'. Our party spent almost $500 dollars - with a 20% tip that was automatically added for the size of our party (8 people) and it honestly made me SICK to give that 20% to someone whose service was beyond sub-par. Thank god I was with friends and not clients - if I had been entertaining for business I would have been appalled. Nectar has not only lost my business, but the business of every person at that party. Again - what a disappointment!!
author: Sarah B.
